original: gsum man chad dge 'dun du ma langs pa ni nyes byas te gang zag gcig la mthol /
analyzed: gsum man chad dge 'dun du ma langs pa ni nyes byas te gang zag gcig la mthol /
translated: If the nun is not a member of the Sangha, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The place where the patron prepares the food is any of the three: the temple of the Sangha, the open space of the monastery, or the patron’s house.🔽If the nun has prepared the food, she commits a serious offense.🔽If the patron has understood the nun’s hint, then the nun has committed an offense entailing expulsion.

original: rigs su'o // sbyin bdag gis zas sbyar ba'i gnas ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du zan sbyar ba dang dgon pa'i thang la sbyar ba dang khyim bdag nyid kyi khyim du spyan drangs pa dang 'di rnams gsum gang yang rung ste dge slong mas bshams na mthol bar 'gyur🔽/ de ste des tshig gi mtshams rnyed na rtsa ba'o //🔽zan za ba'i tshe dge slong mas bshams te 'di gsol zhes zer ba la sogs pa'i tshig thos na mthol bar 'gyur ro //🔽de ste ma yin na nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs su'o // sbyin bdag gis zas sbyar ba'i gnas ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du zan sbyar ba dang dgon pa'i thang la sbyar ba dang khyim bdag nyid kyi khyim du spyan drangs pa dang 'di rnams gsum gang yang rung ste dge slong mas bshams na mthol bar 'gyur / de ste des tshig gi mtshams rnyed na rtsa ba'o // zan za ba'i tshe dge slong mas bshams te 'di gsol zhes zer ba la sogs pa'i tshig thos na mthol bar 'gyur ro // de ste ma yin na nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If the patron has not understood the nun’s hint, then the nun has committed an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If the patron has understood the nun’s hint, but the patron has not said anything, then the nun has committed an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If the patron has understood the nun’s hint, and has said something, but the patron has not done anything, then the nun has committed an offense of wrong conduct.

original: zan za ba la khang dmigs so so na 'khod de khang pa mig gcig na 'khod pa'i rnams shom pa'i tshig ma thos pa ni mthol ba'i nyes byas so //🔽'bring der bsgo ba spyad na'o //
analyzed: zan za ba la khang dmigs so so na 'khod de khang pa mig gcig na 'khod pa'i rnams shom pa'i tshig ma thos pa ni mthol ba'i nyes byas so //🔽'bring der bsgo ba spyad na'o //
translated: If the patron has understood the nun’s hint, and has said something, and has done something, but has not completed the task, then the nun has committed an offense entailing suspension.🔽If the patron has understood the nun’s hint, and has said something, and has done something, and has completed the task, then the nun has committed an offense entailing expulsion.

original: snga nas dge slong ma sham shing 'dug pa thos te shes bzhin du za ba'i tshe dge slong mas shom pa'i tshig zer ba la dge slong grogs kyis ma shom shig ces bsgo ba'i tshig ma thos pa ni mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga nas dge slong ma sham shing 'dug pa thos te shes bzhin du za ba'i tshe dge slong mas shom pa'i tshig zer ba la dge slong grogs kyis ma shom shig ces bsgo ba'i tshig ma thos pa ni mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk hears that a nun is preparing food beforehand, and he eats knowing that, and at the time when the monk friend says, “Do not prepare it,” if he does not hear the words, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.🔽Therefore, you must make an effort to write it down.

original: de bas na 'bri ba'i phyir nan tan gyis shig / mdo ltag ma ltar shom par shes te dge slong grogs kyis bsgo ba'i tshig ma thos pa'i dge slong des zan zos zin na grogs po rnams dge slong ma zhig shom zhing 'dug ces zer na khyod kyis
analyzed: de bas na 'bri ba'i phyir nan tan gyis shig / mdo ltag ma ltar shom par shes te dge slong grogs kyis bsgo ba'i tshig ma thos pa'i dge slong des zan zos zin na grogs po rnams dge slong ma zhig shom zhing 'dug ces zer na khyod kyis
translated: If a monk who does not hear the words of the monk friend, knowing that a nun is preparing food as in the previous case, eats, and if his monk friend says, “A nun is preparing food,”

original: slar bsgo'am zhes dris shig bsgo'o zhes zer ba thos na mthol bar mi 'gyur te nyes med do //🔽rgan pos der ma zhugs na gsar bus zhugs shig / zan za ba'i tshe dge slong ma shom @185a * //
analyzed: slar bsgo'am zhes dris shig bsgo'o zhes zer ba thos na mthol bar mi 'gyur te nyes med do // rgan pos der ma zhugs na gsar bus zhugs shig / zan za ba'i tshe dge slong ma shom @185a * //
translated: if he asks, “Did you tell her to stop?” and if he hears the reply, “I told her,” he does not commit an offense entailing acknowledgment.🔽If an elder does not enter, a junior should enter.

original: zhing 'dug pa la ma shom shig ces slar bsgo ba ni gral thog ma na 'dug pas bsgo'o //
analyzed: zhing 'dug pa la ma shom shig ces slar bsgo ba ni gral thog ma na 'dug pas bsgo'o //
translated: When eating, if a nun is preparing food, if he tells her to stop, “Do not prepare it,” he should tell her to stop while sitting in the first row.

original: thog ma pas bsgo na 'og na 'khod pas rim bzhin du bsgo'o //
analyzed: thog ma pas bsgo na 'og na 'khod pas rim bzhin du bsgo'o //
translated: If the first one is not able to do so, then the one below him should do it in order.

original: gral mi mnyam par spras pa ma bzlog bar zos pa ste so sor mthol ba gnyis so //
analyzed: gral mi mnyam par spras pa ma bzlog bar zos pa ste so sor mthol ba gnyis so //
translated: There are two offenses for eating without having confessed: not having corrected the uneven seating arrangement and not having confessed.

original: dge slong ma khyim pas spyan drangs pa'i zan la shom pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong ma khyim pas spyan drangs pa'i zan la shom pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall for eating food prepared by a nun who has invited the Saṅgha is complete when the food is prepared.

original: // / slob pa'i so sor mthol ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / slob pa'i so sor mthol ba la 'chad de /
translated: The individual confession for a trainee is explained as follows.🔽If the trainee is poor and lacks the means to give alms, then he should observe the following rules:

original: de ste dad pa la sbyin pas phongs na rigs su slob pa'i khrims chos shig / dge bsnyen dad pa che ste dkon mchog dang dge 'dun la yon dbul zhing sbyin gtong byed byed pas dbul phongs par 'gyur na yon bdag de'i khyim du spyan drangs kyang rung
analyzed: de ste dad pa la sbyin pas phongs na rigs su slob pa'i khrims chos shig / dge bsnyen dad pa che ste dkon mchog dang dge 'dun la yon dbul zhing sbyin gtong byed byed pas dbul phongs par 'gyur na yon bdag de'i khyim du spyan drangs kyang rung
translated: If a layperson has great faith and is giving offerings to the Three Jewels and the Saṅgha, but is becoming poor because of this, then even if he invites the Saṅgha to his house,

original: dge 'dun mi 'dong zhing nor rdzas mi blang bar 'og khrims chos shig / zhu bas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun mi 'dong zhing nor rdzas mi blang bar 'og khrims chos shig / zhu bas so //
translated: the Saṅgha should not go and should not accept his wealth.🔽The rules should be observed as requested.🔽The rules are to be observed according to the Vinaya.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar 'og khrims bca' ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bca'o //🔽kha phyir dgrol ba'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar 'og khrims bca' ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bca'o //🔽kha phyir dgrol ba'o //
translated: The rules are to be observed according to the sūtras.🔽The rules are to be observed according to the Abhidharma.🔽The rules are to be observed according to the Vinaya and the sūtras.🔽The rules are to be observed according to the Vinaya and the Abhidharma.🔽The rules are to be observed according to the sūtras and the Abhidharma.🔽The rules are to be observed according to the Vinaya, the sūtras, and the Abhidharma.

original: 'og khrims bcas pa las slar dgrol na yang gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis dgrol lo //🔽byin pa de'i sems shes par bya ste khyim du 'gro ba dang stan la spyad pa dang chos bshad pa byos shig / dge bsnyen dbul por gyur pa de'i khyim du dge 'dun mi 'dod par byas pa dang nor zang na dge 'dun 'di gang yang 'ong du'ang
analyzed: 'og khrims bcas pa las slar dgrol na yang gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis dgrol lo // byin pa de'i sems shes par bya ste khyim du 'gro ba dang stan la spyad pa dang chos bshad pa byos shig / dge bsnyen dbul por gyur pa de'i khyim du dge 'dun mi 'dod par byas pa dang nor zang na dge 'dun 'di gang yang 'ong du'ang
translated: If the penalty is lifted, it is lifted by a legal procedure of asking and informing.🔽The mind of the donor should be known. Go to his house, use his seat, and teach the Dharma.🔽If the house of the poor lay follower is not desired by the Saṅgha, and if he has no wealth, then even if the Saṅgha is not able to come, it is appropriate to go to the house of that lay follower and teach the Dharma, even if there is no food.

original: mi btub na zas med kyang chos bshad cing 'ong ba'i rigs na zhes mi dga' ba'i phyir dge bsnyen de'i khyim du 'gro zhing stan dag la yang spyad chos bshad pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: mi btub na zas med kyang chos bshad cing 'ong ba'i rigs na zhes mi dga' ba'i phyir dge bsnyen de'i khyim du 'gro zhing stan dag la yang spyad chos bshad pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Therefore, go to the house of that lay follower, use his seat, and teach the Dharma.

original: lhung bzed stong pas gsob tu ma 'jug cig / dge bsnyen de'i khyim du 'gro ba'i tshe sngon lhung bzed bkang zhing sbyin sbyin nang lhung bzed stong par song ngo zhes mya ngan ldang pa'i phyir lhung bzed stong par mi bskur bskur dgos na'ang gzhan nas bslangs te🔽bkang la bskur ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed stong pas gsob tu ma 'jug cig / dge bsnyen de'i khyim du 'gro ba'i tshe sngon lhung bzed bkang zhing sbyin sbyin nang lhung bzed stong par song ngo zhes mya ngan ldang pa'i phyir lhung bzed stong par mi bskur bskur dgos na'ang gzhan nas bslangs te bkang la bskur ro //
translated: If you must send an empty begging bowl, fill it from another source.🔽Give it to him.

original: de la byin cig / slong ba'i byis pa dag bsod snyoms las khur ba rangs ba ma yin la sbyin /
analyzed: de la byin cig / slong ba'i byis pa dag bsod snyoms las khur ba rangs ba ma yin la sbyin /
translated: The children who beg are not satisfied with alms.🔽Fill the begging bowl with food and carry it.🔽The lay brother's children will beg for it.

original: lhung bzed zan gyis bkang ste khyer ba la dge bsnyen de'i byis ba dag bslangs nas khur ba la sogs pa phrul de dum bu dum bur byas la sbyin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed zan gyis bkang ste khyer ba la dge bsnyen de'i byis ba dag bslangs nas khur ba la sogs pa phrul de dum bu dum bur byas la sbyin no //
translated: Take the food and so forth, tear it into pieces, and give it to them.

original: rangs par byin na byis pa'i lag pa na khyer te grong du 'phyan du dong nas mur 'dug khyim tshes na re sngon na dge bsnyen des dge slong la zan spyin pa yin na da ni 'di ltar dge slong la slong zhing za'o zhes 'phya ba'i @185b phyir
analyzed: rangs par byin na byis pa'i lag pa na khyer te grong du 'phyan du dong nas mur 'dug khyim tshes na re sngon na dge bsnyen des dge slong la zan spyin pa yin na da ni 'di ltar dge slong la slong zhing za'o zhes 'phya ba'i @185b phyir
translated: If he gives it to them, they will carry it in their hands and go wandering through the village. If they stay in a house, they will say, “In the past, this lay vow holder gave food to the monks, but now he begs and eats like this.”

original: khur ba rangs par mi sbyin /
analyzed: khur ba rangs par mi sbyin /
translated: Therefore, do not give the food to them.

original: dgos na phyis dgrol /
analyzed: dgos na phyis dgrol /
translated: If necessary, give it to them later.

original: dge bsnyen dbul por gyur pa de slar phyug par gyur te dge 'dun la spyan 'dren cing gsol na mi bslang bar 'og khrims bcas pa slar dgrol zhing bshig ste 'dong ngo //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dbul por gyur pa de slar phyug par gyur te dge 'dun la spyan 'dren cing gsol na mi bslang bar 'og khrims bcas pa slar dgrol zhing bshig ste 'dong ngo //
translated: If that poor lay vow holder becomes rich again and invites the Saṅgha, he should not be refused. The previously established rule should be lifted and he should be allowed to go.

original: slob pa'i khrims bcas par slar dgrol zhing bshig ste 'dod ngo //
analyzed: slob pa'i khrims bcas par slar dgrol zhing bshig ste 'dod ngo //
translated: If a rule is established for a trainee, it should be lifted and he should be allowed to go.

original: slob pa'i khrims bcas pa'i rigs su sngar ma thos par bza' ba dang bca' ba blangs na ma gtogs pa ni ga gon dang rtsa ba dang sngon po ma phongs pa la zos na'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i khrims bcas pa'i rigs su sngar ma thos par bza' ba dang bca' ba blangs na ma gtogs pa ni ga gon dang rtsa ba dang sngon po ma phongs pa la zos na'o //
translated: If a rule is established for a trainee, he should not eat roots, stalks, leaves, flowers, and fruits that he has not previously heard of, except for what he has received.

original: dge bsnyen dbul po'i khyim du mi 'dod par 'og khrims bcas pa las der dong zhing nor rdzas blangs sam zos na so sor mthol ba'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dbul po'i khyim du mi 'dod par 'og khrims bcas pa las der dong zhing nor rdzas blangs sam zos na so sor mthol ba'o //
translated: If one goes to the house of a poor lay practitioner and, without being invited, sits on a seat or takes and eats food that was not given, one confesses each of those.

original: nyes med pa ni 'og khrims ma bcas pa'i mdun du spyan drangs pa la 'og khrims bcas pa'i 'og tu zan zar 'dod pa dang ga gon dang rtsa ba dang lo ma dag phongs shing gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i zas zos pa nyes med do //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni 'og khrims ma bcas pa'i mdun du spyan drangs pa la 'og khrims bcas pa'i 'og tu zan zar 'dod pa dang ga gon dang rtsa ba dang lo ma dag phongs shing gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i zas zos pa nyes med do //
translated: If one is not at fault, one is invited in front of those who have not made the lower rule. If one wishes to eat food after the lower rule has been made, or if one eats food that is not harmful and does not cause hardship, such as garlic, roots, and leaves, one is not at fault.

original: rigs su bslab pa las 'gal bar 'jug pa ste so sor mthol ba gsum mo //
analyzed: rigs su bslab pa las 'gal bar 'jug pa ste so sor mthol ba gsum mo //
translated: One engages in what is contrary to the training in a family. There are three confessions.

original: dge bsnyen dbul por gyur pa la de'i khyim du mi 'dod par khrims bcas pa las song ste zan zos na so sor mthol ba ste rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge bsnyen dbul por gyur pa la de'i khyim du mi 'dod par khrims bcas pa las song ste zan zos na so sor mthol ba ste rdzogs so /
translated: If one goes to the house of a poor lay practitioner and, without being invited, sits on a seat or takes and eats food that was not given, one confesses each of those.

original: // / dbye ba'i so sor mthol pa la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / dbye ba'i so sor mthol pa la 'chad de /
translated: The confession of schism is explained.

original: nags nyul ba'i dge slong skos shig / dge slong phal mo che dgon pa ni gnas na rkun po dang mi rgod la sogs pa yod dam med brtag pa'i phyir nyul zhing bya ra byed pa dge slong la bsgo shig / dpag tshad phyed kyi kho ra khor
analyzed: nags nyul ba'i dge slong skos shig / dge slong phal mo che dgon pa ni gnas na rkun po dang mi rgod la sogs pa yod dam med brtag pa'i phyir nyul zhing bya ra byed pa dge slong la bsgo shig / dpag tshad phyed kyi kho ra khor
translated: Appoint a monk to inspect the forest to see whether or not there are thieves, wild men, and so forth in the forest where the majority of monks are staying.

original: yug tu des rtogs shig / nyul zhing bya ra byed par bskos pa'i dge slong des gang gis dpag tshad phyed kho ra khor yug tu nyul zhing rtogs shig /'jigs pa dang bcas na du ba gyis shig / nyul nas mi rgod dam /
analyzed: yug tu des rtogs shig / nyul zhing bya ra byed par bskos pa'i dge slong des gang gis dpag tshad phyed kho ra khor yug tu nyul zhing rtogs shig /'jigs pa dang bcas na du ba gyis shig / nyul nas mi rgod dam /
translated: That monk should inspect and investigate the area within a half league.🔽If there is danger, he should signal with smoke.

original: rkun po yod na grogs po dag la go bar bya ba'i phyir du brda bya mi mang du yod pa ltar bya zhing bsdigs bar bya ba'i phyir shing gi kha ras kyi ba dan btags la bsgreng ste mthong bar bya /
analyzed: rkun po yod na grogs po dag la go bar bya ba'i phyir du brda bya mi mang du yod pa ltar bya zhing bsdigs bar bya ba'i phyir shing gi kha ras kyi ba dan btags la bsgreng ste mthong bar bya /
translated: The monk appointed to inspect and investigate the area should inspect and investigate the area within a half league. If there is danger, he should signal with smoke to inform his companions.🔽He should also raise a flag to warn them.

original: ba dan kyang sgrengs shig /
analyzed: ba dan kyang sgrengs shig /
translated: He should also raise a flag.

original: grogs mi 'ong ba /
analyzed: grogs mi 'ong ba /
translated: If his companions do not come,

original: lam mi shes pa'i phyir rtsva'i lo ma lam du bor ba la mtshon gyis brnga bya /
analyzed: lam mi shes pa'i phyir rtsva'i lo ma lam du bor ba la mtshon gyis brnga bya /
translated: Because of not knowing the path, one should cut grass with a weapon on the path where grass blades are scattered.

original: mi mang du nyal nyal ba ltar rtsva mang du bting ba la'ang bya /
analyzed: mi mang du nyal nyal ba ltar rtsva mang du bting ba la'ang bya /
translated: One should also do that to the many grasses spread out like many people sleeping.

original: lo mi phung po dag lam du khrom shig / mdo 'di'i ti ka ni gong ma la 'dug pa yin no //🔽gong ma'i ti ka ni gong ma'i steng du 'dug pa'i mjug las @186a * //
analyzed: lo mi phung po dag lam du khrom shig / mdo 'di'i ti ka ni gong ma la 'dug pa yin no // gong ma'i ti ka ni gong ma'i steng du 'dug pa'i mjug las @186a * //
translated: One should scatter the heaps of leaves on the path. The tika of this sutra is above.

original: 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chad pa yin no //
translated: The tika of the above is explained at the end of what is above.

original: der dgos pa yod na snga dro'i zas sbyin /
analyzed: der dgos pa yod na snga dro'i zas sbyin /
translated: If there is a need there, one should give morning food.

original: nags nyul ba'i dge slong du bsngos pa'i rnams las che zhing nyon mongs pa'i phyir g-yar sus byin la dgye /
analyzed: nags nyul ba'i dge slong du bsngos pa'i rnams las che zhing nyon mongs pa'i phyir g-yar sus byin la dgye /
translated: Because of being large and afflicted among those dedicated to being forest-dwelling monks, one should give a vow to a monk.

original: grogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: grogs kyang ngo //
translated: Also friends.

original: nags nyul ba'i dge slong 'jigs na grogs kyang sbyin te de'ang g-yar sus sbyin /
analyzed: nags nyul ba'i dge slong 'jigs na grogs kyang sbyin te de'ang g-yar sus sbyin /
translated: If a forest-dwelling monk is afraid, one should also give friends. Also, one should give a vow to a monk.🔽Abhid

original: 'bhrid / mi rgod dang rkun po yod de 'jigs par shes bzhin pa las mthol bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / nags su ma nyul na'o //
analyzed: 'bhrid / mi rgod dang rkun po yod de 'jigs par shes bzhin pa las mthol bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / nags su ma nyul na'o //
translated: If one knows that there are wild men and thieves and is afraid, one should confess. One part. If one does not search in the forest.

original: nyul bar bskos pa'i dge slong gis 'jigs par shes bzhin du ma nyul na mthol bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / nags su ra ba'i phyi rol du bza' ba dang bca' ba blangs te zos na'o //
analyzed: nyul bar bskos pa'i dge slong gis 'jigs par shes bzhin du ma nyul na mthol bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / nags su ra ba'i phyi rol du bza' ba dang bca' ba blangs te zos na'o //
translated: If a monk appointed to inspect the forest does not inspect it out of fear, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If a monk appointed to inspect the forest takes food and eats it outside the forest boundary, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: nags nyul ba'i dge slong gis gnas ma nyul ba'i dgon pa'i mtshams gcad pa'i phyi rol tu zan blangs shing zos na mthol bar 'gyur te yan lag 'di gsum dang ldan na so sor mthol ba'o //
analyzed: nags nyul ba'i dge slong gis gnas ma nyul ba'i dgon pa'i mtshams gcad pa'i phyi rol tu zan blangs shing zos na mthol bar 'gyur te yan lag 'di gsum dang ldan na so sor mthol ba'o //
translated: If a monk appointed to inspect the forest does not inspect the monastery boundary and takes food outside the forest boundary, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: bsrungs te bsrubs na phyed du byed do //
analyzed: bsrungs te bsrubs na phyed du byed do //
translated: If he guards it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nags nyul du bskos pa'i dge slong kha cig zan za zhing 'khod pa la kha cig nyul du bkye par 'jigs par shes bzhin du grogs zan za ba la bsrung du bcug na mthol ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nags nyul du bskos pa'i dge slong kha cig zan za zhing 'khod pa la kha cig nyul du bkye par 'jigs par shes bzhin du grogs zan za ba la bsrung du bcug na mthol ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk appointed to inspect the forest, knowing that some monks are eating food, tells his companions to guard the food out of fear of being sent to inspect the forest, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'jigs pa'i gnas las gzhan du zhugs na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i gnas las gzhan du zhugs na yang ngo //
translated: If he goes to a place other than the dangerous place,

original: nags nyul ba'i dge slong de dag gis zan khyer te mi 'jigs pa'i phyogs kyis lkog dben pa gzhan du dong nas zos na nyes byas /
analyzed: nags nyul ba'i dge slong de dag gis zan khyer te mi 'jigs pa'i phyogs kyis lkog dben pa gzhan du dong nas zos na nyes byas /
translated: If the forest-ranging monks go to another secluded place and eat the food they brought, it is a minor infraction.

original: nags brtag par rtogs pa ste so sor mthol ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: nags brtag par rtogs pa ste so sor mthol ba bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four individual confessions.

original: nags nyul du bskos pa las nags ma nyul bar lam du zan zos pa'i mthol ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: nags nyul du bskos pa las nags ma nyul bar lam du zan zos pa'i mthol ba rdzogs so //
translated: The confession for not ranging the forest when appointed to do so is finished.

original: so sor mthol ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: so sor mthol ba rdzogs so /
translated: The individual confessions are finished.

original: // / 'di man chad mang po bslab pa la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / 'di man chad mang po bslab pa la 'chad de /
translated: From here on, the text explains the many precepts.

original: de ltar sham thabs bgo ba ji lta bur zlum po'i dbyibs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sham thabs bgo ba ji lta bur zlum po'i dbyibs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The lower robe should be worn in such a way that it forms a round shape.

original: sham thabs kha thur du blta ba ya yo dang ring thung ma khyer bar zlum por bgo'o //

original: cha sna ltar mi dpyang /

analyzed: sham thabs kyi mtha' cha ga ya gcig bal glang gi sna ltar mi dpyang /

analyzed: mi stod / sham thabs kyi kha yar lta ba lte ba las mi stod /

original: lhug lhug pos mi bzlogs /

analyzed: de bzhin du chos gos bgos te ji ltar 'di snga ma gsum du 'gyur ba ltar ro //

translated: The four below are going to the door at night, going on the road during the day, crossing water, and going outside the boundaries during the day. If there is no nun companion, it becomes a remainder.

original: sum cha ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sum cha ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for one third.

original: dge slong ma zhig grogs su khrid de ltag tu smos pa bzhi las gang yang rung //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhig grogs su khrid de ltag tu smos pa bzhi las gang yang rung //
translated: A nun should be taken as a companion.

original: grogs su khrid na sum cha ma tshang ba'i phyir nyes byas so //
analyzed: grogs su khrid na sum cha ma tshang ba'i phyir nyes byas so //
translated: If one goes with a female novice as a companion, it is a fault because one-third is missing.

original: dge slob ma'o //
analyzed: dge slob ma'o //
translated: A female novice.

original: mdo lhag ma ltar sum cha ma tshang ste nyes byas su 'gyur ba ni dge slob ma ngang 'grogs shing khrid pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo lhag ma ltar sum cha ma tshang ste nyes byas su 'gyur ba ni dge slob ma ngang 'grogs shing khrid pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: As in the remaining sutras, if one-third is missing, it becomes a fault. It occurs from going with a female novice as a companion.

original: sum cha ni dge sbyong ma'o //
analyzed: sum cha ni dge sbyong ma'o //
translated: One-third is a female probationer.

original: dag sbyong ma grogs su khrid pa ni sum gnyis ma tshang ba'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag sbyong ma grogs su khrid pa ni sum gnyis ma tshang ba'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one goes with a female probationer as a companion, it becomes a serious violation because two-thirds are missing.

original: nyes med pa ni mi 'dod de bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni mi 'dod de bral ba'o //
translated: There is no fault if one does not wish to go but is forced to go.

original: dge slong ma grogs su khrid de 'gro ba las grogs mo de bros sam shi 'am khyim par babs sam rkun pos khyer na bdag gcig pu lus pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma grogs su khrid de 'gro ba las grogs mo de bros sam shi 'am khyim par babs sam rkun pos khyer na bdag gcig pu lus pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If a female novice runs away, dies, becomes a layperson, or is carried off by thieves while one is going with a female novice as a companion, there is no fault if one is left alone.

original: bar chad du 'gro ba'i dbang gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: bar chad du 'gro ba'i dbang gis kyang ngo //
translated: Also, if one is forced to go by obstacles.

original: grogs su khrid khrid pa'i dge slong ma de la zhang blon nam yul dpon lta bus rtse ba'i rkyen cig yod de tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang srog la dma' ba tsam gyi tshong na grogs mo slar song ste dge slong ma gcig pu lus kyang nyes🔽med do // sbyor ba bzhin du tha ma'i dus su rtog pa tshun chad du'o //🔽nub mo phyi rol du song ste lhag mar 'gyur ba'i tshad ni nam sum cha zad kyi bar du ni nyes byas /
analyzed: grogs su khrid khrid pa'i dge slong ma de la zhang blon nam yul dpon lta bus rtse ba'i rkyen cig yod de tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang srog la dma' ba tsam gyi tshong na grogs mo slar song ste dge slong ma gcig pu lus kyang nyes med do // sbyor ba bzhin du tha ma'i dus su rtog pa tshun chad du'o // nub mo phyi rol du song ste lhag mar 'gyur ba'i tshad ni nam sum cha zad kyi bar du ni nyes byas /
translated: The nun who remains alone commits no fault.🔽The measure of the remainder is that if one-third of the night has passed, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skya rengs ma byung gi bar du sbom po skya rengs dang po byung na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skya rengs ma byung gi bar du sbom po skya rengs dang po byung na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the night is not over, there is a serious offense. If the first watch of the night has passed, there is a downfall.

original: nub pa'i mtha' ni nyi ma mtha'/
analyzed: nub pa'i mtha' ni nyi ma mtha'/
translated: The end of the night is when the sun has not yet risen.

original: nyin par mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa ni nyi ma nub ste dmar thag chad na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin par mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa ni nyi ma nub ste dmar thag chad na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one remains outside the boundary during the day, when the sun has set and the red glow has disappeared, there is a downfall.

original: nub mo dbyar mo thang gi phyi rol na gnas na'o //
analyzed: nub mo dbyar mo thang gi phyi rol na gnas na'o //
translated: If one remains outside the boundary during the night, in the summer months,

original: nub mo mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas na lhag mar 'gyur ba ni bdag gi gnas khang nyid kyi sgo 'das pa phan chad phyi rol du brtsi ste /
analyzed: nub mo mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas na lhag mar 'gyur ba ni bdag gi gnas khang nyid kyi sgo 'das pa phan chad phyi rol du brtsi ste /
translated: One’s own dwelling place is considered to be outside the boundary beyond the door.

original: sgo phan chad du skya rengs byung na lhag mar 'gyur ro //🔽nub mo 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: sgo phan chad du skya rengs byung na lhag mar 'gyur ro // nub mo 'bral ba'o //
translated: If dawn occurs beyond the door, there is a partial defeat.

original: nub mo mtshams kyi phyi rol du gnas pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: nub mo mtshams kyi phyi rol du gnas pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the partial defeat of staying outside the boundary at night.

original: // / nyin mo mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas pa'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / nyin mo mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas pa'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
translated: The partial defeat of staying outside the boundary during the day is explained next.

original: nyin mo nyin par mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa las lhag mar 'gyur ro //🔽mu ge'i tshe gcig pu gnyen gyi khyim du zas kyi phyir song la gnyen dang lhan cig tu 'brel par nye bar song ste gnang ba thob @191b na'o //
analyzed: nyin mo nyin par mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa las lhag mar 'gyur ro // mu ge'i tshe gcig pu gnyen gyi khyim du zas kyi phyir song la gnyen dang lhan cig tu 'brel par nye bar song ste gnang ba thob @191b na'o //
translated: If one stays outside the boundary during the day, there is a partial defeat.🔽If one goes alone to the house of a relative for food during a famine, and one stays there in connection with the relative, there is no offense.

original: mu ge byung ba'i tshe gnyen gyi khyim du zan gyi phyir 'gro bar dge 'dun gyis gnang la grogs med par song ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: mu ge byung ba'i tshe gnyen gyi khyim du zan gyi phyir 'gro bar dge 'dun gyis gnang la grogs med par song ba ni nyes med do //
translated: If the saṅgha has given permission to go to the house of a relative for food during a famine, there is no offense in going there without a companion.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba'ang med par grogs med par song na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba'ang med par grogs med par song na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If she goes alone without the permission of the community, it is a pārājika.

original: de sbyin mu ge'i tshe dge slong ma gnyen gyi der zan zar 'gro bar gsol na grogs med kyang dge 'dun gyis gnang ba sbyin no //🔽nyin mo'i 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: de sbyin mu ge'i tshe dge slong ma gnyen gyi der zan zar 'gro bar gsol na grogs med kyang dge 'dun gyis gnang ba sbyin no // nyin mo'i 'bral ba'o //
translated: If a nun who is a relative of a monk invites him to eat at her house during a famine, she may go alone, but she must obtain permission from the community.🔽The prohibition against separation during the day.

original: nyin mo'i mtshams kyi phyi rol du grogs med par gnas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /🔽// / lam du 'gro ba'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
analyzed: nyin mo'i mtshams kyi phyi rol du grogs med par gnas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so / // / lam du 'gro ba'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of staying alone outside the time limit is complete.🔽The remainder is explained as traveling on the road.

original: lam du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Traveling on the road.

original: dge slong ma grogs med par lam du zhugs nas rgyang grags re re zhing lhag ma re rer 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong ma grogs med par lam du zhugs nas rgyang grags re re zhing lhag ma re rer 'gyur /
translated: If a nun travels on the road alone, she commits a serious violation for each quarter league.

original: rgyang grags phyed cing sbom po re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyang grags phyed cing sbom po re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If she travels half a league, she commits a minor offense.

original: lam du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lam du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Traveling on the road.

original: grogs med bar lam du 'gro ba'i lhag ma rdzogs so /🔽// / grogs med par chu rgal ba'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
analyzed: grogs med bar lam du 'gro ba'i lhag ma rdzogs so / // / grogs med par chu rgal ba'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
translated: The remainder of the prohibition against traveling on the road alone is complete.🔽The remainder is explained as crossing a body of water alone.

original: chu pha rol du rgal ba'o //
analyzed: chu pha rol du rgal ba'o //
translated: Crossing a body of water.

original: chu brgal te pha rol tu phyin na lhag mar 'gyur /
analyzed: chu brgal te pha rol tu phyin na lhag mar 'gyur /
translated: If one crosses the water and reaches the other side, it is a partial defeat.

original: rkyal te pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rkyal te pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: If one crosses by swimming, it is a partial defeat.

original: chu brgal te pha rol tu phyin pa ni rkyal te pha rol tu phyin na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu brgal te pha rol tu phyin pa ni rkyal te pha rol tu phyin na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one crosses the water and reaches the other side, and then crosses again by swimming, it is a partial defeat.

original: tshun chad ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: tshun chad ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one crosses up to the middle, it is a serious violation.

original: pha rol ma phyin par slar log pa ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: pha rol ma phyin par slar log pa ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one crosses to the other side and then returns, it is a serious violation.

original: nyes byas pa ni yur ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni yur ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: If one crosses to the other side of a canal, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chu rkyal du mi chog pa dang yur ba tsam yan chad rgal ba ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: chu rkyal du mi chog pa dang yur ba tsam yan chad rgal ba ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one crosses water that is not suitable for swimming, or a canal and so on, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chu rgal ba'o //
analyzed: chu rgal ba'o //
translated: This is the rule on crossing water.

original: grogs med par chu rgal ba'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: grogs med par chu rgal ba'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The remainder of the rule on crossing water without a companion is finished.

original: // / rab tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: // / rab tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: Ordination

original: thug thub tu bud med rab tu phyung na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug thub tu bud med rab tu phyung na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives full ordination to a woman without a companion, it is a partial defeat.

original: mang pos bskos bdag pos btang rgyal pos gnang ste gsad pa'i phyir ba las na'o //
analyzed: mang pos bskos bdag pos btang rgyal pos gnang ste gsad pa'i phyir ba las na'o //
translated: If one gives full ordination to a woman who has been appointed by many people, who has been sent by her master, or who has been approved by the king, it is a partial defeat.

original: bud med mi sha za ba ma rungs ma yul mis kyang grags par 'gyur nas rgyal po la phul khyim thab kyis kyang btang rgyal pos kyang gsad par chad pa las de lta bu'i bud med thug thub tu rab tu byung na lhag mar 'gyur //
analyzed: bud med mi sha za ba ma rungs ma yul mis kyang grags par 'gyur nas rgyal po la phul khyim thab kyis kyang btang rgyal pos kyang gsad par chad pa las de lta bu'i bud med thug thub tu rab tu byung na lhag mar 'gyur //
translated: If a woman who eats human flesh is wicked, and if people know it, and if she is handed over to the king, and if her husband sends her away, and if the king sentences her to death, then she becomes guilty if she is ordained as a nun.

original: mkhan mor na'o //
analyzed: mkhan mor na'o //
translated: If she is a preceptor,

original: bud med thug thub tu rab tu byung bde mkhan mo gang yin pa de lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med thug thub tu rab tu byung bde mkhan mo gang yin pa de lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a woman who eats human flesh is ordained as a nun, then the preceptor becomes guilty.

original: der shes na'o //
analyzed: der shes na'o //
translated: If she knows,

original: bud med ma rungs ma rgyal po la gsol te /🔽gsad par chad par shes bzhin pa las rab tu phyung na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med ma rungs ma rgyal po la gsol te / gsad par chad par shes bzhin pa las rab tu phyung na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a wicked woman is handed over to the king,

original: rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: and if she is sentenced to death, and if she is ordained, then she becomes guilty.

original: thug thub tu rab tu 'byin pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: thug thub tu rab tu 'byin pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The end of the chapter on Ordination of a woman who eats human flesh.

original: // / shi ba'i nor blangs pa'o //
analyzed: // / shi ba'i nor blangs pa'o //
translated: Taking the property of the dead

original: khyim @192a * //
analyzed: khyim @192a * //
translated: Householder

original: bas dge slong ma la nor sbyin par khas blangs pa las khyim pa de shi ba dang de'i sgo bgags nas ro phyir ma btang zhing sngon nor sbyin pa bdas na lhag ma /
analyzed: bas dge slong ma la nor sbyin par khas blangs pa las khyim pa de shi ba dang de'i sgo bgags nas ro phyir ma btang zhing sngon nor sbyin pa bdas na lhag ma /
translated: If a monk promises to give wealth to a nun, but the householder dies, and the door is blocked, and the corpse is not taken out, and the previous wealth is lost,

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyi na'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyi na'o //
translated: there is no offense if it is the Saṅgha’s.

original: khyim pas dge 'dun la nor byin pa khas blangs pa las khyim pa shi ste /
analyzed: khyim pas dge 'dun la nor byin pa khas blangs pa las khyim pa shi ste /
translated: If a householder promises to give wealth to the Saṅgha, but the householder dies,

analyzed: sngon nor sbyin pa de bdas te sngon nor byin pa de dge slong ma la blangs pa ni nyes med do //
translated: and the previous wealth is lost, and the previous wealth is taken from the nun, there is no fault.

original: de ste bya ba nyung na'o //
analyzed: de ste bya ba nyung na'o //
translated: If there is little work to be done.🔽If the householder dies after promising to give wealth to the Saṅgha, it is said that it is appropriate to give the merit of the offering.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar nyes pa'ang sgo bcad cing mthus bu lon du mi bda' ba'i sngon dge 'dun la nor zhig dbul bar khas blangs te shi ba'i yang bsod nams te dbul ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar nyes pa'ang sgo bcad cing mthus bu lon du mi bda' ba'i sngon dge 'dun la nor zhig dbul bar khas blangs te shi ba'i yang bsod nams te dbul ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni nyes med do //
translated: This is faultless.

original: blangs pa'o // khyim bdag shi ba las nor blangs pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: blangs pa'o // khyim bdag shi ba las nor blangs pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The remainder of taking wealth from a dead householder is complete.

original: // / mtshams kyi phyi rol la chags pa'o //
analyzed: // / mtshams kyi phyi rol la chags pa'o //
translated: It is outside the boundary.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis dge slong la chad pas bcad cing bskrad pa la dge slong ma kha cig gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ste /🔽thug thub tu 'chags su bcug cing chad pas gnang bar byas na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis dge slong la chad pas bcad cing bskrad pa la dge slong ma kha cig gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ste / thug thub tu 'chags su bcug cing chad pas gnang bar byas na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a nun who has been punished and expelled by the community of nuns goes outside the boundary and🔽causes a monk to confess his fault and be released from punishment, she commits a partial defeat.

original: 'chags pa'o // chad pas bcad pa'i dge slong ma thug thub tu 'chags su bcug cing chad pa byung ba'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'chags pa'o // chad pas bcad pa'i dge slong ma thug thub tu 'chags su bcug cing chad pa byung ba'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The partial defeat of a nun who has been punished and causes a monk to confess his fault and be released from punishment is finished.

original: // / dkon mchog bshags pa ni 'di dag dang dge sbyong gzhan 'dras der changs pa'i spyod pa spyad do zhes pa'i tshig 'di la zhugs pa ma btang na'o //
analyzed: // / dkon mchog bshags pa ni 'di dag dang dge sbyong gzhan 'dras der changs pa'i spyod pa spyad do zhes pa'i tshig 'di la zhugs pa ma btang na'o //
translated: The confession of the Three Jewels is as follows: “I have practiced the pure conduct in this way and other ways.” If one does not give up the words,

analyzed: dge slong mas sangs rgyas kyi chos dang mur 'dug gi chos spyod pa mi 'dra ba med de /
translated: there is no difference between the Buddha’s Dharma and the Dharma of the tīrthikas.

analyzed: dge 'dun dbyin du 'jug pa bzhin no //

original: mdo ltag ma ltar lhag mar 'gyur ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen du zhugs pa la dge 'dun gyis lan gsum du bsgos te ma btang pa las lhag mar 'gyur ba bzhin du 'di'ang 'di skad ma zer zhes lan gsum du bsgo ste ma btub na lhag mar
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar lhag mar 'gyur ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen du zhugs pa la dge 'dun gyis lan gsum du bsgos te ma btang pa las lhag mar 'gyur ba bzhin du 'di'ang 'di skad ma zer zhes lan gsum du bsgo ste ma btub na lhag mar
translated: Here, if one is not released by being told three times, “Do not say that,” it becomes a remainder.

original: 'gyur ro // 'og ma dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'og ma dag kyang ngo //

analyzed: 'og nas lhag ma 'byung ba rnams kyang lan gsum du bsgo ste ma btang na lhag mar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: phul ba'o // sangs rgyas kyi chos mi byed mur 'dug gi chos spyod do zhes zer ba'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The remainder of “I will not practice the Buddha’s teachings, I will practice the teachings of the non-Buddhists” is complete.

analyzed: // /'dod pa dang ldan pa la sogs pas dge slong ma la bsgo ba'o //
translated: Admonishing a nun who possesses desire, etc.

translated: In the latter source, if a nun says to another nun who is fighting, mocking, and so on, “Do not act like that,” and the first nun replies, “You are full of desire, you are full of anger, you are full of delusion,”

analyzed: 'thab mo la 'jug na'o //

analyzed: 'thab mo la zhugs te gtong du mi btub pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so / // /'gril cing 'khod pa'o //
translated: Having entered into a fight, it is a remainder offense if one does not stop.

original: grogs mo dang bsten nas 'gril cing 'grogs na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs mo dang bsten nas 'gril cing 'grogs na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a remainder offense if one associates with a woman who is a friend.

original: dge slong ma na'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma na'o //
translated: A nun.

original: 'gril cing 'grogs pa de dge slong ma yang yin pa las lhag mar 'gyur /🔽trog trog mo dang ltar lta ra mo dang rnyil rnyil mo'i skyen du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'gril cing 'grogs pa de dge slong ma yang yin pa las lhag mar 'gyur / trog trog mo dang ltar lta ra mo dang rnyil rnyil mo'i skyen du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is a remainder offense if one associates with a nun who is a friend.🔽It is a remainder offense if one associates with a nun who is a friend who is like this: she is a woman who is noisy, who is a woman who is flirtatious, who is a woman who is a gossip, or who is a woman who is a busybody.

original: 'grogs pa'i dge slong ma de rtsed mo dang 'phyar ba la sogs pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig byed pa dang 'grogs na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grogs pa'i dge slong ma de rtsed mo dang 'phyar ba la sogs pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig byed pa dang 'grogs na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a remainder offense if one associates with a nun who is a friend who does these things such as playing, flirting, and so forth.

original: bdag bud med 'di rnams ltar byed pa zhig dang 'grogs na'ang lhag mar 'gyur ro //🔽bud med kyi 'du 'dzir gtogs pa'o //🔽bud med trog trog mor byed pa dang 'grogs pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: bdag bud med 'di rnams ltar byed pa zhig dang 'grogs na'ang lhag mar 'gyur ro // bud med kyi 'du 'dzir gtogs pa'o // bud med trog trog mor byed pa dang 'grogs pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: It is a remainder offense if one associates with a woman who does these things.🔽It is a remainder offense if one associates with a woman who is a busybody.🔽The remainder offense for associating with a woman who is noisy is finished.

original: // / de'i 'du 'dzir 'doms pa'o //
analyzed: // / de'i 'du 'dzir 'doms pa'o //
translated: It is a remainder offense if one associates with a woman who is a busybody.

original: dge slong ma grogs la trog trog mo dang rtsed mo la sogs pa gyis shig ces bsgo zhing byed du bcug na'ang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma grogs la trog trog mo dang rtsed mo la sogs pa gyis shig ces bsgo zhing byed du bcug na'ang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bhikṣuṇī tells a fellow bhikṣuṇī, “Go play with a man,” and makes her do it, it is a partial defeat.

original: 'doms pa'o // rtsed mo gyis shig ces 'doms pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'doms pa'o // rtsed mo gyis shig ces 'doms pa'i lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The remainder of “Go play” is finished.

original: // / dge 'dun dbyen pa la sogs pa bzhi dge slong ma yir gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / dge 'dun dbyen pa la sogs pa bzhi dge slong ma yir gtogs pa'o //
translated: The four, such as schism in the saṅgha, belong to the bhikṣuṇī.

original: dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa dang / rigs sun pa dang dag dka' ba bzhi yang dge slong pa'i bshad pa bzhin du dge slong mas byas na'ang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa dang / rigs sun pa dang dag dka' ba bzhi yang dge slong pa'i bshad pa bzhin du dge slong mas byas na'ang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bhikṣuṇī creates schism, or sides with it, or insults the family, or makes it difficult to purify, it is a partial defeat, just as in the explanation of the bhikṣu.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The remainder of the saṅgha is finished.

original: // / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma nyi shu rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma nyi shu rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty remainders of the saṅgha are finished.

original: // /'di man chad sum cu bzhi'i spang ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // /'di man chad sum cu bzhi'i spang ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: From here on, it explains the forty-three downfalls to be abandoned.

original: bcu pa'o // 'chad pa dang 'dral ba la sogs pa bcu dang phung po gcig ril gyis dge @193a * //🔽slong pha'i dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bcu pa'o // 'chad pa dang 'dral ba la sogs pa bcu dang phung po gcig ril gyis dge @193a * //🔽slong pha'i dang 'dra'o //
translated: The ten, such as explaining and splitting, and the one aggregate, are the same as the bhikṣu.

original: gser dang dngul dang dngul gyis pa dang nyo tshong dang lhan pa med pa dang / 'thag pa gnyis dang 'phrog pa dang bsngos pa dang bsdus par chud pa'o //
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang dngul gyis pa dang nyo tshong dang lhan pa med pa dang / 'thag pa gnyis dang 'phrog pa dang bsngos pa dang bsdus par chud pa'o //
translated: Not having gold, silver, or what is made of gold and silver, buying and selling, not having a needle case, two weavers, stealing, dedicated to an individual, and included in a group.

original: gser dang dngul dang nyo 'tshong dang lhung bzed lhan pa med par bzang po tshol ba dang 'thag pa gnyis dang byin 'phrog dang dge 'dun dbang ba gang zag la bsngos so zhes zer ba dang sman zhag bdun pa dang zhag bcu dgu ni dge slong pha'i dang
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang nyo 'tshong dang lhung bzed lhan pa med par bzang po tshol ba dang 'thag pa gnyis dang byin 'phrog dang dge 'dun dbang ba gang zag la bsngos so zhes zer ba dang sman zhag bdun pa dang zhag bcu dgu ni dge slong pha'i dang
translated: Gold, silver, buying and selling, seeking a good alms-bowl without a patch, two weavers, stealing what is given, saying “What belongs to the Saṅgha is dedicated to an individual,” and medicine for seven days and nineteen days are the same as for a fully ordained monk.

original: 'dra ste dge slong phas bsrung bar bshad pa bzhin du dge slong mas kyang bsrung ngo //
analyzed: 'dra ste dge slong phas bsrung bar bshad pa bzhin du dge slong mas kyang bsrung ngo //
translated: Just as it is explained that a fully ordained monk should guard, a fully ordained nun should also guard.

original: dge slong pha'i spang ba'i ltung ba bcu dgur ming gis smos pa 'di la ma gtogs pa rnams ni dge slong ma'i spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong pha'i spang ba'i ltung ba bcu dgur ming gis smos pa 'di la ma gtogs pa rnams ni dge slong ma'i spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Except for what is mentioned by name in the nineteen downfalls of a fully ordained monk, they do not become downfalls of a fully ordained nun.

original: dge slong gi 'khru ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khru ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The downfalls of a fully ordained monk, such as washing, etc.

original: dge slong mas dge slong pha'i gos rnying pa bkrus na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes t'i ka las bshad /
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong pha'i gos rnying pa bkrus na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes t'i ka las bshad /
translated: The Tika explains that if a fully ordained nun washes the old robes of a fully ordained monk, she commits an abandoning offense.

original: dge slong mas gos rnying pa dge slong pha la bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig dang mog sha la 'chad /
analyzed: dge slong mas gos rnying pa dge slong pha la bcol na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig dang mog sha la 'chad /
translated: Some who uphold the Vinaya and Moggallana explain that if a fully ordained nun entrusts her old robes to a fully ordained monk, she commits an abandoning offense.

original: de las blangs pa dang / dge slong mas gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong pha las gos blangs na 'ang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las blangs pa dang / dge slong mas gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong pha las gos blangs na 'ang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Taking it back and if a fully ordained nun takes robes from a fully ordained monk who is not a relative, she commits an abandoning offense.

original: dge slong ma byin pa'o //🔽dge slong mas sngar grogs la /
analyzed: dge slong ma byin pa'o // dge slong mas sngar grogs la /
translated: It is not given to a fully ordained nun.🔽If a fully ordained nun gives robes to a companion

original: gos byin pa las phyis gos slar phrogs pa na spong ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos byin pa las phyis gos slar phrogs pa na spong ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and later takes the robes back, she commits an abandoning offense.

original: lha'i dad pa mi gzung /
analyzed: lha'i dad pa mi gzung /
translated: Do not accept worship of gods.

original: dge slong mas 'jig rten gyi lha'i gzugs bris sam byas te de la yul mi yon 'bul du bcug nas yon blangs na spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong mas 'jig rten gyi lha'i gzugs bris sam byas te de la yul mi yon 'bul du bcug nas yon blangs na spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained nun draws or makes an image of a worldly god and makes people offer worship to it and then accepts the offerings, she commits an abandoning offense.

original: lhung bzed lhag pa nyin gcig las ring du mi bcang ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag pa nyin gcig las ring du mi bcang ba'o //
translated: Not to keep an extra begging bowl for more than one day.

original: lhung bzed lhag pa bcangs na sngags kyis ma thebs sam gud du ma btang bar zhag gnyis kyi skya rengs byung na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag pa bcangs na sngags kyis ma thebs sam gud du ma btang bar zhag gnyis kyi skya rengs byung na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one keeps an extra begging bowl for more than one day, then, unless it is consecrated or given away, it becomes a downfall of forsaking a basic bodhisattva precept if the next dawn arrives.

original: lhung bzed kyi 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi 'chang ba'o //
translated: This is the rule for keeping a begging bowl.

original: lhung bzed lhag ba zhag gcig las 'das te sngags ma thebs pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag ba zhag gcig las 'das te sngags ma thebs pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the downfall that is to be forsaken in regard to keeping an extra begging bowl for more than one day.

original: // / zla ba phyed phyed pa'i nyin mo thog ma la bsngo ba ma bsngos na'o //
analyzed: // / zla ba phyed phyed pa'i nyin mo thog ma la bsngo ba ma bsngos na'o //
translated: Not to consecrate one’s three robes and the thirteen articles of a monk as belonging to no one on the first day of every half-month.

original: chos gos lnga dang yo byad bcu gsum bdag gi yin par bsngos na zla ba phyed phyed cing sngags kyis gdab dgos so //
analyzed: chos gos lnga dang yo byad bcu gsum bdag gi yin par bsngos na zla ba phyed phyed cing sngags kyis gdab dgos so //
translated: One’s three robes and thirteen articles of a monk must be consecrated as belonging to no one and consecrated with a mantra every half-month.

original: gzhan sbyin par bsngos pa dang gos lhag gis sngags btab pa ni mi dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan sbyin par bsngos pa dang gos lhag gis sngags btab pa ni mi dgos so //
translated: However, it is not necessary to consecrate as belonging to no one and to consecrate with a mantra those things that are given to others or the extra robes.

original: ma bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsngos pa'o //
translated: Not to consecrate.

original: zla ba phyed @193b cing gos sngags kyis ma thebs pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: zla ba phyed @193b cing gos sngags kyis ma thebs pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the downfall that is to be forsaken in regard to not consecrating one’s robes with a mantra every half-month.

original: // / dpyid zla ra ba'i tha ma'i nyin mo tshun chad du drubs pa phyung na'o //
analyzed: // / dpyid zla ra ba'i tha ma'i nyin mo tshun chad du drubs pa phyung na'o //
translated: If one takes out a mat that was woven before the last day of the first autumn month.

original: dpyid zla ra ba nya la gding ba drubs pa las 'byin pa las de las sngar gding ba drubs pa phyung na zla ba lnga'i tshe rdzas rnyed do cog spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba nya la gding ba drubs pa las 'byin pa las de las sngar gding ba drubs pa phyung na zla ba lnga'i tshe rdzas rnyed do cog spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one takes out a mat that was woven before the full moon of the first autumn month, then one must give up all the articles that one has acquired during the five months.

original: ltung ba med pa ni rkun pos khyer ba dge slong ma'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni rkun pos khyer ba dge slong ma'i phyir na'o //
translated: There is no offense if the mat was taken by thieves and then given to a nun.

original: dpyid zla ra ba'i nya las sngar gding ba drubs pa phyung yang nyes med pa ni dge slong mang mo zhig nor dang gos rkun pos khyer drubs pa phyung nas nor dgos pa ni nyes med do //🔽drubs pa las 'byin pa'o //🔽gding ba drubs pa dus las sngar phyung ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba'i nya las sngar gding ba drubs pa phyung yang nyes med pa ni dge slong mang mo zhig nor dang gos rkun pos khyer drubs pa phyung nas nor dgos pa ni nyes med do // drubs pa las 'byin pa'o // gding ba drubs pa dus las sngar phyung ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: If one takes out a mat that was woven before the full moon of the first autumn month, there is no offense if many monks have had their wealth and robes stolen and they need the mat.🔽This was the downfall of taking out a mat before the proper time.

original: // / ma byung pa'o //
analyzed: // / ma byung pa'o //
translated: The downfall of taking out a mat before the proper time is finished.

original: gding ba drubs pa la dpyid zla ra ba'i nya la 'byin pa'i rigs pa las nya las 'das te drubs pa phyung na zla ba lnga'i tshe gos ci rnyed pa spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gding ba drubs pa la dpyid zla ra ba'i nya la 'byin pa'i rigs pa las nya las 'das te drubs pa phyung na zla ba lnga'i tshe gos ci rnyed pa spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the monk has not finished weaving the mat by the full moon of the first spring month, and if he takes out the mat after the full moon, then he must give up the robe that he has obtained during the five months.

original: der ro // nya 'das nas zhag gcig gi skya rengs byung na spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der ro // nya 'das nas zhag gcig gi skya rengs byung na spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he takes out the mat after the full moon, and if the first part of the night has passed, then he must give up the robe.

original: drubs pa dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: drubs pa dbyung ba'o //
translated: This is the rule for taking out the mat.

original: gding ba drubs pa dus las 'das te phyung ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gding ba drubs pa dus las 'das te phyung ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: This was the downfall of taking out the mat after the proper time.

original: // / dbyig dang gser slong ba'o //
analyzed: // / dbyig dang gser slong ba'o //
translated: Soliciting gold and silver

original: dge slong mas nor rin po che dang / dbyig dang gser dngul la sogs pa khyim pa las blangs na gnyen yin yang rung ma yin yang rung spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽rin po che slong ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas nor rin po che dang / dbyig dang gser dngul la sogs pa khyim pa las blangs na gnyen yin yang rung ma yin yang rung spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro // rin po che slong ba'o //
translated: If a nun asks a layperson for money, precious things, gold, silver, or other valuables, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment, whether the layperson is a relative or not.🔽Soliciting precious things

original: rin po che khyim pa las slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rin po che khyim pa las slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: This was the downfall of soliciting precious things.

original: // / gzhan gyi phyir gos rnyed pa zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: // / gzhan gyi phyir gos rnyed pa zas su byas te bza' ba'i phyir bsngos pa'o //
translated: “For another’s sake” means that the robe was obtained for the sake of eating food.

original: gzhan gyis gos shig byin te 'dis kha phyis sam snod spyad dam gzhan zhig tu bsgyur te spyod cig ces bsngos te byin pa las gos de zas shig tu yang bsgyur na zas de rnams spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gos shig byin te 'dis kha phyis sam snod spyad dam gzhan zhig tu bsgyur te spyod cig ces bsngos te byin pa las gos de zas shig tu yang bsgyur na zas de rnams spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: “Dedicated” means that someone else gave a robe, saying, “Use this to wipe your mouth, or to make a container, or to make something else,” and then the robe was transformed into food.

original: gos za bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: gos za bar chud pa'o //
translated: “The food is transformed into a robe” means that the food is transformed into a robe.

original: gos gzhan zhig tu bsgyur cig par byin pa las zas su bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gos gzhan zhig tu bsgyur cig par byin pa las zas su bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: “The robe is transformed into something else” means that the robe was given to be transformed into food. The downfall is completed by eating the food.🔽“Again and again” means that the downfall is accrued for each use.

original: // / gos dang mal stan dang dbyar mo thang gi phyir ba gang cig la yang yang ngo //
analyzed: // / gos dang mal stan dang dbyar mo thang gi phyir ba gang cig la yang yang ngo //
translated: “For the sake of robes, bedding, or the rainy season retreat” means that the downfall is accrued for each use.

original: dge 'dun la gos dang mal stan dang / gtsug lag khang gi yo byad du 'di rnams las phul ba las zas su bsgyur na spang ba'i ltung ba /
analyzed: dge 'dun la gos dang mal stan dang / gtsug lag khang gi yo byad du 'di rnams las phul ba las zas su bsgyur na spang ba'i ltung ba /
translated: “For the sake of the saṅgha” means that the downfall is accrued for each use of the robes, bedding, or temple goods that were offered to the saṅgha and then transformed into food.

original: ltag ma'i ltung ba dang 'di gnyis ka dge 'dun la phul ba las zas su bsgyur kyang rung gang zag la @194a * //🔽phul ba las zas su bsgyur kyang rung spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltag ma'i ltung ba dang 'di gnyis ka dge 'dun la phul ba las zas su bsgyur kyang rung gang zag la @194a * // phul ba las zas su bsgyur kyang rung spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.

analyzed: 'di rnams kyis bsgyur gyis shig par rin byin pa las zas su bsgyur na gang ci yang rung spang ba'o // gos la sogs pa bza' bar chud pa'o // gos phul ba la sogs zas su bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.

original: // / dge slong ma 'gro ba mang po'i phyir bskul ba las de bdag la bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: // / dge slong ma 'gro ba mang po'i phyir bskul ba las de bdag la bsngos pa'o //
translated: Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.

original: dge slong ma bzhi yan chad mang po zhig gud nas 'ongs te zas dang yo byad kyis mi chog go zhes blangs la gud nas 'ongs pa'i zas su ma byas par bdag gir byas te gzhan na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /🔽'gro ba mang po'i phyir bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma bzhi yan chad mang po zhig gud nas 'ongs te zas dang yo byad kyis mi chog go zhes blangs la gud nas 'ongs pa'i zas su ma byas par bdag gir byas te gzhan na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /🔽'gro ba mang po'i phyir bsngos pa'o //
translated: Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽Whether it is changed into food from what was offered to the Saṅgha or from what was offered to an individual, it is a downfall that requires confession.

original: gud nas 'ongs pa'i phyir blangs te bdag gir byas pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa'i phyir blangs te bdag gir byas pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: Having taken it from another, it is a downfall to make it one’s own.

original: // / dge 'dun gyi phyir na yang ngo //
analyzed: // / dge 'dun gyi phyir na yang ngo //
translated: It is for the sake of the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi gzhi la 'khod pa'i zas dang yo byad mi chog go zhes gud nas blangs te dge 'dun gyir ma spyad par bdag nyid kyir byas na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gzhi la 'khod pa'i zas dang yo byad mi chog go zhes gud nas blangs te dge 'dun gyir ma spyad par bdag nyid kyir byas na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If, having taken it from another, one does not use it for the saṅgha, but makes it one’s own, it is a downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir bsngos pa'o //
translated: It is dedicated to the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir bslangs pa las bdag nyid kyir byas pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir bslangs pa las bdag nyid kyir byas pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: Having taken it for the sake of the saṅgha, it is a downfall to make it one’s own.🔽The downfall is accrued when the medicine is taken.

original: // / tshig bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bcing ba'i don dgrol ba'o //
