original: dge slong ma rtsed mo byed na lus bsgyur tam kha bsnyer tam mig bsgyur ba la sogs pa ci byas kyang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rtsed mo byed na lus bsgyur tam kha bsnyer tam mig bsgyur ba la sogs pa ci byas kyang ltung ba'o //
translated: If a nun plays, then whether she moves her body, or moves her mouth, or moves her eyes, or does anything, it is a downfall.

original: glu len na yang ngo ;
analyzed: glu len na yang ngo ;
translated: If she sings, it is also.

original: / dge slong mas glu blangs na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: / dge slong mas glu blangs na ltung ba'o //
translated: If a nun sings, it is a downfall.

original: gang du de dag tu de'i bsam pas dbyangs kyi bsgyur ba yang ngo //
analyzed: gang du de dag tu de'i bsam pas dbyangs kyi bsgyur ba yang ngo //
translated: If she sings with the intention of doing so, it is also a downfall.

original: yi ge klog pa'i phyir bsams te gtang rag dang gre bsgyur dang glu'i dbyangs ro 'dra ba byas na'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge klog pa'i phyir bsams te gtang rag dang gre bsgyur dang glu'i dbyangs ro 'dra ba byas na'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If she sings with the intention of reading the letters, or of giving thanks, or of changing her voice, or of imitating the sound of a song, it is a downfall.

original: sil snyan blangs na yang ngo //
analyzed: sil snyan blangs na yang ngo //
translated: If she plays a musical instrument, it is also.

original: rnga dang gling bu la sogs pa rol mo'i yo byad las blangs shing bus na ltung ba /
analyzed: rnga dang gling bu la sogs pa rol mo'i yo byad las blangs shing bus na ltung ba /
translated: If she plays and blows a musical instrument such as a drum or flute, it is a downfall.

original: reg pa'i tshe na'ang ltung ba /🔽trog trog por chud pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i tshe na'ang ltung ba / trog trog por chud pa'o //
translated: If she touches it, it is a downfall.🔽It is a downfall to play and to be noisy.

original: rtse zhing trog trog por byed pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rtse zhing trog trog por byed pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall for playing and being noisy is complete.

original: // / gdugs kun du spyod par 'gyur bar 'chang na yang ngo //
analyzed: // / gdugs kun du spyod par 'gyur bar 'chang na yang ngo //
translated: If she keeps it for the purpose of using it all the time, it is also.

original: dge slong mas gdugs thogs shing spyod na 'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas gdugs thogs shing spyod na 'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If a nun keeps and uses an umbrella, it is a downfall.

original: lham gong med kyang ngo //
analyzed: lham gong med kyang ngo //
translated: It is also not an offense if one is without shoes.

original: dge slong mas lham gag kyang rung gyon na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas lham gag kyang rung gyon na ltung ba'o //
translated: If a bhikṣuṇī wears shoes, she commits an offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dbyar mo thang na mal stan bsrung ba'i phyir na yang ngo //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dbyar mo thang na mal stan bsrung ba'i phyir na yang ngo //
translated: There is no offense if she is on a journey during the rainy season in order to protect her bedding.

original: lham gyon kyang nyes med pa ni dbyar mo thang bdag gi gnas na rkang pa bkrus te nyal ba'i tshe mal stan la rkang pa'i rdul gyis mi phog par bya ba'i phyir lhan gyon ni nyes med do //
analyzed: lham gyon kyang nyes med pa ni dbyar mo thang bdag gi gnas na rkang pa bkrus te nyal ba'i tshe mal stan la rkang pa'i rdul gyis mi phog par bya ba'i phyir lhan gyon ni nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if she wears shoes during the rainy season in her own dwelling in order to prevent dust from her feet from falling on the bedding when she is washing her feet.

original: khri'i steng du kun du spyod pa myong na yang ngo //
analyzed: khri'i steng du kun du spyod pa myong na yang ngo //
translated: There is also no offense if she is using a high seat.

original: dge slong ma khri'i thog na 'dug la khri'i pha rol tshu rol nas slob ma la sogs pa gzhan gyis theg cing spod na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma khri'i thog na 'dug la khri'i pha rol tshu rol nas slob ma la sogs pa gzhan gyis theg cing spod na ltung ba'o //
translated: If a bhikṣuṇī is sitting on a high seat and her disciples and others are sitting on the ground in front of her, she commits an offense.

original: sgeg sgeg mor chud pa'o //
analyzed: sgeg sgeg mor chud pa'o //
translated: She is acting like a flirt.

original: sgeg sgeg mo byed pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgeg sgeg mo byed pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of acting like a flirt is finished.

original: // / @199a * //  grong par du ma bsgo bar 'dug na yang ngo //
analyzed: // / @199a * //  grong par du ma bsgo bar 'dug na yang ngo //
translated: There is also no offense if she is staying in a village without permission.

original: grong bar khyim pa'i khyim du stan la 'dug ces ma bsgo bar thug thub tu stan la 'dug na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: grong bar khyim pa'i khyim du stan la 'dug ces ma bsgo bar thug thub tu stan la 'dug na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one sits down in a lay person’s house in the middle of the village without being invited to sit on a seat, one commits an offense.

original: pho brjid kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: pho brjid kyis kyang ngo //
translated: Also, if one is conceited.

original: pho brjid byed pa'i ltung ba'o //🔽chos bsnyad pa'i phyir gnas shing spyod pa'i khyim pa'i mal stan khyim pa la ma bsnyad par bor te song na'o //
analyzed: pho brjid byed pa'i ltung ba'o // chos bsnyad pa'i phyir gnas shing spyod pa'i khyim pa'i mal stan khyim pa la ma bsnyad par bor te song na'o //
translated: This is the downfall of being conceited.🔽If, while staying in a lay person’s house for the sake of teaching the Dharma, one leaves the bed or seat without informing the lay person,

original: chos bshad pa'i phyir khyim pas khri stan bting ba la 'dug 'dug ste khyim pa med de bdag gis kyang ma brtul bar bor te song na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i phyir khyim pas khri stan bting ba la 'dug 'dug ste khyim pa med de bdag gis kyang ma brtul bar bor te song na ltung ba'o //
translated: if one sits on a bed or seat that a lay person has prepared for the sake of teaching the Dharma, and if one leaves it without informing the lay person or having been dismissed, one commits an offense.

original: de'i mtshams btang na mtha'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshams btang na mtha'o //
translated: If one leaves the area, the limit is the boundary.

original: stan ma brtul te bor te song nas 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa 'das na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: stan ma brtul te bor te song nas 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa 'das na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one leaves the seat without informing anyone and goes beyond forty-eight fathoms, one commits an offense.

original: blan pa'o // stan ma brtul ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /🔽// / skud pa 'khal na yang ngo //
analyzed: blan pa'o // stan ma brtul ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so / // / skud pa 'khal na yang ngo //
translated: This is the downfall of leaving the seat without informing anyone.🔽If one spins wool, one commits an offense.

original: gos rgyu'i skud pa bal 'khal na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gos rgyu'i skud pa bal 'khal na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one spins wool for the sake of making cloth, one commits an offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni rgya cang dang lcag phod kyi phyir phyogs dben par ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni rgya cang dang lcag phod kyi phyir phyogs dben par ro //
translated: There is no offense if it is for the sake of a large amount of cloth or a good quality cloth, or in a secluded place.

original: skud pa bkal kyang nyes pa med pa ni rgya cad dang lcag pod dang skud pa las pa phran tshegs dben par gzhan gyis ma mthong bar bkal ba nyes med do //
analyzed: skud pa bkal kyang nyes pa med pa ni rgya cad dang lcag pod dang skud pa las pa phran tshegs dben par gzhan gyis ma mthong bar bkal ba nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if the cloth is spread out in a secluded place, where no one will see it, and it is not for the sake of a large amount of cloth or a good quality cloth.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun ma'i gos bdag gir byas na yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun ma'i gos bdag gir byas na yang ngo //
translated: There is an offense if a monk appropriates the robe of a nun.

original: dge 'dun la dgos pa'i phyir khyim pa las gos bslangs te dge slong gir ma byas par bdag gir byas na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la dgos pa'i phyir khyim pa las gos bslangs te dge slong gir ma byas par bdag gir byas na ltung ba'o //
translated: There is an offense if a monk asks a layperson for cloth for the Sangha and then appropriates it for himself.

original: zas btsongs pa byas na yang ngo //
analyzed: zas btsongs pa byas na yang ngo //
translated: There is an offense if a monk sells food.

original: kha zas dang kha zas kyi rgyu 'tshong bsgyur na yang ltung ba'o //🔽khyim pa yir gtogs pa na yang ngo //
analyzed: kha zas dang kha zas kyi rgyu 'tshong bsgyur na yang ltung ba'o // khyim pa yir gtogs pa na yang ngo //
translated: There is an offense if a monk trades food or the ingredients for food.

original: khyim pa'i las ma gtogs pa ci yang rung bdag gis grogs byas na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i las ma gtogs pa ci yang rung bdag gis grogs byas na ltung ba'o //
translated: There is an offense if a monk helps with any work other than that of a layperson.

original: chang gi las mi bya /
analyzed: chang gi las mi bya /
translated: A monk should not make alcohol.

original: chang ma rung bar song ba zhim por byed pa la sogs pa cang gi grogs byed na yang nyes byas /
analyzed: chang ma rung bar song ba zhim por byed pa la sogs pa cang gi grogs byed na yang nyes byas /
translated: If you help a friend make bad beer taste good, you have committed an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chang 'tshong bar mi bya /🔽chang btsongs na nyes byas /
analyzed: chang 'tshong bar mi bya / chang btsongs na nyes byas /
translated: You should not sell beer.🔽If you do, you have committed an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rlon pa btsos na yang ngo //
analyzed: rlon pa btsos na yang ngo //
translated: If you cook it in water, you have also committed an offense.

original: kha zas ma tshos pa slar bslas te btsos pa ni ltung ba /
analyzed: kha zas ma tshos pa slar bslas te btsos pa ni ltung ba /
translated: If you reheat food that has already been cooked, you have committed a downfall.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong pha'i dge 'dun dang slob dpon dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i phyir na phyogs dben par ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong pha'i dge 'dun dang slob dpon dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i phyir na phyogs dben par ro //
translated: There is no offense if you do it for the community of monks, for your preceptor, or for fellow practitioners in a secluded place.

original: kha zas btsos kyang nyes med pa ni dge 'dun pho dang slob dpon dang mkhan po dang dge slong tshangs par spyod pa gang zag gi phyir byas pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: kha zas btsos kyang nyes med pa ni dge 'dun pho dang slob dpon dang mkhan po dang dge slong tshangs par spyod pa gang zag gi phyir byas pa ni nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if you cook food for the community of monks, for your preceptor, for your teacher, or for a fellow practitioner.

original: khyim pa'i bzor chud pa'o //🔽khyim ma'i las spyad pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: khyim pa'i bzor chud pa'o // khyim ma'i las spyad pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: It is finished.

original: // / zos nas stan las 'phos te zos na yang ngo //
analyzed: // / zos nas stan las 'phos te zos na yang ngo //
translated: If you eat it after moving from your seat, you have also committed an offense.

original: zan @199b za ba las lan mang du yang langs yang 'dug byed cing 'chag cing za na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: zan @199b za ba las lan mang du yang langs yang 'dug byed cing 'chag cing za na ltung ba'o //
translated: If he gets up and sits down many times while eating, and walks around while eating, he commits an offense.

original: bcud pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: bcud pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The rule on eating.

original: zan smos shing za ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: zan smos shing za ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: The offense of eating while talking about food.

original: sgog pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sgog pa yang ngo //
translated: And garlic.

original: sgog pa zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: sgog pa zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: The offense of eating garlic.

original: 'dus par mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus par mi rigs pa'o //
translated: The impropriety of gathering.

original: sgog pa zos pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgog pa zos pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The offense of eating garlic is finished.

original: // / rdul gos ma bcangs na'o//
analyzed: // / rdul gos ma bcangs na'o//
translated: The offense of not wearing a skirt.

original: mo mtshan las khrag zag pa'i phyir dgab pa'i ras bcangs shing /
analyzed: mo mtshan las khrag zag pa'i phyir dgab pa'i ras bcangs shing /
translated: Because blood flows from the vagina, he should wear a cloth to cover it.

original: ma g-yogs na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ma g-yogs na ltung ba'o //
translated: If he does not cover it, he commits an offense.

original: gnas par the gus lus bcing ngo //
analyzed: gnas par the gus lus bcing ngo //
translated: He should bind his body with a belt.

original: dgab pa'i ras la the gus btags te mi ltung ba'i phyir lus la bcing ngo //
analyzed: dgab pa'i ras la the gus btags te mi ltung ba'i phyir lus la bcing ngo //
translated: He should tie the cloth that covers it with a belt and bind it to his body so that it does not fall off.

original: dus dus su de bkru zhing btso //
analyzed: dus dus su de bkru zhing btso //
translated: From time to time he should wash and boil it.

original: mo mtshan dgab pa'i ras khrag mi 'ong pa'i skabs su bkru zhing btso //
analyzed: mo mtshan dgab pa'i ras khrag mi 'ong pa'i skabs su bkru zhing btso //
translated: When blood does not flow from the vagina, he should wash and boil the cloth that covers it.

original: chu'i ras kyang ngo //
analyzed: chu'i ras kyang ngo //
translated: And a cloth for bathing.

original: khrus ras 'khor gsum yog pa gcig dang lus thams cad yog pa gcig dang gnyis bcang ngo //
analyzed: khrus ras 'khor gsum yog pa gcig dang lus thams cad yog pa gcig dang gnyis bcang ngo //
translated: He should keep two bathing cloths: one that covers the three areas and one that covers the whole body.

original: khrus ras chung dus ma g-yogs par bkrus na ltung /🔽chen pos ma g-yogs pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: khrus ras chung dus ma g-yogs par bkrus na ltung / chen pos ma g-yogs pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one bathes without covering oneself with a small bathing robe, one commits an offense.🔽If one bathes without covering oneself with a large bathing robe, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bcang / khrus ras che chung gnyis bcang na nyes byas /
analyzed: de bcang / khrus ras che chung gnyis bcang na nyes byas /
translated: If one keeps both a large and a small bathing robe, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'khru bas gos de brkus na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'khru bas gos de brkus na yang ngo //
translated: If one steals the robe that one is washing, one commits the same offense as for stealing it.

original: khrus mkhan la gos 'khrur bcug na rnying pa ni ltung ba sar pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: khrus mkhan la gos 'khrur bcug na rnying pa ni ltung ba sar pa ni nyes byas /
translated: If one has a layperson wash a robe, then if the robe is old, one commits an offense of wrong conduct; if it is new, one commits an offense.

original: dben pa zhig par chud pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhig par chud pa'o //
translated: It is lost in a secluded place.

original: mo mtshan ma g-yogs pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mo mtshan ma g-yogs pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: The offense entailing confession for not covering one’s private parts.

original: dge slong ma'i gos khyim pa bskon pa'i phyir byin na yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gos khyim pa bskon pa'i phyir byin na yang ngo //
translated: If one gives a nun’s robe to a layperson to wear, one commits the same offense.

original: dge slong ma'i chos gos khyim pa bskon zhing spyod du bcug na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i chos gos khyim pa bskon zhing spyod du bcug na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one makes a nun wear a monk’s Dharma robe, one commits an offense.

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan la bsti stang med par bcud pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan la bsti stang med par bcud pa'o //
translated: It is to disrespect the Dharma banner.

original: chos gos khyim pa bskon pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /🔽// / dge slong dang lhan cig tu sbyar ma brje na yang ngo //
analyzed: chos gos khyim pa bskon pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so / // / dge slong dang lhan cig tu sbyar ma brje na yang ngo //
translated: The class of offenses entailing confession for wearing a layperson’s clothes is finished.🔽If one exchanges a large robe with a monk, one commits an offense.

original: dge slong ma'i chos gos chen po dge slong dang brje na ltung ba /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i chos gos chen po dge slong dang brje na ltung ba /
translated: If a nun exchanges a large Dharma robe with a monk, she commits an offense.

original: chos gos bzhi las brjes pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: chos gos bzhi las brjes pa ni nyes byas /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is to exchange the four types of robes.

original: rgyal mtshan brjes par chud pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan brjes par chud pa'o //
translated: The offense of a downfall is to exchange a victory banner.

original: chos gos brje ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos brje ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: The downfall is to exchange Dharma robes.

original: bsngags pa'i ser sna byed na yang ngo //
analyzed: bsngags pa'i ser sna byed na yang ngo //
translated: The same is true if one is stingy with praise.

original: dge slong ma gzhan chos mkhas pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mkhan mo'i mdun du slob mas bsngags nas mkhan mos gnas 'char ma bcug ste de ltar khyod su mkhas pa'i gan du zhus shig ces byas na ltung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma gzhan chos mkhas pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mkhan mo'i mdun du slob mas bsngags nas mkhan mos gnas 'char ma bcug ste de ltar khyod su mkhas pa'i gan du zhus shig ces byas na ltung ngo //
translated: If a nun praises a learned nun and so on in front of her preceptor, and the preceptor says, “You should ask someone else who is more learned,” the nun commits a downfall.

original: rigs dang grong phyug po 'di rnams nga'i sa ris kyis ma slong cig ces zer ba dang / gnas dang / bdag gis gtsug lag khang brtsigs @200a * //
analyzed: rigs dang grong phyug po 'di rnams nga'i sa ris kyis ma slong cig ces zer ba dang / gnas dang / bdag gis gtsug lag khang brtsigs @200a * //
translated: The same is true if a nun says to her preceptor, “Do not ask the wealthy families of this town for alms,” or if she says, “Do not build a temple in this place; build it in this other place.”

original: pa la dge slong ma gzhan gnas su 'ongs pa la ma bzhag pa dang / rnyed pa dang / slob ma bsod snyoms las 'khor te zan bstan pas kha zas bzang po 'di byin pa'i grong dum long shig ces zer ba dang / chos la ser sna byed ba yang ngo //🔽chos slong cing kha dog 'bul ba la nam brel te zhes mi bstan par bkyigs pa dang / 'di rnams gang byas kyang ltung ba'o //🔽'jungs bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: pa la dge slong ma gzhan gnas su 'ongs pa la ma bzhag pa dang / rnyed pa dang / slob ma bsod snyoms las 'khor te zan bstan pas kha zas bzang po 'di byin pa'i grong dum long shig ces zer ba dang / chos la ser sna byed ba yang ngo // chos slong cing kha dog 'bul ba la nam brel te zhes mi bstan par bkyigs pa dang / 'di rnams gang byas kyang ltung ba'o // 'jungs bar chud pa'o //
translated: Also, when a nun does not give a place to stay to another nun who has come to her dwelling, or when she does not give her food, or when she does not give her a meal that she has received as alms, and she says, “Go to the village where they give good food,” or when she is stingy with the doctrine,🔽or when she does not teach the doctrine to one who asks for it, or when she does not give her robes, or when she does not give her food, or when she does not give her a place to stay, or when she does not give her medicine, and she says, “Go to the village where they give robes,” and so on, these are downfalls.🔽It is a downfall to be stingy with the Dharma.

original: ser sna byed pa'i ltung ba'o /🔽// / dge slong ma dbyar mo thang nas bskrad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ser sna byed pa'i ltung ba'o / // / dge slong ma dbyar mo thang nas bskrad pa yang ngo //
translated: It is a downfall to be stingy with the Dharma.🔽It is a downfall to expel a nun from a place.

original: dge slong ma gtsug lag khang yang rung gang zag gi gnas kyang rung khyim pa'i khyim yang rung bskrad na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma gtsug lag khang yang rung gang zag gi gnas kyang rung khyim pa'i khyim yang rung bskrad na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is a downfall to expel a nun from a temple, or from a place where individuals live, or from a layman’s house.

original: ci ltar de ltar dge slong ma la'o //
analyzed: ci ltar de ltar dge slong ma la'o //
translated: It is the same for a monk.

original: bdag gis bskrad pa bzhin du gzhan la skrod du bcol na thabs ji ltar byas kyang rung bskrad na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bskrad pa bzhin du gzhan la skrod du bcol na thabs ji ltar byas kyang rung bskrad na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one tells another to drive out, as if one were to drive out oneself, then it is a downfall no matter what method one uses to drive out.

original: grong bar du sdar 'ongs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: grong bar du sdar 'ongs pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also the same if one comes to a village and then goes to another.

original: dge slong ma snga na grong bar na zan slong zhing 'dug pa la phyis 'ongs pas gud du slongs shig ces bsgo na'ang ltung /
analyzed: dge slong ma snga na grong bar na zan slong zhing 'dug pa la phyis 'ongs pas gud du slongs shig ces bsgo na'ang ltung /
translated: If a nun who is already in a village begging for alms is told by a later arrival, “Go elsewhere,” then it is a downfall.

original: phyis 'ongs pa las ma 'ong shig ces snga nas bskrad kyang ltung /
analyzed: phyis 'ongs pa las ma 'ong shig ces snga nas bskrad kyang ltung /
translated: If a later arrival is told, “Do not come,” then it is a downfall to drive out an earlier arrival.

original: bskrad par chud pa'o //
analyzed: bskrad par chud pa'o //
translated: It is included in “driving out.”

original: skrod pa'i ltung ba'o /
analyzed: skrod pa'i ltung ba'o /
translated: It is the downfall of “driving out.”

original: // / lta ba dan pa la sogs pas rgol na'o //
analyzed: // / lta ba dan pa la sogs pas rgol na'o //
translated: If one accuses someone of a downfall, such as a view, and so on.

original: ltung ba man chad gcig las nyes pa zhig byung ngo zhes skur na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba man chad gcig las nyes pa zhig byung ngo zhes skur na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one accuses someone of having committed a downfall, such as a partial defeat, and so on, it is a downfall.

original: 'tshe bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe bar chud pa'o //
translated: It is included in “harming.”

original: skur cing 'tshe ba'i ltung ba'o /
analyzed: skur cing 'tshe ba'i ltung ba'o /
translated: It is the downfall of “accusing and harming.”

original: // / mna' 'dor ba yang ngo //
analyzed: // / mna' 'dor ba yang ngo //
translated: If one swears an oath.

original: dge slong mas mna' bor na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas mna' bor na ltung ba'o //
translated: If a nun swears an oath, it is a downfall.

original: bzlog pas ston par chud pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pas ston par chud pa'o //
translated: It is included in “teaching by reversing.”

original: mna' 'dor ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mna' 'dor ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: It is the downfall of “swearing an oath.”

original: khros par bdag la bsnun na'o //
analyzed: khros par bdag la bsnun na'o //
translated: If I get angry with myself and beat myself, I fall.

original: bdag la bdag khros shing bdag la brdegs sam lus rdebs na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la bdag khros shing bdag la brdegs sam lus rdebs na ltung ba'o //
translated: If I get angry with myself and beat myself, I fall.

original: mi brtan par sgyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi brtan par sgyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: I make myself unstable.

original: bdag la rdeg pa'i ltung ba'o /
analyzed: bdag la rdeg pa'i ltung ba'o /
translated: If I beat myself, I fall.

original: // / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun rnams la 'phya ba'o //
analyzed: // / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun rnams la 'phya ba'o //
translated: I criticize the community of nuns.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la nyes so zhes 'phyas byed na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la nyes so zhes 'phyas byed na ltung ba'o //
translated: If I criticize the community of nuns, saying, “They are at fault,” I fall.

original: rgyab yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyab yang ngo //
translated: I turn my back.

original: dge 'dun la rgya gang zer zhing spyod na'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la rgya gang zer zhing spyod na'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If I say, “What is the community?” and act like that, I fall.

original: 'khor gyi thu bo la chu 'thor ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi thu bo la chu 'thor ba'o //
translated: I sprinkle water on the head of the chief of the assembly.

original: dge slong pha la chus gtor na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong pha la chus gtor na ltung ba'o //
translated: If I sprinkle water on a monk, I fall.

original: ltung ba med pa ni brgyal na'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni brgyal na'o //
translated: There is no offense if he is unconscious.

original: dge slong pha brgyal ba la chus 'thor ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong pha brgyal ba la chus 'thor ba ni nyes med do //
translated: If I sprinkle water on an unconscious monk, there is no offense.

original: dge slong la mchil mas mi gdab /
analyzed: dge slong la mchil mas mi gdab /
translated: I should not spit on a monk.

original: dge slong pha la @200b mchil mas gtor na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong pha la @200b mchil mas gtor na nyes byas /
translated: If I spit on a monk, I commit an offense.

original: rkog tu dge slong pa la dmigs te thub 'di ces byas na nyes byas rab tu 'byung ba 'di la mi brgyad /
analyzed: rkog tu dge slong pa la dmigs te thub 'di ces byas na nyes byas rab tu 'byung ba 'di la mi brgyad /
translated: If one says, “This is a monk,” with reference to a monk, but in a hidden way, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong pho mo dang dge slong ma la spyo zhing brgyad na yang nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong pho mo dang dge slong ma la spyo zhing brgyad na yang nyes byas /
translated: If one scolds and berates a fully ordained monk or nun, it is a minor infraction.

original: gnyis kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is so for two.

original: dge slong pho mo gnyis la spyo zhing brgyad na yang nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong pho mo gnyis la spyo zhing brgyad na yang nyes byas /
translated: If one scolds and berates both a monk and a nun, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong gi mdun du spyod yul mi spyad /
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du spyod yul mi spyad /
translated: One should not engage in the conduct of the domain in front of a monk.

original: dge slong slong mo spyod pa la dge slong mas dge slong ma mthong bar sngon du khyim pa'i khyim du song ste yibs nas dge slong 'ongs pa dang zan ma btsos so zhes khyim pa yin pa skad du smras te dge slong slar bzlog cing g-yo byas na
analyzed: dge slong slong mo spyod pa la dge slong mas dge slong ma mthong bar sngon du khyim pa'i khyim du song ste yibs nas dge slong 'ongs pa dang zan ma btsos so zhes khyim pa yin pa skad du smras te dge slong slar bzlog cing g-yo byas na
translated: If a fully ordained nun goes to the house of a layperson before a fully ordained monk who is begging for alms, hides, and when the monk arrives says to the layperson, “I did not cook the food,” and turns the monk away,🔽it is a downfall.

original: ltung ba / zam pa mi brten pa la dge slong dang lhan cig tu mi 'gro //
analyzed: ltung ba / zam pa mi brten pa la dge slong dang lhan cig tu mi 'gro //
translated: One should not go with a monk on an unsafe bridge.

original: zam pa ldem pa la dge slong sngar btang zhing dge slong mas phyi bzhin 'gro ste zam pa bsgul na nyes byas //
analyzed: zam pa ldem pa la dge slong sngar btang zhing dge slong mas phyi bzhin 'gro ste zam pa bsgul na nyes byas //
translated: If the bridge is swaying, the monk should go first, and the nun should follow. If the bridge sways, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong mthong ma thag tu stan las 'pho //
analyzed: dge slong mthong ma thag tu stan las 'pho //
translated: As soon as she sees a monk, she should rise from her seat.

original: dge slong pha 'ong ba mthong nas dge slong ma mkhas shing na rgan kyang stan las 'phag go //
analyzed: dge slong pha 'ong ba mthong nas dge slong ma mkhas shing na rgan kyang stan las 'phag go //
translated: If a nun sees a monk coming, she should rise from her seat, even if she is learned and old.

original: 'dug nas 'greng ba 'di la 'dug ces bsgo //
analyzed: 'dug nas 'greng ba 'di la 'dug ces bsgo //
translated: If she is sitting and he is standing, she should say, “Sit down!”

original: dge slong la 'dug la dge slong ma 'greng zhing 'khod pa la 'dug shig ces ma smras na dge slong pha nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong la 'dug la dge slong ma 'greng zhing 'khod pa la 'dug shig ces ma smras na dge slong pha nyes byas /
translated: If a monk is sitting and a nun is standing or sitting, he should not say, “Sit down!” If he does not do this, it is a minor infraction for the monk.

original: ma byas na gsol te 'dug par bya /
analyzed: ma byas na gsol te 'dug par bya /
translated: If he does not do this, he should sit down after asking permission.

original: dge slong phas dge slong ma la 'dug mi zer na 'dug na nyes sam ma nyes zhes zhus la 'khod do //
analyzed: dge slong phas dge slong ma la 'dug mi zer na 'dug na nyes sam ma nyes zhes zhus la 'khod do //
translated: If a monk does not tell a nun to sit down, he should ask, “Is it a minor or a major infraction?” and then sit down.

original: lci bar 'gyur ba bcad bar chud pa'o //🔽dge 'dun dang dge slong la 'phya zhing 'chal ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: lci bar 'gyur ba bcad bar chud pa'o // dge 'dun dang dge slong la 'phya zhing 'chal ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: It is a serious offense to interrupt a discussion.🔽It is a downfall to mock the Saṅgha or a monk.

original: dge slong ma'i 'thab mo la nus pa yod la zhi bar ma byas na'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i 'thab mo la nus pa yod la zhi bar ma byas na'o //
translated: It is a downfall to be unable to resolve a dispute among nuns.

original: dge slong ma 'thab cing 'khod pa la bdag gis thab mo zhi bar nus la ma bcug na ltung ba'o //🔽'khrug pa g-yel ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'thab cing 'khod pa la bdag gis thab mo zhi bar nus la ma bcug na ltung ba'o // 'khrug pa g-yel ba'o //
translated: If a nun is quarreling, and I am able to settle the dispute, but I do not do so, I have committed an offense.🔽To be quarrelsome.

original: 'thab pa ma bcug pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa ma bcug pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: To not settle a dispute.

original: dad pa byin nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa byin nas gnas pa'o //
translated: To accept offerings of faith.

original: dge 'dun ma'i las ci byed kyang rung dad pa'i 'dri pa la dad pa sngar byin pa yin mod ces phyi ma mi ster cing khyig na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun ma'i las ci byed kyang rung dad pa'i 'dri pa la dad pa sngar byin pa yin mod ces phyi ma mi ster cing khyig na ltung ba'o //
translated: If I do not give to a faithful person who has previously given to me, and I hold back, saying, “I have already received offerings from you,” I have committed an offense.

original: ga ma spra'i rtsed mor chud pa'o//
analyzed: ga ma spra'i rtsed mor chud pa'o//
translated: To be like a prostitute.

original: dad pa mi ster cing ga ma spra byed pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa mi ster cing ga ma spra byed pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: To not give to a faithful person, and to act like a prostitute.🔽To not listen to the teachings.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing dge slong la 'chad pa'i ston par myong na'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing dge slong la 'chad pa'i ston par myong na'o //
translated: If I do not listen to the teachings from a monk every half-month,

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing dbyar mo thang du dge slong pa las chos 'chad pa spyan ma drangs shing ma bshad dam /🔽pho'i gtsug lag khang du chos nyan du ma song na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing dbyar mo thang du dge slong pa las chos 'chad pa spyan ma drangs shing ma bshad dam / pho'i gtsug lag khang du chos nyan du ma song na ltung ba'o //
translated: or if I do not invite a monk to teach the Dharma at the summer retreat every half-month, or if I do not teach the Dharma,
or if I do not go to a monastery to listen to the teachings, I have committed an offense.

original: slong med par gso sbyong byed pa'o //
analyzed: slong med par gso sbyong byed pa'o //
translated: To perform the poṣadha ceremony without a monk.🔽To perform the poṣadha ceremony without a monk.

original: gso spyod byed pa'i tshe dge slong pha kun las dad pa ma dris na ltung ba /
analyzed: gso spyod byed pa'i tshe dge slong pha kun las dad pa ma dris na ltung ba /
translated: When one is being treated, it is a downfall not to ask all the monks for permission.

original: gsol ba'i las kyis chos 'chad par bskos pa'i dge slong zhig yod na de la dad pa dris pas chog ste kun la ma dris kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gsol ba'i las kyis chos 'chad par bskos pa'i dge slong zhig yod na de la dad pa dris pas chog ste kun la ma dris kyang nyes med do //
translated: If there is a monk who has been appointed to teach the doctrine by means of a formal procedure of proposal, it is sufficient to ask him for permission. It is not necessary to ask all the monks, and there is no fault if one does not.

original: dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar tshul du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar tshul du zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is a downfall to enter the rainy season retreat in a place where there are no monks.

original: dge slong gi gtsug lag khang nas bar rgyang grags phyed las ring pa zhig tu tshul du zhugs na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi gtsug lag khang nas bar rgyang grags phyed las ring pa zhig tu tshul du zhugs na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is a downfall to enter the rainy season retreat in a place that is more than a half league from a temple where monks reside.

original: dbyar tshul du zhugs pa las dge 'dun gnyis la gnas gsum gyis ma byung na'o //
analyzed: dbyar tshul du zhugs pa las dge 'dun gnyis la gnas gsum gyis ma byung na'o //
translated: It is a downfall not to leave the rainy season retreat when one of the two sanghas in the area has committed one of the three actions that require the community to suspend the precepts.

original: dge slong ma tshul nas byung ba'i tshe dge 'dun pho mo gnyis la sogs pa la ltung ba sde lnga la mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa yod na rgol cig ces skabs phye la tshul nas 'byung ste de ltar ma byas na ltung bar yang 'gyur
analyzed: dge slong ma tshul nas byung ba'i tshe dge 'dun pho mo gnyis la sogs pa la ltung ba sde lnga la mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa yod na rgol cig ces skabs phye la tshul nas 'byung ste de ltar ma byas na ltung bar yang 'gyur
translated: When a nun has committed a downfall, she must request the monks and nuns to give her permission to leave the nunnery and confess her offense in the community of monks. If she does not do this, she incurs a downfall.

original: / tshul 'byung ba'i las su yang mi rung /🔽lci ba'i chos las 'gal bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: / tshul 'byung ba'i las su yang mi rung / lci ba'i chos las 'gal bar chud pa'o //
translated: It is to be unfit for the work of the monastic community.🔽It is to be in conflict with the heavy rules.

original: lci ba'i chos las rgal ba'i ltung ba'o //🔽dbul po la drubs pa slong ba'o //
analyzed: lci ba'i chos las rgal ba'i ltung ba'o // dbul po la drubs pa slong ba'o //
translated: It is to fall from the heavy rules.🔽It is to ask a poor person to sew.

original: gding ba 'drub pa'i gos khyim bdag dbul po la bslangs na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gding ba 'drub pa'i gos khyim bdag dbul po la bslangs na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is to ask a poor householder to sew a mat.

original: drubs pa dbyung ba'i phyir tshogs pa'i dgrol ba ma byin na'o //
analyzed: drubs pa dbyung ba'i phyir tshogs pa'i dgrol ba ma byin na'o //
translated: It is to not give the allowance to the assembly for the sake of removing the sewing.

original: drubs pa 'byin pa'i tshe bdag dge 'dun nang du ma 'dus sam dad phas ma byin na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: drubs pa 'byin pa'i tshe bdag dge 'dun nang du ma 'dus sam dad phas ma byin na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is to fall when, in order to remove the sewing, one does not join the saṅgha or when one does not receive the allowance from a layperson.

original: gos bgo ba'i phyir na yang ngo //
analyzed: gos bgo ba'i phyir na yang ngo //
translated: It is also for the sake of wearing the robe.

original: drubs pa phyung nas dge 'dun nor 'god pa la dad pas ma byin na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: drubs pa phyung nas dge 'dun nor 'god pa la dad pas ma byin na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is to fall when, after removing the sewing, one does not give the allowance to the saṅgha because of faith in the laypeople.

original: des nor mi 'dod na ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: des nor mi 'dod na ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is not to be done if one does not want the allowance.

original: dge 'dun nor 'god pa la bdag nor skal mi 'dod de mi len tam mtshams kyi phyi rol du song na nyes med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun nor 'god pa la bdag nor skal mi 'dod de mi len tam mtshams kyi phyi rol du song na nyes med do //
translated: It is not a downfall if one does not want the allowance from the saṅgha and does not accept it, or if one goes outside the boundary.

original: pha rol la phongs par spyod par chud pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol la phongs par spyod par chud pa'o //
translated: It is to be in conflict with the practice of not being miserly.

original: pha rol po phongs shing mi bde bar 'gyur ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po phongs shing mi bde bar 'gyur ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: It is a downfall to cause others to suffer and become destitute.

original: dbyar mo thang la ma byas par song ba'o //
analyzed: dbyar mo thang la ma byas par song ba'o //
translated: It is a downfall to go to the summer pasture without having prepared it.

original: gud du 'gro ste dge slong ma gzhan med na lha khang gi srung ma ma bzhag gam gzhan la ma bcol bar song na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gud du 'gro ste dge slong ma gzhan med na lha khang gi srung ma ma bzhag gam gzhan la ma bcol bar song na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is a downfall to go to a temple without leaving a guard to watch over the nuns’ quarters or without asking someone to take care of the nuns.

original: mtshams gtang pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams gtang pa'o //
translated: It is a downfall to leave the boundaries.

original: ltung ba ni song nas 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu 'das na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni song nas 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu 'das na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is a downfall to go beyond forty-nine fathoms.

original: dbyar mo thang gi gla mi blang /
analyzed: dbyar mo thang gi gla mi blang /
translated: It is a downfall to accept payment for work during the summer pasture.

original: gtsug lag khang glar btang zhing gla blangs na nyes byas /🔽khyim gyi don dang bdag gi don kyang ma yin /🔽lha ris kyi zhing dang nor la sogs pa sngar thang bcad de khyim pa @201b gang yang rung sbyor zhing 'dug pa la khe yod pa'i phyir snga ma las phrogs te gzhan la byed du bcug na ltung ba /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang glar btang zhing gla blangs na nyes byas / khyim gyi don dang bdag gi don kyang ma yin / lha ris kyi zhing dang nor la sogs pa sngar thang bcad de khyim pa @201b gang yang rung sbyor zhing 'dug pa la khe yod pa'i phyir snga ma las phrogs te gzhan la byed du bcug na ltung ba /
translated: It is a minor infraction to rent a temple and to accept payment for renting it.🔽It is a downfall to take away a plow, etc., that was lent for the sake of the community or for the sake of the doctrine, and to give it to someone else.🔽It is a downfall to take away a plow, etc., that was lent for the sake of the community or for the sake of the doctrine, and to give it to someone else.

original: dbyar mo thang la rgyas par byed par chud pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar mo thang la rgyas par byed par chud pa'o //
translated: It is a downfall to take away a plow, etc., that was lent for the sake of the community or for the sake of the doctrine, and to give it to someone else.🔽It is a downfall to take away a plow, etc., that was lent for the sake of the community or for the sake of the doctrine, and to give it to someone else.🔽It is a downfall to take away a plow, etc., that was lent for the sake of the community or for the sake of the doctrine, and to give it to someone else.

original: gtsug lag khang la rgyas par byed pa'i ltung ba'o /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la rgyas par byed pa'i ltung ba'o /
translated: This is the downfall.

original: // / dbyar gyi bar du yul rgyu ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: // / dbyar gyi bar du yul rgyu ba spyod pa'o //
translated: To travel in the summer.

original: dbyar tshul du zhugs nas dge slong ma gnas gud du zhag gcig kyang mi dbang ste gud du song zhing zhag lon na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dbyar tshul du zhugs nas dge slong ma gnas gud du zhag gcig kyang mi dbang ste gud du song zhing zhag lon na ltung ba'o //
translated: After having entered the rainy season retreat, a nun is not allowed to stay even one night away from the nunnery. If she stays away for one night, this is a downfall.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bar chad mngon par 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bar chad mngon par 'dug pa'o //
translated: There is no downfall if there are manifest obstacles.

original: tshul na 'dug pa'i tshe srog la dma' ba dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba'i rkyen cig byung ba ni gud du song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: tshul na 'dug pa'i tshe srog la dma' ba dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba'i rkyen cig byung ba ni gud du song yang nyes med do //
translated: If, while in the rainy season retreat, a nun is threatened with loss of life or loss of chastity, she may leave and there is no fault.

original: dbyar gnas nas ma spyad pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar gnas nas ma spyad pa'o //
translated: To not make use of the rainy season retreat.

original: dbyar gyi tshul nas byung nas tshul na 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas de las gud du 'phos te ma song na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi tshul nas byung nas tshul na 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas de las gud du 'phos te ma song na ltung ba'o //
translated: If, after having entered the rainy season retreat, a nun does not leave the place where she is staying for the retreat, this is a downfall.

original: gnas gud du song ste zhag gcig lon na tshul gyi tshe gnas gnas pa der slar gnas na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes t'i ka las 'chad /
analyzed: gnas gud du song ste zhag gcig lon na tshul gyi tshe gnas gnas pa der slar gnas na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes t'i ka las 'chad /
translated: If she goes to another place and stays there for one night, she must return to the place where she was staying for the retreat. If she does so, there is no downfall, according to the Tikā.

original: nyin gcig gud du song ste slar gnas pa tsam gyis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig gis bshad /
analyzed: nyin gcig gud du song ste slar gnas pa tsam gyis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig gis bshad /
translated: Some who hold the Vinaya explain that it is not a downfall merely to go out for a day and then return.

original: dgos pa yod la 'khor du spyod pa'i lam na rkun po dang chom po dang gcan gzan la sogs pa 'jigs pa'i rkyen yod bzhin du dge slong ma lam du zhugs te song na ltung ba'o //🔽'khrugs par yang ngo //
analyzed: dgos pa yod la 'khor du spyod pa'i lam na rkun po dang chom po dang gcan gzan la sogs pa 'jigs pa'i rkyen yod bzhin du dge slong ma lam du zhugs te song na ltung ba'o // 'khrugs par yang ngo //
translated: If a fully ordained nun travels on a road where there are conditions of fear, such as thieves, bandits, wild animals, and so on, and she does so without a companion, she incurs a downfall.

original: yul 'khrugs shing gcig la gcig gnod par byed cing dmag 'gyed pa lta bu yod bzhin du zhugs te song na ltung ba'o //🔽spyod pa dang mi spyod par chud pa'o //
analyzed: yul 'khrugs shing gcig la gcig gnod par byed cing dmag 'gyed pa lta bu yod bzhin du zhugs te song na ltung ba'o // spyod pa dang mi spyod par chud pa'o //
translated: If she travels in a place where there is conflict, such as a place where people are fighting and harming each other, she incurs a downfall.

original: gud du song ba dang ma song ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gud du song ba dang ma song ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If she travels in a place where there is no conflict, she does not incur a downfall.

original: lha'i rigs la sogs pa dang // mur 'dug gi gnas su song ste rgol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rigs la sogs pa dang // mur 'dug gi gnas su song ste rgol bar byed pa'o //
translated: If she travels to the abode of nonhuman beings, such as gods, she incurs a downfall.🔽If she travels to the abode of nonhuman beings, such as demons, she incurs a downfall.

original: mur 'dug gi lha'i 'khor dang mur 'dug gi grong dang zhang blon dang mi dra ma la sogs pa'i khyim du song zhing chos bsnyems shing gol du 'gro na ltung ba'o //🔽'dri zhing rmed pa'i skabs ma byas par ro //
analyzed: mur 'dug gi lha'i 'khor dang mur 'dug gi grong dang zhang blon dang mi dra ma la sogs pa'i khyim du song zhing chos bsnyems shing gol du 'gro na ltung ba'o // 'dri zhing rmed pa'i skabs ma byas par ro //

original: smra ba las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra ba las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one teaches the Dharma to a lay person who is a devotee of another religion, or to a lay person who is a heretic, or to a lay person who is a tīrthika, without first being invited, and without first asking permission, and without first asking if they have any questions, and without first preparing a seat, and without first showing respect, and without first asking if they have any questions, one commits an offense.

original: phyi rol gyi sar gcig pu 'gro na'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sar gcig pu 'gro na'o //
translated: If one teaches the Dharma to a lay person who is a devotee of another religion, or to a lay person who is a heretic,

original: mtshan mo dge slong ma gcig pu phyi rol che chung du song na ltung ba'o //🔽rtsva sngon po la bshang ba 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo dge slong ma gcig pu phyi rol che chung du song na ltung ba'o // rtsva sngon po la bshang ba 'dor ba'o //
translated: If a nun goes out alone at night, even a little way, it is a downfall.🔽To defecate or urinate on green plants.

original: rtsva la sogs pa sngon po skye ba'i thog tu bshang gci btang zhing por ba'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa sngon po skye ba'i thog tu bshang gci btang zhing por ba'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: To defecate or urinate on green plants or grass is a downfall.

original: ltung ba med pa ni na na'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni na na'o //
translated: There is no downfall if one is sick.

original: nad pa ni bshang gci rtsva sngon po'i gnas su 'gro mi phod pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nad pa ni bshang gci rtsva sngon po'i gnas su 'gro mi phod pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: A sick person who cannot go to a place where there are no green plants does not commit a downfall.

original: rtsva sngon pos thams cad du yog na yang ngo //
analyzed: rtsva sngon pos thams cad du yog na yang ngo //
translated: Even if the whole area is covered with green plants.

original: rtsva sngon pos thams cad du g-yogs te bshang gci bya ba'i sa med na bshang gci byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: rtsva sngon pos thams cad du g-yogs te bshang gci bya ba'i sa med na bshang gci byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: If there is no place to defecate or urinate because the whole area is covered with green plants, there is no downfall in defecating or urinating there.

original: rtsig pa'i 'gram du ma brtags par ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa'i 'gram du ma brtags par ro //
translated: To defecate or urinate without checking whether there are people nearby.

original: bshang gci snod kyi nang nas 'dor na rtsig drung la sogs pa na ci yod pa brtags shing dor ro //
analyzed: bshang gci snod kyi nang nas 'dor na rtsig drung la sogs pa na ci yod pa brtags shing dor ro //
translated: If one defecates or urinates in a container, one should check whether there are people nearby.

original: ltung ba med pa ni pu shus bskor ba'i rtsig pa na'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni pu shus bskor ba'i rtsig pa na'o //
translated: There is no downfall if one defecates or urinates in a place surrounded by a wall.

original: khang pa pu shu can gyi steng nas bshang gci 'dor ba ni blta zhing brtag tu mi rung bas ma brtags par bor yang nyes med do //
analyzed: khang pa pu shu can gyi steng nas bshang gci 'dor ba ni blta zhing brtag tu mi rung bas ma brtags par bor yang nyes med do //
translated: It is not wrong to throw it away without examining it, because it is improper to look at or examine feces and urine on the roof of a house with a peaked roof.

original: mi gtsang bar bor ba mi dor /
analyzed: mi gtsang bar bor ba mi dor /
translated: Do not throw out filth.🔽Do not throw feces, urine, or filth into a swamp.

original: bshang gci dang mi gtsang ba 'dam rdzab tu bor ba dang mi dor /🔽bshang bar ldan par ro //
analyzed: bshang gci dang mi gtsang ba 'dam rdzab tu bor ba dang mi dor / bshang bar ldan par ro //
translated: Do not defecate in the water.

original: bshang gci byed pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bshang gci byed pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: This is the downfall of defecating.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
translated: The chapter on “only” is finished.

original: dge slong ma'i ltung ba brgya brgyad cu rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i ltung ba brgya brgyad cu rdzogs so /
translated: The one hundred and eight downfalls of fully ordained nuns are finished.

original: // / dge slong ma'i so sor mthol ba bcu gcig la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / dge slong ma'i so sor mthol ba bcu gcig la 'chad de /
translated: The eleven individual confessions of fully ordained nuns are explained as follows:

original: bdag gi phyir rigs gzhan du 'o ma blangs te 'thungs na min na'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir rigs gzhan du 'o ma blangs te 'thungs na min na'o //
translated: If you drink milk that you have requested for yourself from another family, it is not a downfall.

original: bdag min par gnyan ma yin pa las 'o ma blangs na so sor mthol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag min par gnyan ma yin pa las 'o ma blangs na so sor mthol ba'o //
translated: If you drink milk that you have requested for yourself from a non-relative, it is an individual confession.

original: de slong ba ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: de slong ba ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: To request it is a minor offense.

original: 'o ma lag tu ma thob cing ma 'thungs kyi bar du slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: 'o ma lag tu ma thob cing ma 'thungs kyi bar du slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If you request milk but do not obtain it or drink it, it is a minor offense.

original: zho dang mar sar dang zhun mar dang yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram dang sha dang nya sha dang sha skam rnams so //
analyzed: zho dang mar sar dang zhun mar dang yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram dang sha dang nya sha dang sha skam rnams so //
translated: curd, fresh butter, clarified butter, mustard oil, honey, molasses, meat, fish, and dried meat.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams dgu'ang min bar gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag las bslangs shing zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams dgu'ang min bar gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag las bslangs shing zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one eats any of these nine things, which are not mentioned by name, that were asked for from a householder who is not a relative, there is an offense.

original: 'di thob ste gzhan slong na 'bri ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di thob ste gzhan slong na 'bri ba ma yin no //
translated: If one asks for one thing and gets another, there is no offense.

original: 'o ma bslangs pa las zho la sogs pa gang thob kyang mthol ba'o //
analyzed: 'o ma bslangs pa las zho la sogs pa gang thob kyang mthol ba'o //
translated: If one asks for milk and gets curd, etc., one must confess.

original: ngan pa yang ngo //🔽kha zas tshod ma la sogs pa ngan pa zhig bslangs pa @202b las bzang po rnam bcu po gang thob kyang mthol ba /
analyzed: ngan pa yang ngo // kha zas tshod ma la sogs pa ngan pa zhig bslangs pa @202b las bzang po rnam bcu po gang thob kyang mthol ba /
translated: If one asks for something bad,🔽and gets something good, one must confess.

original: 'di thob na'ang der chud do zhes bslangs pa las dar ba thob pa lta bu mthol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thob na'ang der chud do zhes bslangs pa las dar ba thob pa lta bu mthol ba'o //
translated: If one asks for something, saying, “If I get this, I will eat it,” and gets something else, one must confess.

original: zho bslangs pa las rtsab mo lta bu'ang mthol ba'o //
analyzed: zho bslangs pa las rtsab mo lta bu'ang mthol ba'o //
translated: If one asks for curd and gets buttermilk, one must confess.

original: 'di nyes byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyes byed do //
translated: This is a minor offense.

original: dge slong ma tshod ma la sogs pa slong ba'ang nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong ma tshod ma la sogs pa slong ba'ang nyes byas /
translated: If a nun asks for vegetables, etc., it is a minor offense.

original: seng ge yang ngo //
analyzed: seng ge yang ngo //
translated: The lion also agreed.

original: dge slong gis so sor mthol ba bzhi las tha ma dge bsnyen phyug po dbul por sang ba la mi bslang bar dam bcas pa la bslangs pa ni so sor mthol ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis so sor mthol ba bzhi las tha ma dge bsnyen phyug po dbul por sang ba la mi bslang bar dam bcas pa la bslangs pa ni so sor mthol ba'o //
translated: The monk confessed the last of the four individual confessions. He promised not to ask a wealthy lay person to give up his wealth, but he asked a wealthy lay person to give up his wealth. This is an individual confession.

original: so sor mthol ba'o //
analyzed: so sor mthol ba'o //
translated: It is an individual confession.

original: so sor mthol ba bcu gcig rdzogs so /
analyzed: so sor mthol ba bcu gcig rdzogs so /
translated: The eleven individual confessions are complete.

original: // / bslab pa mang po la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / bslab pa mang po la 'chad de /
translated: There are many precepts.

original: brla snang bar sham thabs mi bgo //
analyzed: brla snang bar sham thabs mi bgo //
translated: Do not wear the lower robe over the knees.

original: khyim mi mo 'dron po yo lang gi phyir gos kyi 'og tu rkub kyi rbod bcug ste /
analyzed: khyim mi mo 'dron po yo lang gi phyir gos kyi 'og tu rkub kyi rbod bcug ste /
translated: A lay woman put a cushion under her robe for the sake of a caravan's entertainment.

original: rkub glo bor 'dug pa 'dra ba dge slong mas mi bya /
analyzed: rkub glo bor 'dug pa 'dra ba dge slong mas mi bya /
translated: A nun should not sit as if her buttocks are exposed.

original: chags pa'i grong bar du mi 'gro //
analyzed: chags pa'i grong bar du mi 'gro //
translated: Do not go to a village with desire.

original: dge slong ma 'dod chags kyi sems yod na grong bar du mi 'gro //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'dod chags kyi sems yod na grong bar du mi 'gro //
translated: If a nun has a mind of desire, she should not go to a village.

original: gzhan 'dod chags yod pa'i gror du'ang mi 'gro //
analyzed: gzhan 'dod chags yod pa'i gror du'ang mi 'gro //
translated: She should not go to a village where others have desire.

original: dge slong gi yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gi yang ngo //
translated: It is the same for monks.

original: dge slong pa'i bslab pa mang po thams cad kyang dge slong mas bsrung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong pa'i bslab pa mang po thams cad kyang dge slong mas bsrung ngo //
translated: All the many precepts of monks are to be guarded by nuns.

original: bslab pa'o // dge slong ma'i bslab pa mang po rdzogs so //
analyzed: bslab pa'o // dge slong ma'i bslab pa mang po rdzogs so //
translated: The training.🔽The many trainings of a fully ordained nun are complete.

original: dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs so //
translated: The analysis of the fully ordained nun is complete.

original: dge slong ma'i khrims 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nad nas 'byung ba'i mdo rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i khrims 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nad nas 'byung ba'i mdo rdzogs so /
translated: The sutra that arose from the analysis of the fully ordained nun's ethical precedents is complete.

original: // /'di man chad pa ri ba sha la 'chad de /
analyzed: // /'di man chad pa ri ba sha la 'chad de /
translated: From here on, the explanation is as follows:

original: nyes byas pa ni zhig pa dang ma skyes pas ltung bar sbyar na'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni zhig pa dang ma skyes pas ltung bar sbyar na'o //
translated: If a nun commits a downfall and then disrobes, or if she commits a downfall and then becomes a novice nun, that downfall is not a downfall.

original: de zhes 'byung ba'i mdo man chad la 'chad de /
analyzed: de zhes 'byung ba'i mdo man chad la 'chad de /
translated: The explanation from the sutra that arose from the analysis of the fully ordained nun's ethical precedents is as follows:

original: dge slong phas pham pa phyung ste khrims zhig pa dang khrims rdzogs par byas pa las ma chags pa rnam gnyis ni phas pham pa man chad nyes byas yan chad ltung ba sde lnga las gang byas kyang rung thams cad nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong phas pham pa phyung ste khrims zhig pa dang khrims rdzogs par byas pa las ma chags pa rnam gnyis ni phas pham pa man chad nyes byas yan chad ltung ba sde lnga las gang byas kyang rung thams cad nyes byas so //
translated: If a fully ordained monk commits a defeating offense and then disrobes, or if he commits a defeating offense and then becomes a novice monk, then all five classes of downfalls, from the defeating offenses down to the offenses of wrong conduct, are offenses of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong phas khrims phul ba dang / khrims ma phog par thug thub tu rang byig shur zhugs pa gnyis ni phas pham pa man chad gang byas kyang khyim pa dang 'dra bas nyes byas yod par mi brtsi'o //🔽bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i rab tu 'byung bas blangs pa 'gal na yang ngo //🔽dge sbyong pho dang dge sbyong mo dang dge slob ma gsum ni dge sbyong nyid kyi khrims bcu dang dge slob ma nyid kyi khrims nyi shu rtsa gnyis las gang @203a * //
analyzed: dge slong phas khrims phul ba dang / khrims ma phog par thug thub tu rang byig shur zhugs pa gnyis ni phas pham pa man chad gang byas kyang khyim pa dang 'dra bas nyes byas yod par mi brtsi'o // bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i rab tu 'byung bas blangs pa 'gal na yang ngo // dge sbyong pho dang dge sbyong mo dang dge slob ma gsum ni dge sbyong nyid kyi khrims bcu dang dge slob ma nyid kyi khrims nyi shu rtsa gnyis las gang @203a * //
translated: If a fully ordained monk commits a defeating offense, or if he commits any offense other than a defeating offense, but does not confess it, he is considered to be like a layperson and is not considered to have committed a misdeed.🔽If a fully ordained monk commits a defeating offense, or if he commits any offense other than a defeating offense, but does not confess it, he is considered to be like a layperson and is not considered to have committed a misdeed.

original: byas shing dral kyang rung ste nyes byas so //
analyzed: byas shing dral kyang rung ste nyes byas so //
translated: If a male or female novice or a female probationer commits any offense, whether or not it is a violation of a rule, it is a misdeed.

original: nyes byas de mthol bas tshangs pas phyis khrims dbog tu rung ngo //
analyzed: nyes byas de mthol bas tshangs pas phyis khrims dbog tu rung ngo //
translated: If that misdeed is confessed, the novice is purified and is later suitable to receive the vows.

original: dge sbyong gis phas pham pa bzhi spyad pa dang dge sbyong gi khrims ma chags pas dge sbyong gi khrims bcu las gang dral kyang nyes byas te mthol pas tshangs so //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis phas pham pa bzhi spyad pa dang dge sbyong gi khrims ma chags pas dge sbyong gi khrims bcu las gang dral kyang nyes byas te mthol pas tshangs so //
translated: If a male novice commits any of the four defeating offenses, or if he commits any offense other than a defeating offense, but does not confess it, he is considered to have violated any of the ten rules of a novice monk. If he confesses it, he is purified.

original: mthol ba ni dge slong gcig gi drung du mthol lo //
analyzed: mthol ba ni dge slong gcig gi drung du mthol lo //
translated: Confession is made in the presence of a single fully ordained monk.

original: de'i phyogs yid kyis na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyogs yid kyis na yang ngo //
translated: And it is mentally in the presence of the one who is the object of the offense.

original: dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob ma nyid kyi khrims ma gtogs par dge slong pha dang dge slong mas bsrung ngo cog las gang yang rung ste spyad cing dral na khrims bcu nyid ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob ma nyid kyi khrims ma gtogs par dge slong pha dang dge slong mas bsrung ngo cog las gang yang rung ste spyad cing dral na khrims bcu nyid ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Except for the rules of training of fully ordained monks and nuns and of probationary nuns, any of the rules to be guarded by fully ordained monks and nuns, if transgressed and violated, are not the ten rules themselves.

original: khrims bcu'i char gtogs shing 'dra ba'i bag yin pas nyes byas su 'gyur te khar mthol mi dgos kyi yid la 'gyod pas tshangs shing 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khrims bcu'i char gtogs shing 'dra ba'i bag yin pas nyes byas su 'gyur te khar mthol mi dgos kyi yid la 'gyod pas tshangs shing 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But since they are included in the ten rules and are similar to them, they are downfalls. They are not to be confessed verbally, but are purified and cleansed by mental regret.

original: dge slong pho mos bsrung ba las ming gis smos pa 'di brgyad ni dge slob mas bsrung ba ma yin te dral kyang nyes byas med pas yid kyis 'gyod kyang mi dgos te brgyad gang zhe na gos lhag pa dang lhung bzed dang zhag 'das pa'i ltung ba
analyzed: dge slong pho mos bsrung ba las ming gis smos pa 'di brgyad ni dge slob mas bsrung ba ma yin te dral kyang nyes byas med pas yid kyis 'gyod kyang mi dgos te brgyad gang zhe na gos lhag pa dang lhung bzed dang zhag 'das pa'i ltung ba
translated: Of the rules to be guarded by fully ordained monks and nuns, these eight mentioned by name are not to be guarded by probationary nuns. Even if they are transgressed, there is no downfall. Therefore, there is no need for mental regret. What are the eight? They are the downfalls of an extra robe, an extra begging bowl, and the passing of the boundary.

original: dang chos gos bral ba'i ltung ba dang me la reg pa'i ltung ba dang spags nas za ba'i ltung ba dang / 'bras bu sa bon gyi grong bcom pa'i ltung ba dang rtsva sngon po'i steng du bshang gci dor ba dang shing mi gang yan chad la 'dzegs pa dang 'di brgyad ni dge slob mas ba srung mi dgos te nyes med do //
analyzed: dang chos gos bral ba'i ltung ba dang me la reg pa'i ltung ba dang spags nas za ba'i ltung ba dang / 'bras bu sa bon gyi grong bcom pa'i ltung ba dang rtsva sngon po'i steng du bshang gci dor ba dang shing mi gang yan chad la 'dzegs pa dang 'di brgyad ni dge slob mas ba srung mi dgos te nyes med do //
translated: The eight downfalls that are not to be trangressed by a probationary nun are: to engage in sexual intercourse; to steal; to kill a human being; to lie about one’s level of spiritual attainment; to divulge another’s root downfall; to reveal secrets concerning the tantric teachings; to handle gold; and to touch a man.🔽The eight downfalls that are not to be trangressed by a novice monk or nun are: to engage in sexual intercourse; to steal; to kill a human being; to claim to have attained a high level of spiritual attainment; to declare that one has seen what one has not seen, that is, to lie about having had a vision of a deity; to declare that one has realized what one has not realized, that is, to lie about having had a spiritual experience; to declare that one has attained what one has not attained, that is, to lie about having attained a high level of spiritual attainment; and to declare that one has seen the truth when one has not.🔽The eight downfalls that are not to be trangressed by a fully ordained monk or nun are: to engage in sexual intercourse; to steal; to kill a human being; to claim to have attained a high level of spiritual attainment; to divulge another’s root downfall; to reveal secrets concerning the tantric teachings; to handle gold; and to touch a man.

original: dge slob mas bsrung mi dgos pa brgyad kyi steng du gzhan rin po che la 'dzin pa dang / sa rko ba dang kha zas byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung ba dang kha zas dang zhag lon te spags pa za ba'i ltung ba dang rtsi shing gcod pa'i ltung ba dang 'di lngas bsnan te bcu gsum ni dge sbyong gis ma bsrungs shing dral kyang🔽nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slob mas bsrung mi dgos pa brgyad kyi steng du gzhan rin po che la 'dzin pa dang / sa rko ba dang kha zas byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung ba dang kha zas dang zhag lon te spags pa za ba'i ltung ba dang rtsi shing gcod pa'i ltung ba dang 'di lngas bsnan te bcu gsum ni dge sbyong gis ma bsrungs shing dral kyang🔽nyes med do //
translated: The eight downfalls that are not to be trangressed by a monk who is a master of the ten points of training are: to engage in sexual intercourse; to steal; to kill a human being; to claim to have attained a high level of spiritual attainment; to divulge another’s root downfall; to reveal secrets concerning the tantric teachings; to handle gold; and to touch a man.🔽The eight downfalls that are not to be trangressed by a probationary nun are: to engage in sexual intercourse; to steal; to kill a human being; to claim to have attained a high level of spiritual attainment; to divulge another’s root downfall; to reveal secrets concerning the tantric teachings; to touch gold; and to touch a man.🔽The eight downfalls that are not to be trangressed by a novice monk or nun are: to engage in sexual intercourse; to steal; to kill a human being; to claim to have attained a high level of spiritual attainment; to divulge another’s root downfall; to reveal secrets concerning the tantric teachings; to touch gold; and

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ma gtogs par dge sbyong dang dge slob mas khrims nos shing blangs ba bcu dang nyi shu gnyis ni gang dral kyang nyes byas so //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ma gtogs par dge sbyong dang dge slob mas khrims nos shing blangs ba bcu dang nyi shu gnyis ni gang dral kyang nyes byas so //
translated: Except for the ones mentioned by name, if a probationer or a female novice breaks any of the ten or twelve rules she has taken and accepted, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob mas tshul dral ba yang nyes byas te mthol dgos so //
analyzed: dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob mas tshul dral ba yang nyes byas te mthol dgos so //
translated: If a male or female probationer or a female novice breaks a rule, it is a minor infraction and must be confessed.

original: gso sbyong gi dus su mthol tshangs ma byas pa dang dge sbyong ma dang dge slob ma dge 'dun sde gnyis la tshul @203b nas ma byung ba yang nyes byas te mthol dgos /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi dus su mthol tshangs ma byas pa dang dge sbyong ma dang dge slob ma dge 'dun sde gnyis la tshul @203b nas ma byung ba yang nyes byas te mthol dgos /
translated: If at the time of the purification and restoration ceremony one has not confessed and purified oneself, or if a probationer or a female novice has not confessed and purified herself in the community of two or more members, it is a minor infraction and must be confessed.🔽If one breaks a rule that is part of the ten rules and is similar to a downfall, it is a minor infraction.

original: khrims bcu'i char gtogs shing bag 'dra ba dral na nyes byas su 'gyur zhing yid kyis 'gyod de tshangs pa ni khrims bcu so sor 'di 'drar sdud de so sor gtogs shing bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khrims bcu'i char gtogs shing bag 'dra ba dral na nyes byas su 'gyur zhing yid kyis 'gyod de tshangs pa ni khrims bcu so sor 'di 'drar sdud de so sor gtogs shing bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the individual rules that are included in the ten rules?

original: thog ma byig shu'i tshul mnos shing blangs pas na khyim pa'i rgyan dang khyim pa'i spyod do cog ltar byed na yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te byig shu'i tshul mnos shing blangs pa'i nang du bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma byig shu'i tshul mnos shing blangs pas na khyim pa'i rgyan dang khyim pa'i spyod do cog ltar byed na yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te byig shu'i tshul mnos shing blangs pa'i nang du bsdu ba'o //
translated: If one first takes up the way of the Vṛji and then acts like a householder, wearing householder ornaments and engaging in all householder activities, one will regret it and it will be a fault of a pure one.

original: ma byin par blangs na nyes byas te mthol dgos pa yin na bdag gir dgos pa'i phyir slong zhing tshol ba la sogs pa rku ba'i char gtogs shing bag 'dra ba'i phyir yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te ma byin par len pa'i nang du bsdu'o
analyzed: ma byin par blangs na nyes byas te mthol dgos pa yin na bdag gir dgos pa'i phyir slong zhing tshol ba la sogs pa rku ba'i char gtogs shing bag 'dra ba'i phyir yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te ma byin par len pa'i nang du bsdu'o
translated: If one takes what is not given and it is a fault that must be confessed, then because it must be taken as one’s own, it is a fault of a pure one that is included in taking what is not given because it is similar to stealing, such as begging and searching for it, and because of regret.

original: // gser la reg pa ni nyes byas pa ste mthol ba yin na gser dngul byas so cog dang rin po che dang rin po che la gtogs so cog la bzung ba ni gser dngul gyi char gtogs pas nyes byas te yid kyis 'gyod pa tshangs par gyur te
analyzed: // gser la reg pa ni nyes byas pa ste mthol ba yin na gser dngul byas so cog dang rin po che dang rin po che la gtogs so cog la bzung ba ni gser dngul gyi char gtogs pas nyes byas te yid kyis 'gyod pa tshangs par gyur te
translated: Touching gold is a fault that must be confessed. If one holds gold, silver, and all precious things and things belonging to precious things, it is a fault that is included in gold and silver because it is a fault of a pure one that is mentally regretted.

original: gser dngul la mi reg pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: gser dngul la mi reg pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
translated: Not to touch gold and silver is included in the confession of faults.

original: phyi dro zan zos pa ni mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te kha zas ma brtags pa sgog pa la sogs pa zos pa ni yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te phyi dro zan mi za ba'i nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: phyi dro zan zos pa ni mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te kha zas ma brtags pa sgog pa la sogs pa zos pa ni yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te phyi dro zan mi za ba'i nang du bsdu'o //
translated: Eating in the evening is a fault that should be confessed. Eating garlic and so forth without examining the food is a fault that should be confessed. Eating in the evening is included in the confession of faults.

original: rol mo glu gar byas na mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te chu'i nang du rtse ba la sogs pa rtse'o cog rol mo glu gar gyi char gtogs shing bag 'dra ba'i phyir yid la 'gyod cing tshangs pa'i nyes byas te /
analyzed: rol mo glu gar byas na mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te chu'i nang du rtse ba la sogs pa rtse'o cog rol mo glu gar gyi char gtogs shing bag 'dra ba'i phyir yid la 'gyod cing tshangs pa'i nyes byas te /
translated: Dancing, singing, and playing music is a fault that should be confessed. Playing in water and so forth is included in dancing, singing, and playing music because it is frivolous and causes regret and a fault that should be confessed.

original: rol mo glu gar gyi nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: rol mo glu gar gyi nang du bsdu'o //
translated: Dancing, singing, and playing music is included in the confession of faults.

original: mi tshangs par spyod na'ang mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te 'dod chags kyi sems kyis pho mtshan la 'dzin pa dang khu ba 'byin pa dang gcig gi steng du gcig zhon pa la sogs pa byed do cog yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te mi
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod na'ang mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te 'dod chags kyi sems kyis pho mtshan la 'dzin pa dang khu ba 'byin pa dang gcig gi steng du gcig zhon pa la sogs pa byed do cog yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te mi
translated: With a mind of desire, if one holds the male organ, emits semen, mounts one on top of the other, and so on, it is a fault that must be confessed.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
translated: It is included in impure conduct.🔽If one kills, it is a fault that must be confessed.🔽If one harms by beating, binding, or throwing out, and so on, it is a fault that must be confessed.

original: srog gcod na mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te brdeg pa dang 'ju ba dang nan la 'dor ba la sogs pa gnod par byed do cog yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te srog gcod pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: srog gcod na mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te brdeg pa dang 'ju ba dang nan la 'dor ba la sogs pa gnod par byed do cog yid la 'gyod de tshangs pa'i nyes byas te srog gcod pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
translated: It is included in killing.

original: chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro zhes thog ma khas @204a * //
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro zhes thog ma khas @204a * //
translated: If one says, “I go for refuge to the Dharma and the Saṅgha,” it is a fault that must be confessed.

original: blangs pas dge slong dang dge 'dun dang chos dang mi 'grogs par khyim pa dang shan pa dang rol mo mkhan dang chang 'tshong ba dang mur 'dug pa la sogs pa dang 'grogs shing bsten pa yang yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te chos dang dge🔽'dun la skyabs su song ba'i nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: blangs pas dge slong dang dge 'dun dang chos dang mi 'grogs par khyim pa dang shan pa dang rol mo mkhan dang chang 'tshong ba dang mur 'dug pa la sogs pa dang 'grogs shing bsten pa yang yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba'i nang du bsdu'o //
translated: This is a fault of pure conduct, and is included in the category of those who have gone for refuge in the Dharma and the community.

original: thog ma sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro'o zhes khas blangs pas na sangs rgyas la bsten cing gus par bya ba yin te tshul khrims bsrung ba la g-yel ba dang dkon mchog gsum la ma gus shing rim gro chung ba la sogs pa thams cad sangs rgyas la
analyzed: thog ma sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro'o zhes khas blangs pas na sangs rgyas la bsten cing gus par bya ba yin te tshul khrims bsrung ba la g-yel ba dang dkon mchog gsum la ma gus shing rim gro chung ba la sogs pa thams cad sangs rgyas la
translated: Since one has accepted the words, “First, I go for refuge to the Buddha,” one should rely on and respect the Buddha. All of the following are faults of pure conduct: being lax in guarding morality, being disrespectful to the Three Jewels, having little reverence, and so on.

original: skyabs su song ba'i phyir gtogs shing bag 'dra bas yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ba'i nang du bsdus te sangs rgyas la ma gus pa ni mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas so //🔽thog ma sh'akya'i rjes su 'byung ngo zhes bya bas na sh'akya'i rjes su slob cing nyes med par dag par bya ba yin te mthol tshangs ma byas shing nyes pa ma mthol to cog sh'akya'i rjes su 'byung ba'i nang du bsdu'o //🔽phyi dro kha zas zos na mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te kha zas ma brtags pa sgog pa la sogs pa zos pa ni yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te phyi dro kha zas mi za ba'i nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: skyabs su song ba'i phyir gtogs shing bag 'dra bas yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ba'i nang du bsdus te sangs rgyas la ma gus pa ni mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas so // thog ma sh'akya'i rjes su 'byung ngo zhes bya bas na sh'akya'i rjes su slob cing nyes med par dag par bya ba yin te mthol tshangs ma byas shing nyes pa ma mthol to cog sh'akya'i rjes su 'byung ba'i nang du bsdu'o // phyi dro kha zas zos na mthol dgos pa'i nyes byas yin te kha zas ma brtags pa sgog pa la sogs pa zos pa ni yid la 'gyod pas tshangs pa'i nyes byas te phyi dro kha zas mi za ba'i nang du bsdu'o //
translated: Since one has gone for refuge, one should confess one's faults with regret.
