original: slob pa byin pa'i dge slong gis kyang dge slong gi khrims nyis brgya lnga ba cu ci ltar bsrung ba bzhin bya zhing bsrung ngo //🔽slob pa byin pa la dge slong la la zhig gis bskrad dam /
analyzed: slob pa byin pa'i dge slong gis kyang dge slong gi khrims nyis brgya lnga ba cu ci ltar bsrung ba bzhin bya zhing bsrung ngo // slob pa byin pa la dge slong la la zhig gis bskrad dam /
translated: The monk who has been granted probation should observe and guard the two hundred and fifty rules of the monk just as they are to be observed and guarded.

original: brdegs sam / gos byin te slar 'phrogs pa na dge slong la byas pa bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdegs sam / gos byin te slar 'phrogs pa na dge slong la byas pa bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk should expel, beat, give clothing to and then take it back from a monk who has been granted probation, he would incur a downfall as if he had done it to a monk.

original: dge slong nan di ka zhes bya ba thog ma nas mthol bar ba sems nas mi tshangs par spyad nas de ma thag tu sangs rgyas la mthol du song ste tshe gcig gi bar du slob pa byin pa la gnas shing chad pa byed phod dam zhes smras
analyzed: dge slong nan di ka zhes bya ba thog ma nas mthol bar ba sems nas mi tshangs par spyad nas de ma thag tu sangs rgyas la mthol du song ste tshe gcig gi bar du slob pa byin pa la gnas shing chad pa byed phod dam zhes smras
translated: A monk called Nandika, having had sexual intercourse with an impure thought from the beginning, immediately went to confess to the Buddha. He was granted probation for the remainder of his life. He asked, “Can I endure the penalty?”

original: nas phod do zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir slob pa byin te gzhag pa las bcas /
analyzed: nas phod do zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir slob pa byin te gzhag pa las bcas /
translated: Since he promised, “I can,” he was granted probation and placed on probation.

original: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same for one who is not fully ordained.

original: slob pa byin pa nyid kyis ni dge slong bzhin du bsrung dgos pa yin na dge slong rnams kyis ni slob pa byin bde la dge sbyong dang 'dra @204b bar lta'o //🔽dge sbyong dang 'dra bas byin len bya ba dang mi bla ma'i chos smra ba dang des zan zos pa dang lhan cig tu nyal ba la sogs pa yang dag sbyong la nyes par 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba bzhin du slob pa byin pa yang de dang
analyzed: slob pa byin pa nyid kyis ni dge slong bzhin du bsrung dgos pa yin na dge slong rnams kyis ni slob pa byin bde la dge sbyong dang 'dra @204b bar lta'o // dge sbyong dang 'dra bas byin len bya ba dang mi bla ma'i chos smra ba dang des zan zos pa dang lhan cig tu nyal ba la sogs pa yang dag sbyong la nyes par 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba bzhin du slob pa byin pa yang de dang
translated: If a novice monk is given full ordination, he must be guarded like a fully ordained monk, but fully ordained monks view a novice who is given full ordination as equal to a fully ordained monk.

original: 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is equal to a fully ordained monk, then it would follow that he would be subject to and not subject to the training rules of fully ordained monks, such as accepting alms, being a teacher of the Dharma, sleeping with a woman, and so on.

original: der ma yin /
analyzed: der ma yin /
translated: It is not so.

original: slob pa byin pa mang zhig yod na nang gcig la gcig dge slong yon tan dang ldan pa nang gcig la gcig rung ba dang mi rung ba bzhin du slob ba byin pa nang yang de bzhin te gcig gis byin len byas na der bzar rung gcig gis
analyzed: slob pa byin pa mang zhig yod na nang gcig la gcig dge slong yon tan dang ldan pa nang gcig la gcig rung ba dang mi rung ba bzhin du slob ba byin pa nang yang de bzhin te gcig gis byin len byas na der bzar rung gcig gis
translated: If there are many novices who are given full ordination, then like fully ordained monks who are suitable or unsuitable for each other, novices who are given full ordination are also like that. If one accepts alms, then it is suitable to eat there.

original: btsos sam spags pa byas na gzhan gyis bzar mi rung ba la sogs pa kun 'dra bar bsrung ngo //
analyzed: btsos sam spags pa byas na gzhan gyis bzar mi rung ba la sogs pa kun 'dra bar bsrung ngo //
translated: If it is cooked or prepared by another, it is not suitable to be eaten.

original: dge slob ma yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slob ma yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to a probationary nun.

original: slob pa byin pa dang dge slob ma gnyis su yang mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: slob pa byin pa dang dge slob ma gnyis su yang mi 'dra ste /
translated: The two, a novice monk and a probationary nun, are also not similar.

original: dge slob ma yang dge sbyong dang 'dra bar lta ste dge slob mas byin len byas pa dang spags pa dang btsos pa la sogs pa slob pa byin pas bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slob ma yang dge sbyong dang 'dra bar lta ste dge slob mas byin len byas pa dang spags pa dang btsos pa la sogs pa slob pa byin pas bzar rung ngo //
translated: A probationary nun may eat the food of a novice monk that has been received, prepared, or cooked by a probationary nun.

original: slob pa byin pas spags pa la sogs pa dge slob ma la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: slob pa byin pas spags pa la sogs pa dge slob ma la mi rung ngo //
translated: A novice monk may not eat the food of a probationary nun that has been prepared, etc.

original: rgyud gzhan lta bus spyad pa na dge slong du 'du shes pa thob na yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan lta bus spyad pa na dge slong du 'du shes pa thob na yang ngo //
translated: If one has the perception of being a fully ordained monk while eating the food of another being, one is also a fully ordained monk.

original: dge slong rdzu 'phrul shes pa'am sman gyi cho ga zhig gis phyugs sam gzhan zhig tu 'phrul te mi tshangs par spyod na spyod pa'i tshe dge slong las bsrung ba 'phrul bar shes bzhin du mi tshangs par spyad na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong rdzu 'phrul shes pa'am sman gyi cho ga zhig gis phyugs sam gzhan zhig tu 'phrul te mi tshangs par spyod na spyod pa'i tshe dge slong las bsrung ba 'phrul bar shes bzhin du mi tshangs par spyad na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk who has the knowledge of magical power or the knowledge of medicine transforms himself into an animal or another being and engages in sexual intercourse, if he engages in sexual intercourse while knowing that he is a fully ordained monk, he commits a partial defeat.

original: ma thob na 'bri'o //
analyzed: ma thob na 'bri'o //
translated: If not, then one should write it.

original: dge slong las phyugs sam gzhan du 'phrul te mi tshangs par spyod pa'i tshe dge slong las 'phrul pa 'phrul par mi shes na sbom po //
analyzed: dge slong las phyugs sam gzhan du 'phrul te mi tshangs par spyod pa'i tshe dge slong las 'phrul pa 'phrul par mi shes na sbom po //
translated: If a monk is transformed into an animal or another person, and when he engages in sexual intercourse, he does not know that he is transformed from a monk, then it is a serious offense.

original: sngon gyi rim gyis sbyar na yang ngo //🔽khyim pa'i tshig gzhan zhig la bcol te rkur bcug nas des nor blangs ba dang rab tu 'byung ba dang dus mnyam pa zhig tu gyur na de tshun chad ni nyes byas yang bar 'gyur ro //🔽nor blangs pa des khyer te 'ongs nas dge sbyong rab tu byung ba des blangs na nyes byas lci ba /
analyzed: sngon gyi rim gyis sbyar na yang ngo // khyim pa'i tshig gzhan zhig la bcol te rkur bcug nas des nor blangs ba dang rab tu 'byung ba dang dus mnyam pa zhig tu gyur na de tshun chad ni nyes byas yang bar 'gyur ro // nor blangs pa des khyer te 'ongs nas dge sbyong rab tu byung ba des blangs na nyes byas lci ba /
translated: If he applies the previous stages, then it is also so.🔽If he instructs another layperson to steal, and the thief takes the wealth, and the time of taking the wealth is simultaneous with the time of going forth, then from that time on, it is a minor offense.🔽If the thief takes the wealth and brings it, and the renunciate who has gone forth accepts it, then it is a serious offense.

original: dge sbyong gi tshe nor zhig rkur btang ste rkun po des nor blangs pa dang dge sbyong des bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe dus mnyam pa zhig tu gyur na de tshun chad ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshe nor zhig rkur btang ste rkun po des nor blangs pa dang dge sbyong des bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe dus mnyam pa zhig tu gyur na de tshun chad ni sbom po'o //
translated: If a renunciate sends someone to steal some wealth, and the thief takes the wealth, and the time of taking the wealth is simultaneous with the time of the renunciate's going forth, then from that time on, it is a serious offense.

original: nor rkur bcug pa des nor khyer te 'ongs te bsnyen par rdzogs pa des nor de blangs na pham pa'o //
analyzed: nor rkur bcug pa des nor khyer te 'ongs te bsnyen par rdzogs pa des nor de blangs na pham pa'o //
translated: If the one who was made to steal the wealth comes and the fully ordained monk takes that wealth, there is a downfall.

original: de bzhin du pha rol @205a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol @205a * //
translated: The same applies to others.

original: la'o ; / dge slong zhig gis mi gzhan zhig nor rkur bcug pa las dge sbyong slar khyim par babs pa na /
analyzed: la'o ; / dge slong zhig gis mi gzhan zhig nor rkur bcug pa las dge sbyong slar khyim par babs pa na /
translated: A monk made another person steal wealth.🔽When the spiritual practitioner returned to lay life, since he was made to steal when he was a spiritual practitioner, he had one minor offense.

original: dge sbyong byed pa'i tshe rkur btang bas ni nyes byas yang ba gcig yod kyi phyis khyim par babs pa'i tshe nyes byas yod par mi brtsi /
analyzed: dge sbyong byed pa'i tshe rkur btang bas ni nyes byas yang ba gcig yod kyi phyis khyim par babs pa'i tshe nyes byas yod par mi brtsi /
translated: Later, when he returned to lay life, it is not counted as an offense.🔽A monk made another person steal wealth.

original: dge slong zhig gis nor rkur btang ba las dge slong de dge sbyong du babs na rkur btang ba'i tshe ni sbom po /
analyzed: dge slong zhig gis nor rkur btang ba las dge slong de dge sbyong du babs na rkur btang ba'i tshe ni sbom po /
translated: When that monk became a spiritual practitioner, the act of stealing was a serious violation.

original: dge sbyong du babs pa'i tshe nor blangs kyang nyes byas /
analyzed: dge sbyong du babs pa'i tshe nor blangs kyang nyes byas /
translated: When he became a spiritual practitioner, taking the wealth was a minor offense.

original: dge sbyong yang ma byas par khyim bar babs pa ni nyes byas kyang med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong yang ma byas par khyim bar babs pa ni nyes byas kyang med do //
translated: When he became a lay person without becoming a spiritual practitioner, there was not even a minor offense.

original: rdzas kyang bcad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyang bcad pa'o //
translated: The wealth was also lost.

original: srin bu 'ba' zhig la stan sar pa byas na ltung bar 'gyur ba bzhin du dar ram men tri 'ba' zhig las byas pa'i stan kyang ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: srin bu 'ba' zhig la stan sar pa byas na ltung bar 'gyur ba bzhin du dar ram men tri 'ba' zhig las byas pa'i stan kyang ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one makes a mat of only black wool, one commits an infraction.

original: bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byed pa'i 'ang phyed srin bal bzang po lta bu dang bsres te byas na'ang ltung ba'o //🔽mtshungs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bal nag po 'ba' zhig las stan byed pa'i 'ang phyed srin bal bzang po lta bu dang bsres te byas na'ang ltung ba'o // mtshungs pa yang ngo //
translated: If one mixes in a good portion of cotton to a mat made of black wool, one commits an infraction.

original: srin bal dang dar bzhin du de dang 'dra ba kha che dar dang du gu la dang se bo dar gyi rgyu la sogs pa srin bal dang 'dra ba kun gang las byas kyang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srin bal dang dar bzhin du de dang 'dra ba kha che dar dang du gu la dang se bo dar gyi rgyu la sogs pa srin bal dang 'dra ba kun gang las byas kyang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Like wool and silk, if one makes a mat from any of the materials similar to wool, such as Kashmiri silk, dugula, or sebo silk, one commits an infraction.

original: mtshan 'phos na yang gang gi zhing gis so //
analyzed: mtshan 'phos na yang gang gi zhing gis so //

original: dge slong gi phas pham pa bzhi la gang yang rung byed ba'i tshe mtshan gyur kyang pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi phas pham pa bzhi la gang yang rung byed ba'i tshe mtshan gyur kyang pham par 'gyur ro //

original: dge slong mas kyang mthun pa'i phas pham pa bzhi las gang spyad kyang rung spyod pa'i tshe mtshan 'phos na pham par 'gyur ro //🔽mo'i gnad pa'i phas pham pa ni dge slong ma gnad pa'i tshe mtshan gyur na pham pa yin te sbom po'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas kyang mthun pa'i phas pham pa bzhi las gang spyad kyang rung spyod pa'i tshe mtshan 'phos na pham par 'gyur ro // mo'i gnad pa'i phas pham pa ni dge slong ma gnad pa'i tshe mtshan gyur na pham pa yin te sbom po'o //
translated: Also, if a fully ordained nun commits any of the four defeats that are similar to the defeats for fully ordained monks, when she engages in the act, if her gender changes, she incurs a defeat.🔽If a fully ordained nun who is a female changes gender to male, she incurs a defeat.🔽If a fully ordained monk changes gender to female while in the process of emitting semen, he incurs a partial defeat of a female.

original: dge slong khu ba 'byin pa'i 'phro las mo mtshan du gyur pa ni pho'i lhag ma yin te mo'i ltung bar brtsi'o //🔽'bri ba'i phyir na de'i sbyor bas so //🔽dge slong pha gnyis mthang sprad de nyal na nyes byas yin na mthang sprad pa ci nyal ba'i tshe gnyis ka mor gyur na nyes byas so //🔽dge slong ma gnyis mthang sprad de nyal na ltung ba yin te mtshan gyur kyang ltung ba'o //🔽ltung ba dang nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong khu ba 'byin pa'i 'phro las mo mtshan du gyur pa ni pho'i lhag ma yin te mo'i ltung bar brtsi'o // 'bri ba'i phyir na de'i sbyor bas so // dge slong pha gnyis mthang sprad de nyal na nyes byas yin na mthang sprad pa ci nyal ba'i tshe gnyis ka mor gyur na nyes byas so // dge slong ma gnyis mthang sprad de nyal na ltung ba yin te mtshan gyur kyang ltung ba'o // ltung ba dang nyes byas /
translated: If a fully ordained monk changes gender to female while in the process of emitting semen, he incurs a partial defeat of a female.🔽If a fully ordained monk lies down with his genitals placed on the genitals of another fully ordained monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. If both change gender to female while lying with their genitals placed together, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: byas pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: If two fully ordained nuns lie down with their genitals placed together, they commit a downfall. If they change gender, they commit a downfall.

original: mdo ltag ma'i ltag ma la 'chad de /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i ltag ma la 'chad de /
translated: The explanation of the latter part of the root text is as follows.

original: dge slong khu ba 'byin pa la chung zhig gis mo mtshan du ma gyur gyi bar du mor gyur pa'i phyir pho'i lhag ma mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: dge slong khu ba 'byin pa la chung zhig gis mo mtshan du ma gyur gyi bar du mor gyur pa'i phyir pho'i lhag ma mi brtsi'o //
translated: A monk who emits semen does not commit an offense entailing expulsion for the duration that his penis remains erect due to the presence of semen.

original: mo'i ltung bar brtsi'o //
analyzed: mo'i ltung bar brtsi'o //
translated: It is considered a downfall of a nun.

original: dge slong ma glos phab @205b ste nyal ba'ang chung zhig gis pho mtshan du ma gyur kyang phor gyur pa'i phyir mo'i pham par mi brtsi'i pho'i sbom po'o zhes t'i ka las 'chad de /
analyzed: dge slong ma glos phab @205b ste nyal ba'ang chung zhig gis pho mtshan du ma gyur kyang phor gyur pa'i phyir mo'i pham par mi brtsi'i pho'i sbom po'o zhes t'i ka las 'chad de /
translated: A nun who falls asleep lying on her side does not commit a defeating offense for the duration that her penis remains erect due to the presence of semen. It is considered a serious violation of a monk.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re gnang ba'i tshe nyid pham pa yin pas phyis phor gyur pa bas lhar 'gyur kyang mi phan te sbom po ma yin te pham pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re gnang ba'i tshe nyid pham pa yin pas phyis phor gyur pa bas lhar 'gyur kyang mi phan te sbom po ma yin te pham pa'o //
translated: Some Vinaya masters say: Since the offense of defeat occurs at the time of the granting of permission, it is of no benefit for the penis to become erect later. It is not a serious violation, but a defeating offense.

original: khu ba 'byin pa yang 'phags pa'i tshe lhag mar gyur pa yin pas phyis mor 'gyur ba mi brtsan te ltung ba ma yin te lhag ma'o //
analyzed: khu ba 'byin pa yang 'phags pa'i tshe lhag mar gyur pa yin pas phyis mor 'gyur ba mi brtsan te ltung ba ma yin te lhag ma'o //
translated: Since the offense of a serious violation occurs at the time of the emission of semen, it is of no benefit for the penis to become erect later. It is not a downfall, but a serious violation.

original: 'bri yang bdag gi'o //
analyzed: 'bri yang bdag gi'o //
translated: The same applies to the offense of stealing.

original: dge slong mas mo mtshan du rgya skyegs bcug pa dang khu ba phyung ba la sogs pa'i tshe pho mtshan du gyur pa ni mtshan gyur te pho mtshan nas khu ba phyung ba yang mtshan gyur pa mi brtsan te ltung bar zad do //
analyzed: dge slong mas mo mtshan du rgya skyegs bcug pa dang khu ba phyung ba la sogs pa'i tshe pho mtshan du gyur pa ni mtshan gyur te pho mtshan nas khu ba phyung ba yang mtshan gyur pa mi brtsan te ltung bar zad do //
translated: When a nun inserts lac into her vagina, or emits semen, and so on, and then becomes a man, she is called a “sex changer.” But if a man emits semen from his penis, he is not called a sex changer, but only commits a downfall.

original: zhag bcu las nyung ba yang cha'i'o //
analyzed: zhag bcu las nyung ba yang cha'i'o //
translated: If it is less than ten days, it is also permissible.

original: dge slong pha'i lhung bzed zhag bcu 'das te sngags kyis ma thebs na ltung ba yin pa las zhag brgyad dgu zhig lon te sngags kyis ma thebs par mo mtshan du gyur na sngar zhag dgu 'das pa mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: dge slong pha'i lhung bzed zhag bcu 'das te sngags kyis ma thebs na ltung ba yin pa las zhag brgyad dgu zhig lon te sngags kyis ma thebs par mo mtshan du gyur na sngar zhag dgu 'das pa mi brtsi'o //
translated: If a monk keeps a begging bowl for more than ten days, and then it is enchanted, it is a downfall. If he keeps it for eight or nine days, and then it is enchanted, and he becomes a woman, the previous nine days are not counted.

original: nam mtshan gyur pa nas zhag gnyis 'das na mo'i ltung bar 'gyur bar brtsi /
analyzed: nam mtshan gyur pa nas zhag gnyis 'das na mo'i ltung bar 'gyur bar brtsi /
translated: If two days have passed since the sex change, it is counted as a woman’s downfall.

original: dge slong ma'ang mtshan gyur nas zhag gnyis mi brtsi'i /
analyzed: dge slong ma'ang mtshan gyur nas zhag gnyis mi brtsi'i /
translated: If a monk also changes sex, two days are not counted.

original: mtshan gyur pa tshun chad pho'i thang du zhag bcur brtsi'o //
analyzed: mtshan gyur pa tshun chad pho'i thang du zhag bcur brtsi'o //
translated: But after the sex change, it is counted as ten days for a man.

original: zhing ma yin par 'jig go //
analyzed: zhing ma yin par 'jig go //
translated: It is destroyed in an unsuitable field.

original: dge slong ma pho mtshan du gyur na dge slong gi khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum ni bsrung gi nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum las ma gtogs pa dge slong ma'i khrims bla thabs su yod pa brla snang bar sham thabs mi bgo ba dang /🔽'dod chags dang bcas te grong du mi 'gro ba la sogs pa ni ma bsrungs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma pho mtshan du gyur na dge slong gi khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum ni bsrung gi nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum las ma gtogs pa dge slong ma'i khrims bla thabs su yod pa brla snang bar sham thabs mi bgo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bcas te grong du mi 'gro ba la sogs pa ni ma bsrungs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a fully ordained nun becomes a man, she must maintain the two hundred and fifty-three rules of a monk, but she need not maintain the additional rules of a nun, such as not wearing a sarong above the navel.

original: bcabs pa'i nyes ni der ma yin pa ma yin no //🔽dge slong ma dge 'dun lhag ma byung ste bcabs pa yod bzhin du pho mtshan du gyur pa ni bcabs pa'i chad pa bya mi dgos kyi pho'i thang du zhag drug mgu ba byas pas chog go //
analyzed: bcabs pa'i nyes ni der ma yin pa ma yin no // dge slong ma dge 'dun lhag ma byung ste bcabs pa yod bzhin du pho mtshan du gyur pa ni bcabs pa'i chad pa bya mi dgos kyi pho'i thang du zhag drug mgu ba byas pas chog go //
translated: If she does not maintain these, there is no fault.🔽However, it is not the case that there is no fault in concealing the offense.🔽If a fully ordained nun who has committed a partial defeat and concealed it becomes a man, she need not perform the penance for concealing the offense, but it is sufficient to perform the six-day penance for a monk.

original: dge slong pho lhag ma byung ste bcabs pa yod bzhin du mo mtshan du gyur na bcabs pa'i chad pa dgos kyi mo'i thang du zla ba phyed mgu ba byas pas chog go //
analyzed: dge slong pho lhag ma byung ste bcabs pa yod bzhin du mo mtshan du gyur na bcabs pa'i chad pa dgos kyi mo'i thang du zla ba phyed mgu ba byas pas chog go //
translated: If a fully ordained monk who has committed a partial defeat and concealed it becomes a woman, he must perform the penance for concealing the offense, but it is sufficient to perform the penance for a nun for a half month.

original: chad pa bcad pa yang 'bras bu med do //🔽dge slong pho zhig lhag ma byung nas mgu ba byed de zhag gcig ma 'khor bar mtshan gyur na sngar mgu @206a * //
analyzed: chad pa bcad pa yang 'bras bu med do // dge slong pho zhig lhag ma byung nas mgu ba byed de zhag gcig ma 'khor bar mtshan gyur na sngar mgu @206a * //
translated: Also, the punishment is ineffective.

original: ba byas pa mi brtsan te /
analyzed: ba byas pa mi brtsan te /
translated: If a monk becomes the remainder, he should please the nuns for one day. If he changes sex before the day is over, the previous pleasing is not counted.

original: dge slong ma'i thad du mgu ba zhag bco lnga mgo nas bzung ste bya dgos so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i thad du mgu ba zhag bco lnga mgo nas bzung ste bya dgos so //
translated: He should please the nuns for fifteen days, starting from the beginning.

original: dge slong mo zhig lhag ma byung ste mgu ba zhag bco lnga la zhag gcig ma 'khor bar pho mtshan du gyur na snga ma byas pa mi brtsan te dge slong pho'i thad du mgu pa zhag drug mgo nas bzung ste bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mo zhig lhag ma byung ste mgu ba zhag bco lnga la zhag gcig ma 'khor bar pho mtshan du gyur na snga ma byas pa mi brtsan te dge slong pho'i thad du mgu pa zhag drug mgo nas bzung ste bya'o //
translated: If a nun becomes the remainder and pleases the monks for fifteen days, if she changes sex before the day is over, the previous pleasing is not counted. She should please the monks for six days, starting from the beginning.

original: der tshul yang 'phos so //
analyzed: der tshul yang 'phos so //
translated: In this way, the gender changes.

original: mtshan gyur ba'i tshe ltung ba dang mi ltung ba la sogs pa ni ltag tu bshad pa rnams yin mtshan gyur zin nas ni phor gyur na'ang pho'i khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum bsrung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan gyur ba'i tshe ltung ba dang mi ltung ba la sogs pa ni ltag tu bshad pa rnams yin mtshan gyur zin nas ni phor gyur na'ang pho'i khrims nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa gsum bsrung ngo //
translated: Whether or not there is an offense when the sex changes and so on, and whether or not one should maintain the two hundred and fifty-three rules for monks after changing sex and becoming a monk, are explained in the reverse order.

original: mor gyur na mo'i khrims sum brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi bsrung ngo //
analyzed: mor gyur na mo'i khrims sum brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi bsrung ngo //
translated: If she becomes a woman, she must observe the three hundred and sixty-four rules of the nuns.

original: de'i tshe bdag gis byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag gis byed do //
translated: I will do that.

original: dge slong bsam gtan du zhugs te de'i che na dgra bcom par 'gyur ba zhig bsad na'ang phas pham pa dang mtshams med pa gnyis yod do //🔽de'i tshe nyid ni dgra bcom par ma gyur gyi phyis ring po mi thogs par dgra bcom par 'gyur ba zhig la gsad pa'i phyir mtshon gyis btab na 'phral du ni ma shi'i phyis dgra bcom par gyur te shi yang bas pham par zad de mtshams med par
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan du zhugs te de'i che na dgra bcom par 'gyur ba zhig bsad na'ang phas pham pa dang mtshams med pa gnyis yod do // de'i tshe nyid ni dgra bcom par ma gyur gyi phyis ring po mi thogs par dgra bcom par 'gyur ba zhig la gsad pa'i phyir mtshon gyis btab na 'phral du ni ma shi'i phyis dgra bcom par gyur te shi yang bas pham par zad de mtshams med par
translated: If a bhikṣu who has entered into meditation is killed, even though he is an arhat, there is both a pārājika and a heinous transgression.🔽If one strikes with a weapon in order to kill one who is not yet an arhat but will become an arhat before long, if he dies immediately, there is a pārājika but not a heinous transgression.

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he dies later, after becoming an arhat, there is a heinous transgression but not a pārājika.

original: gzhan las skyes pa'ang bdag gi rgyud ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las skyes pa'ang bdag gi rgyud ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that what arises from another is not one’s own continuum.

original: rgyal po aa shva ka la tshang pa zhig gis sa mu dra'i pha rol gyi brag gi drung na sgo nga che ba la bzang ba gnyis shig rnyed de phul nas sgo nga de tshong byas te bzhag pa las sgo da'i nad nas mi gnyis shig byung ste
analyzed: rgyal po aa shva ka la tshang pa zhig gis sa mu dra'i pha rol gyi brag gi drung na sgo nga che ba la bzang ba gnyis shig rnyed de phul nas sgo nga de tshong byas te bzhag pa las sgo da'i nad nas mi gnyis shig byung ste
translated: A certain householder offered two large, beautiful eggs to King Aśoka, saying, “I found these at the base of a rock on the other side of the river.” He sold the eggs and set them aside. Two humans emerged from the eggs.

original: de gnyis bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur te de lta bu pha ma mi ma yin pa byol song las skyes pa bsad na'ang phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur te de lta bu pha ma mi ma yin pa byol song las skyes pa bsad na'ang phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: They were fully ordained and it is said that if one kills such a person whose parents are not human but born from an animal, one commits a defeating offense.

original: rgyud gzhan lta bu spyod pa bsad na yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan lta bu spyod pa bsad na yang ngo //
translated: If one kills one who is like another being, it is also like that.

original: dge slong las ra lug gam gzhan gyi gzugs su sngags sam sman gcig gis sprul cing 'dug pa la mir mi shes bzhin du bsad kyang gsod pa'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong las ra lug gam gzhan gyi gzugs su sngags sam sman gcig gis sprul cing 'dug pa la mir mi shes bzhin du bsad kyang gsod pa'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If a monk is transformed into a goat, sheep or another form by a mantra or medicine and remains in that form, if one kills it without knowing it is a human, at the time of killing one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sha ni pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: sha ni pham par 'gyur /
translated: If one eats the flesh, one commits a defeating offense.

original: mir shes te bsad na nyes byas dang sbom po dang pham pa gsum char yod do //
analyzed: mir shes te bsad na nyes byas dang sbom po dang pham pa gsum char yod do //
translated: If one kills it knowing it is a human, there are three: an offense of wrong conduct, a serious violation and a defeating offense.

original: gnas gzhan du grub na gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du grub na gzhan ma yin no //
translated: If one establishes it as another place, it is not another.

original: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong ma yin pho mo dang dge slob ma dang khyim pa la sogs pa gang bsad kyang pham /
analyzed: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong ma yin pho mo dang dge slob ma dang khyim pa la sogs pa gang bsad kyang pham /
translated: Whether one kills a fully ordained male or female, a male or female novice, a female candidate for novice vows, a layperson and so on, it is a defeating offense.

original: byis pa dang rgan po dang mda' na 'dug pa dang gzhon nu @206b dang 'di rnams las gang bsad kyang pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa dang rgan po dang mda' na 'dug pa dang gzhon nu @206b dang 'di rnams las gang bsad kyang pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whether one kills a child, an elder, a middle aged person or a youth, it is a defeating offense.

original: de'i nyes pa med par zhugs nas bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nyes pa med par zhugs nas bcad pa'o //
translated: If one enters the state of being free of that fault, it is severed.

original: lhag mar 'gyur ba'i khang pa zhig brtsig brtsig pa las dge slong de khyim par zhugs nas brtsams pa'i nyes pa ci yod du zad de nyes pa gzhan yod par mi brtsi ste slar dge slong du zhugs te khang pa de brtsigs na yang thog ma brtsams pa
analyzed: lhag mar 'gyur ba'i khang pa zhig brtsig brtsig pa las dge slong de khyim par zhugs nas brtsams pa'i nyes pa ci yod du zad de nyes pa gzhan yod par mi brtsi ste slar dge slong du zhugs te khang pa de brtsigs na yang thog ma brtsams pa
translated: If one begins to build a hut that exceeds the prescribed size and then becomes a layperson, whatever faults there are in beginning the construction are exhausted and other faults are not considered to exist. If one again becomes a fully ordained monk and builds that hut, then the faults of the initial construction are counted and added to the faults of the later construction.

original: tshun chad kyi nyes byas brtsis te bsdus nas lhag mar mi 'gyur gyi phyir nam zhugs nas 'phro las brtsigs ba'i nyes pa ci yod pa la logs shig tu brtsi'o //
analyzed: tshun chad kyi nyes byas brtsis te bsdus nas lhag mar mi 'gyur gyi phyir nam zhugs nas 'phro las brtsigs ba'i nyes pa ci yod pa la logs shig tu brtsi'o //
translated: However, in order to avoid the fault of exceeding the size limit, the faults of the later construction are counted separately from the initial construction.

original: gding ba zhig bya bar brtsams pa las slar khrims phul ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gding ba zhig bya bar brtsams pa las slar khrims phul ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is similar to one who begins to make a mat, but then returns the vows.

original: btang yang ngo //
analyzed: btang yang ngo //
translated: Even if one gives it away, it is the same.

original: khang pa dang gding ba byed byed pa las 'phro bor te btang na yang snga ma ci tsam zin pa phan chad kyi nyes byas ni yod do //
analyzed: khang pa dang gding ba byed byed pa las 'phro bor te btang na yang snga ma ci tsam zin pa phan chad kyi nyes byas ni yod do //
translated: If one gives away the mat or hut that one is making, then there is the fault of a wrong action for as long as one has been working on it.

original: btang ba tshun chad kyi nyes byas ni mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: btang ba tshun chad kyi nyes byas ni mi brtsi'o //
translated: The wrong action after one has given it away is not counted.

original: du ma dngos po gcig las bcas pa ji snyed par byas pa'o //
analyzed: du ma dngos po gcig las bcas pa ji snyed par byas pa'o //
translated: If one has many things, one must do the same for each.

original: rigs ngan ko long 'di zhes smras na skyon gyi ltung ba yang gnyis yod /
analyzed: rigs ngan ko long 'di zhes smras na skyon gyi ltung ba yang gnyis yod /
translated: If one says, “This low caste person,” there are two faults: the fault of a downfall and the fault of a lie.

original: brdzun gyi ltung ba yang gnyis yod pa dang yang gcig tu na phyi dro zan za zhing 'dug pa la ci byed ces 'dra ni cang mi byed ces smra ba la phyi dro zan zos pa'i ltung ba gcig / brdzun gyi ltung ba gcig dang gnyis yod /
analyzed: brdzun gyi ltung ba yang gnyis yod pa dang yang gcig tu na phyi dro zan za zhing 'dug pa la ci byed ces 'dra ni cang mi byed ces smra ba la phyi dro zan zos pa'i ltung ba gcig / brdzun gyi ltung ba gcig dang gnyis yod /
translated: If one is sitting eating in the afternoon and someone asks, “What are you doing?” and one says, “Nothing,” then there is one downfall of eating in the afternoon and one downfall of lying.

original: me mar gyi 'od la rab tu ma rdzogs pa'i bud med dang nyal ba la me mar gyi 'od la nyal ba'i nyes byas gcig dang bud med dang nyal ba'i ltung ba gcig dang rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang nyal ba'i ltung ba gcig yod pa bzhin du
analyzed: me mar gyi 'od la rab tu ma rdzogs pa'i bud med dang nyal ba la me mar gyi 'od la nyal ba'i nyes byas gcig dang bud med dang nyal ba'i ltung ba gcig dang rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang nyal ba'i ltung ba gcig yod pa bzhin du
translated: For example, there is one offense of wrong conduct for sleeping in the light of a butter lamp and one root downfall for sleeping with a woman, and one offense of wrong conduct for sleeping in the light of a butter lamp and one root downfall for sleeping with an incomplete woman.

original: nyes byas gcig / byung ba las ltung ba dang nyes byas mang du yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes byas gcig / byung ba las ltung ba dang nyes byas mang du yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that many downfalls and offenses arise from a single offense of wrong conduct.

original: de chad pa der chud do //
analyzed: de chad pa der chud do //
translated: One who commits a root downfall is expelled from the order.

original: phas pham pa bzhi ni dper rgyal po dang 'dra ste rgyal po'i sa ris su gtogs pa'i 'bangs thams cad rgyal po'i 'khor du chud ris su gtogs te /
analyzed: phas pham pa bzhi ni dper rgyal po dang 'dra ste rgyal po'i sa ris su gtogs pa'i 'bangs thams cad rgyal po'i 'khor du chud ris su gtogs te /
translated: The four defeats are like a king, for all the subjects belonging to the king's domain are included in the king's retinue.

original: de bzhin du phas pham pa yang so so'i 'khor du lhag ma dang ltung ba dang nyes byas yan chad cha 'dra ba rnams gtogs shing chud de thams cad phas pham pa'i sder 'dra 'drar bsdu'o //
