analyzed: brdzun dang smyen tshig la sogs pa ni bdag gi kha nas tshig tu smras pa las ltung gi brda dang mtshan mas byas pa ni 'bri ste nyes byas so //
translated: Lying, slander, etc. are downfalls accrued by speaking with one's own mouth. Writing them down is a minor offense.

original: khar tshig tu ma smras kyang nyes par 'gyur ba yod de /🔽smyen lta bu brda go bar lhag mar 'gyur /
analyzed: khar tshig tu ma smras kyang nyes par 'gyur ba yod de / smyen lta bu brda go bar lhag mar 'gyur /
translated: There are cases where one is at fault even if one does not speak with one's own mouth.🔽For example, if one makes a sign that is understood, it is a residual sin.

original: kun spyod dang smyen tshig dang slong ba yang khar tshig tu smras pa las lhag ma dang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun spyod dang smyen tshig dang slong ba yang khar tshig tu smras pa las lhag ma dang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one requests with one's own mouth, it is a residual sin or a downfall.

original: rang gis so //
analyzed: rang gis so //
translated: By oneself.

original: zas dang gos la sogs pa ni slong ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyis bslangs pa las ltung bar 'gyur gyi 'phrin dang yi ge la sogs pas byas pa ni 'bri ste nyes byas /
analyzed: zas dang gos la sogs pa ni slong ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyis bslangs pa las ltung bar 'gyur gyi 'phrin dang yi ge la sogs pas byas pa ni 'bri ste nyes byas /
translated: Eating, wearing and so on, and begging and so on are transgressions when done by oneself, but when done by messenger, letter and so on, they are reduced to faults.

original: ma byin par len pa dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas kyang gzhan la byed du bcug na'ang pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas kyang gzhan la byed du bcug na'ang pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: Taking what is not given, killing and so on are defeats when done by oneself or when one causes another to do it.

original: bdag gis brjod /
analyzed: bdag gis brjod /
translated: One speaks oneself.

original: smyen tshig dang kun spyod dang gnyen ma yin pa la gos dang zan slong ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyi phyir smras shing brjod pa las lhag ma dang ltung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi phyir bslangs shing brjod pa ni 'bri ste nyes byas so //
analyzed: smyen tshig dang kun spyod dang gnyen ma yin pa la gos dang zan slong ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyi phyir smras shing brjod pa las lhag ma dang ltung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi phyir bslangs shing brjod pa ni 'bri ste nyes byas so //
translated: When one speaks and requests for oneself, begging for food and clothing from those who are not relatives, one commits a partial defeat or a downfall, but when one requests for another, it is reduced to a fault.

original: bdag gis bsngos na byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bsngos na byed pa'o //
translated: When one dedicates it to oneself, one does it.

original: sa bon dang rtsi shing 'joms pa dang me 'bud la sogs pa bdag gis mngon sum du byed du bcug na ltung /
analyzed: sa bon dang rtsi shing 'joms pa dang me 'bud la sogs pa bdag gis mngon sum du byed du bcug na ltung /
translated: When one causes the destruction of seeds and plants, the lighting of fire and so on to be done in one's presence, one commits a downfall.

original: mngon @210b sum pa yin par byos shig ces bsgo ste byed du bcug pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mngon @210b sum pa yin par byos shig ces bsgo ste byed du bcug pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes them do it, saying, “Make it manifest,” it is a misdeed.

original: rnam par 'byed par gtogs pa kun du bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed par gtogs pa kun du bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation belonging to the analysis is complete.

original: // / pa ri ba sha 'di la 'dul ba dris pa dang dngos po dang phran tshegs dang bye brag tu gdon mi za ba bzhi'i mdo las kyang 'chad cing yod mod kyi 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba mang ste /
analyzed: // / pa ri ba sha 'di la 'dul ba dris pa dang dngos po dang phran tshegs dang bye brag tu gdon mi za ba bzhi'i mdo las kyang 'chad cing yod mod kyi 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba mang ste /
translated: Here, in the Vinaya, the Sūtra of Four Topics, which is the Vinaya, the Topics, the Minor Points, and the Distinctions, is explained. However, in the Vinaya-vibhanga, there are many more explanations.

original: 'dul ba rnams par 'byed pa'i nang du gtogs par bshad de pa ri ba sha rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams par 'byed pa'i nang du gtogs par bshad de pa ri ba sha rdzogs so /
translated: The Vinaya-vibhanga is explained as belonging to the Vinaya-vibhanga.

original: // / dngos po bco brgyad yod pa la mgor rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga dang gnas bca' ba gsum la dngos po re rer brtsi'o //
analyzed: // / dngos po bco brgyad yod pa la mgor rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga dang gnas bca' ba gsum la dngos po re rer brtsi'o //
translated: There are eighteen topics. In the first, there are three topics: the ceremony of going forth and being fully ordained, and the ceremony of taking up residence.

original: de la gnas pa ni rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gnyis ka'i spyir gtogs so //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gnyis ka'i spyir gtogs so //
translated: In that, taking up residence belongs to both going forth and being fully ordained in general.

original: rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga gnyis ni 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa gzhi'i nang nas kyang 'byung mod kyi 'dul ba dngos po'i nang nas phal cher 'byung bas na gzhi dngos po'i nang du gtogs par bshad do //🔽bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga man chad pa ri ba sha 'di yan chad ni 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang du gtogs so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga gnyis ni 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa gzhi'i nang nas kyang 'byung mod kyi 'dul ba dngos po'i nang nas phal cher 'byung bas na gzhi dngos po'i nang du gtogs par bshad do // bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga man chad pa ri ba sha 'di yan chad ni 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang du gtogs so //
translated: The two rituals of going forth and receiving full ordination are found in the Vinaya Divisions and so forth, but since they are found mostly in the actual Vinaya, they are explained as belonging to the actual Vinaya.🔽From the ritual of full ordination up to this point, it belongs to the Vinaya Divisions.

original: gso sbyong gi dngos po 'di man chad mjug yan chad ni 'dul ba dngos po'i nang du gtogs so //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi dngos po 'di man chad mjug yan chad ni 'dul ba dngos po'i nang du gtogs so //
translated: From the actual confession up to the end, it belongs to the actual Vinaya.

original: gzhi des 'dzin no //
analyzed: gzhi des 'dzin no //
translated: It is upheld by that basis.

original: gso sbyong gi dngos po la 'di man chad 'chad de /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi dngos po la 'di man chad 'chad de /
translated: From here on, the actual confession is explained.

original: rgyu bar zhugs na thub pa mi bsgom /
analyzed: rgyu bar zhugs na thub pa mi bsgom /
translated: When walking, do not meditate.

original: dgon pa'ang mi rung grong du'ang rung rgyu zhing 'gro ba'i tshe bsam gtan mi bya /
analyzed: dgon pa'ang mi rung grong du'ang rung rgyu zhing 'gro ba'i tshe bsam gtan mi bya /
translated: When walking, do not meditate in the wilderness or in town.

original: 'du bar ma yin /
analyzed: 'du bar ma yin /
translated: Not in a gathering.

original: lam ka dang mi mang po 'du ba'i khrod du bsam gtan mi bya /🔽'khrug pa dang gcan gzan dang smyon thabs can spang ba'i ltung ba rigs so //
analyzed: lam ka dang mi mang po 'du ba'i khrod du bsam gtan mi bya / 'khrug pa dang gcan gzan dang smyon thabs can spang ba'i ltung ba rigs so //
translated: Do not meditate in the middle of a road or in a place where many people gather.🔽Do not meditate in the midst of a crowd, in a place where there are wild animals, or in the presence of a madman.

original: phal mo che 'khrug cing klag cor zer ba dang gcan gzan gyis gtse zhing gnod par byed pa dang / smyon pa dang smyon thabs su ku re byed pa la sogs pa'i drung du bsam gtan mi bya /
analyzed: phal mo che 'khrug cing klag cor zer ba dang gcan gzan gyis gtse zhing gnod par byed pa dang / smyon pa dang smyon thabs su ku re byed pa la sogs pa'i drung du bsam gtan mi bya /
translated: Do not meditate in the midst of a crowd that is noisy and quarrelsome, in a place where there are wild animals that might harm you, or in the presence of a madman or someone who is playing a joke on you.

original: spang ba'i gnas bya /
analyzed: spang ba'i gnas bya /
translated: You should stay in a place where you can avoid these.

original: dge 'dun gros byas te bsam gtan gyi khang pa dben zhing yangs par brtsig par gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bya /
analyzed: dge 'dun gros byas te bsam gtan gyi khang pa dben zhing yangs par brtsig par gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bya /
translated: You should ask the Sangha to build a meditation hut in a secluded and spacious place.

original: khang bu gnyis kyi bar gyi khyams su'o //
analyzed: khang bu gnyis kyi bar gyi khyams su'o //
translated: You should build it between two other huts.

original: bsam gtan gyi khang pa bya ba ni pha rol tshul rol khang phran du byas la dbus su bkad sa khyams su bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi khang pa bya ba ni pha rol tshul rol khang phran du byas la dbus su bkad sa khyams su bya /
translated: The meditation hut should be built in the middle of the courtyard, with a space for walking meditation in the middle.

original: lnga 'am @211a * //
analyzed: lnga 'am @211a * //
translated: The hut should be built with five layers of bricks.

original: drug go // khang phran bya ba ni mi mang nyung las khang pa mig lnga drug yan chad du byas kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: drug go // khang phran bya ba ni mi mang nyung las khang pa mig lnga drug yan chad du byas kyang rung ngo //
translated: The temple is suitable to be built with five or six eyes, depending on the number of people, and so forth.

original: sgo dang sgo leb sgra mi zer ba dang drang pa'i thabs kyang ngo //
analyzed: sgo dang sgo leb sgra mi zer ba dang drang pa'i thabs kyang ngo //
translated: The door and door panels should be soundless and straight.

original: khang phran dang dbus kyi bkad sa sgo gdod sgo leb kyang gzhug sgo lcis sgra mi zer bar thabs ci yod pas bya /
analyzed: khang phran dang dbus kyi bkad sa sgo gdod sgo leb kyang gzhug sgo lcis sgra mi zer bar thabs ci yod pas bya /
translated: The door panels of the temple and the central assembly hall should be installed with locks that are as soundless as possible.

original: sgo gcad cing dbye ba'i lag zungs kyang bca'/
analyzed: sgo gcad cing dbye ba'i lag zungs kyang bca'/
translated: Door handles should be installed for closing and opening the doors.

original: skar khung ni blar sum cha bor nas phyi rub la nang yangs na dge'o //
analyzed: skar khung ni blar sum cha bor nas phyi rub la nang yangs na dge'o //
translated: It is auspicious if the windows are narrow outside and wide inside, leaving one-third of the upper part empty.

original: khang pa skar khung gdod pa'i thabs ni 'di 'dra bar byas nang du snang yel che ste de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: khang pa skar khung gdod pa'i thabs ni 'di 'dra bar byas nang du snang yel che ste de ltar bya'o //
translated: The method of installing windows in a house is to make them like this, with a large opening inside.

original: shar bu dang dbus kyi bkad sa sgo gdod sgo 'phar dang rked gtan dang gzer gtan dang zungs dang ra rkang can gyi dbyig pa yang ngo //
analyzed: shar bu dang dbus kyi bkad sa sgo gdod sgo 'phar dang rked gtan dang gzer gtan dang zungs dang ra rkang can gyi dbyig pa yang ngo //
translated: The door panels, door frames, door bolts, door hinges, door handles, and door knockers of the temple and the central assembly hall should be installed.

original: skar khung gi rkyen 'di rnams kyang byas na rkun po dang bya la sogs pa mi shor bar bya'o //
analyzed: skar khung gi rkyen 'di rnams kyang byas na rkun po dang bya la sogs pa mi shor bar bya'o //
translated: If these windows are made, thieves, birds, and so forth will not enter.

original: bkad sar mi shong na steng gi yang tog tu yang ngo //
analyzed: bkad sar mi shong na steng gi yang tog tu yang ngo //
translated: If they do not fit in the assembly hall, they should also be made in the upper story.

original: bsam gtan byed pa'i mi mang ste dbus kyi bkad sa dang khang phran du mi shong na khang pa'i yang tog tu yang khang pa'i yang tog byas la der yang bsam gtan bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa'i mi mang ste dbus kyi bkad sa dang khang phran du mi shong na khang pa'i yang tog tu yang khang pa'i yang tog byas la der yang bsam gtan bya /
translated: If there are many people practicing concentration and they do not fit in the central assembly hall or the small rooms, they should also practice concentration in the upper story of the house.

original: bzeg pa'i phyir skas bya /
analyzed: bzeg pa'i phyir skas bya /
translated: A ladder should be made for climbing up.

original: yang tog tu bzeg pa'i phyir bkad sa'i grva gcig tu skas bya /🔽mi ltung ba'i phyir rten kyang bskor /
analyzed: yang tog tu bzeg pa'i phyir bkad sa'i grva gcig tu skas bya / mi ltung ba'i phyir rten kyang bskor /
translated: In order to climb up to the upper story, a ladder should be made in one corner of the assembly hall.🔽In order not to fall, a railing should be made all around.

original: skas las phan tshun du mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol tshul rol du shing thags kyis brtan par bya /
analyzed: skas las phan tshun du mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol tshul rol du shing thags kyis brtan par bya /
translated: In order not to fall from the ladder to the other side, the ladder should be secured with a rope.

original: de la mi g-yo ba'i phyir lcags kyi gzer bu gdab /
analyzed: de la mi g-yo ba'i phyir lcags kyi gzer bu gdab /
translated: In order not to move, iron nails should be driven in.

original: skas kyi shing thags kyi rten la mi 'gul zhing brtan par bya ba'i phyir lcags kyi gzer gyis gdab /
analyzed: skas kyi shing thags kyi rten la mi 'gul zhing brtan par bya ba'i phyir lcags kyi gzer gyis gdab /
translated: In order for the ladder to be stable and not move, iron nails should be driven in.

original: phyi rol du spang ba'i bkad sa khang bu'i phreng ba yang ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol du spang ba'i bkad sa khang bu'i phreng ba yang ngo //
translated: And outside, a row of pavilions for the rite of renunciation.

original: mi mang ste bsam gtan gyi sar mi shong na khang pa'i phyi rol kho ra khor yug tu khang phran gyis dngar la sgo nang du blta bar bya //
analyzed: mi mang ste bsam gtan gyi sar mi shong na khang pa'i phyi rol kho ra khor yug tu khang phran gyis dngar la sgo nang du blta bar bya //
translated: If the place of meditation is crowded with people, and there is no room, one should build a small house outside the door, facing inward.

original: sgo'i mngon sum du sgo mi bya //
analyzed: sgo'i mngon sum du sgo mi bya //
translated: One should not make the door face the main door.

original: khang phran gyi sgo gdod pa gcig gi thad kar gcig mi bya'i snol du bya zhing gdod do //
analyzed: khang phran gyi sgo gdod pa gcig gi thad kar gcig mi bya'i snol du bya zhing gdod do //
translated: One should not place the door of the small house directly in front of the main door, but should place it at an angle.

original: sgo gang bya /
analyzed: sgo gang bya /
translated: What size should the door be?

original: phyi sgo la sogs pa sgo gang bya ;
analyzed: phyi sgo la sogs pa sgo gang bya ;
translated: The main door and so forth should be one cubit.

original: phug kyang bya'o //
analyzed: phug kyang bya'o //
translated: One should also make a cave.

original: bsam gtan gyi sa brag phug dang sa'i phug byas te der bsam gtan byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sa brag phug dang sa'i phug byas te der bsam gtan byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: One should make a cave in a rock or in the ground for the place of meditation, and it is not a fault to meditate there.

original: 'dug pa'i phyir sa'i stegs bu yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i phyir sa'i stegs bu yang ngo //
translated: And a platform for sitting.

original: bsam gtan du 'dug pa'i 'og tu sa'i stegs bu byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: bsam gtan du 'dug pa'i 'og tu sa'i stegs bu byas kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to make a platform below the place of meditation.

original: khri'u yang ngo //
analyzed: khri'u yang ngo //
translated: And a bench.

original: khri'u'i steng du bsam gtan @211b byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: khri'u'i steng du bsam gtan @211b byas kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to meditate on a bench.

original: de'i kho ra khor yug tu khru bzhis 'khor na dge'o //
analyzed: de'i kho ra khor yug tu khru bzhis 'khor na dge'o //
translated: If it is four cubits around, it is good.

original: bsam gtan bya ba'i khri'u grva bzhi ngos gcig la khru gang yod par byas na dge zhing ran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bya ba'i khri'u grva bzhi ngos gcig la khru gang yod par byas na dge zhing ran par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a meditation bench with four corners and one side one cubit, it is good and suitable.

original: de las cher byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: de las cher byas kyang nyes med /
translated: If it is made larger than that, there is no fault.

original: brtags pa rnam lnga'o //
analyzed: brtags pa rnam lnga'o //
translated: There are five kinds of examinations.

original: khri'u'i dra ba la sogs pa rnam pa lngas brtag tu rung ngo //
analyzed: khri'u'i dra ba la sogs pa rnam pa lngas brtag tu rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable to examine the bench with five aspects.

original: gres ma dang gso ma dang ba la rdza dang lhas ma dang spa'i shun phrags zhes so //
analyzed: gres ma dang gso ma dang ba la rdza dang lhas ma dang spa'i shun phrags zhes so //
translated: It is said that the five are flax, hemp, cotton, silk, and wool.

original: khri'u'i thag pa rnam lngar rung pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams so //🔽de la shing bal can gyi gding /
analyzed: khri'u'i thag pa rnam lngar rung pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams so // de la shing bal can gyi gding /
translated: The five suitable ropes for the bench are these mentioned by name.🔽Among them, the cotton-filled mat.

original: khri'u'i steng du shing bal can bar tshangs can gyi stan gding /
analyzed: khri'u'i steng du shing bal can bar tshangs can gyi stan gding /
translated: On the bench, a mat filled with cotton is spread.

original: de la kun du mthos lhag na dge'o //
analyzed: de la kun du mthos lhag na dge'o //
translated: If it is higher than that, it is good.

original: stan khri'u las mtho gang 'khor bas lhag par byas na dge'o //
analyzed: stan khri'u las mtho gang 'khor bas lhag par byas na dge'o //
translated: If it is made higher than a cubit around the bench, it is good.

original: aar ka dang ka sha dang ke ra ka dang bu ka dang shal ma li dag gi shing bal gyis g-yogs /
analyzed: aar ka dang ka sha dang ke ra ka dang bu ka dang shal ma li dag gi shing bal gyis g-yogs /
translated: It is covered with cotton from the trees arka, kasha, keraka, buka and shalmali.

original: stan gyi bar tshangs su gzhug pa'i shing bal ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ngo ;
analyzed: stan gyi bar tshangs su gzhug pa'i shing bal ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ngo ;
translated: The cotton used to fill the intervals of the seat is any of these mentioned by name.

original: / bal dang gso ma dang shing bal dang ras ma dang lo ma'i tshogs dag gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: / bal dang gso ma dang shing bal dang ras ma dang lo ma'i tshogs dag gis kyang ngo //
translated: It is also a collection of cotton, wool, cotton fluff, cloth and leaves.

original: stan gyi bar tshangs su gzhug pa'i shing bal ma gtogs par ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las byas kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: stan gyi bar tshangs su gzhug pa'i shing bal ma gtogs par ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las byas kyang rung ngo //
translated: It is also made from any of these mentioned by name, except for the cotton used to fill the intervals of the seat.

original: gnas pa'i phyir don gyi bar du skabs su skabs su bya rog gi rkang pa sbyin /
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir don gyi bar du skabs su skabs su bya rog gi rkang pa sbyin /
translated: In order to keep it in place, crow's feet are applied at intervals.

original: stan gyi bar du shing bal la sogs pa bcug na phan tshun du mi 'chugs par bya ba'i phyir skud pa'i nan du bya rog gi rjes 'dra bas mnan /
analyzed: stan gyi bar du shing bal la sogs pa bcug na phan tshun du mi 'chugs par bya ba'i phyir skud pa'i nan du bya rog gi rjes 'dra bas mnan /
translated: In order to prevent the cotton and so forth from shifting around, it is pressed down with strings that resemble crow's feet.

original: gnyid 'ong na bum bu bcang /
analyzed: gnyid 'ong na bum bu bcang /
translated: If sleepiness occurs, one should hold the vase.

original: bsam gtan byed pa'i dus na mi yur bar bya ba'i phyir bum bu bcangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa'i dus na mi yur bar bya ba'i phyir bum bu bcangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one holds a stick in order to ward off people while one is meditating, there is no fault.

original: tha gus rna ba la gdags bum bu chus bkang la tha gus rna ba la gdags /
analyzed: tha gus rna ba la gdags bum bu chus bkang la tha gus rna ba la gdags /
translated: If one ties a stick to one’s ear, fills a vase with water, and ties the stick to one’s ear,

original: dbyig pas dal gyis gzugs /
analyzed: dbyig pas dal gyis gzugs /
translated: one may slowly support oneself with the stick.

original: bsam gtan pa yur ba bslang ba'i phyir gcig las gcig dbyug pas dal gyis btsugs la bslang /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa yur ba bslang ba'i phyir gcig las gcig dbyug pas dal gyis btsugs la bslang /
translated: If one digs a trench for the sake of a meditator, one may slowly dig with a stick, one from another.

original: mi snad pa'i phyir bri bzhin du bcad dam rus mas dkri /
analyzed: mi snad pa'i phyir bri bzhin du bcad dam rus mas dkri /
translated: In order not to injure oneself, one may cut or wrap with bone.

original: bslang ba'i phyir gzugs pa'i dbyug pa mi snang bar bya ba'i phyir shing kha drang por bcad ra das kyang dkri pho long 'phang /
analyzed: bslang ba'i phyir gzugs pa'i dbyug pa mi snang bar bya ba'i phyir shing kha drang por bcad ra das kyang dkri pho long 'phang /
translated: In order to dig, one may use a stick to support oneself. In order not to be seen, one may cut a straight piece of wood and wrap it with grass. One may also throw dice.

original: bsam gtan pa yur ba la pho long 'phangs te bslangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa yur ba la pho long 'phangs te bslangs kyang nyes med /
translated: If one throws dice and digs a trench for the sake of a meditator, there is no fault.

original: tha gus brtags te slar drang /🔽pho long 'phangs nas slar blangs te blang mi dgos pa'i @212a * //
analyzed: tha gus brtags te slar drang / pho long 'phangs nas slar blangs te blang mi dgos pa'i @212a * //
translated: One may tie a stick to one’s ear and pull it out.

original: phyir tha gus gdags /
analyzed: phyir tha gus gdags /
translated: If one throws dice and pulls out a trench, one may tie a stick to one’s ear in order not to need to pull it out again.

original: de'i mdun du me mar gzhag / bsam gtan byed pa'i mdun du me mar bud de gzhag na mi yur ba la phan /
analyzed: de'i mdun du me mar gzhag / bsam gtan byed pa'i mdun du me mar bud de gzhag na mi yur ba la phan /
translated: If the lamp is lit in front of the one who is practicing concentration, it is beneficial for the one who is sick.

original: rkang pa brkyang /
analyzed: rkang pa brkyang /
translated: He should stretch out his legs.

original: yur na rkang pa ya gcig brkyang gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: yur na rkang pa ya gcig brkyang gzhan yang ngo //
translated: If it is beneficial to stretch out one leg, he should stretch out the other.

original: rkang pa ya gcig brkyang ste ma phan na rkang pa gnyis ka brkyang /
analyzed: rkang pa ya gcig brkyang ste ma phan na rkang pa gnyis ka brkyang /
translated: If it is not beneficial to stretch out one leg, he should stretch out both legs.🔽He should walk.

original: bcag / rkang pa gnyis ka brkyang ste ma phan na langs te bcag go //
analyzed: bcag / rkang pa gnyis ka brkyang ste ma phan na langs te bcag go //
translated: If it is not beneficial to stretch out both legs, he should stand up and walk.

original: mi 'khrul pa'i phyir tha gu bres te spu bur bcug la tha gus btags te'o //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa'i phyir tha gu bres te spu bur bcug la tha gus btags te'o //
translated: In order to avoid confusion, he should tie a rope to a peg and fasten the rope to it.

original: mtshan mo bcag na mi 'khrul par bya ba'i phyir 'chag sar nam mkha' la thag bus bres te /
analyzed: mtshan mo bcag na mi 'khrul par bya ba'i phyir 'chag sar nam mkha' la thag bus bres te /
translated: In order to avoid confusion at night, he should stretch a rope in the walking place and fasten it to the sky.

original: thag bu la yang mig gam shing spu gu can bcug la de la yang thag bu las lag pas bzung la bcag go //
analyzed: thag bu la yang mig gam shing spu gu can bcug la de la yang thag bu las lag pas bzung la bcag go //
translated: He should also insert a peg or a wooden peg into the rope and hold it with his hand.

original: lham dang bcas te ma bcag /'chag pa'i tshe bsam gtan la gzhan mi 'dogs par bya ba'i phyir lham mi bgo //
analyzed: lham dang bcas te ma bcag /'chag pa'i tshe bsam gtan la gzhan mi 'dogs par bya ba'i phyir lham mi bgo //
translated: He should not walk with shoes on. In order to avoid attaching to other things while walking in concentration, he should not wear shoes.

original: bar bur gyis mi bcag par dre'u rdog gding /
analyzed: bar bur gyis mi bcag par dre'u rdog gding /
translated: One should not break the clod into pieces, but should spread it out like a donkey load.

original: 'chag pa'i gzhir rdul mi ldang ba dang rkang pa la mi zug pa'i phyir dre'u rdog bting yang nyes med do //
analyzed: 'chag pa'i gzhir rdul mi ldang ba dang rkang pa la mi zug pa'i phyir dre'u rdog bting yang nyes med do //
translated: It is not a fault to spread out the donkey load on the ground for walking, in order that dust does not rise up and in order that one's feet do not sink down.

original: nyi ma gsum zhing spang ba'i rkang bsku /
analyzed: nyi ma gsum zhing spang ba'i rkang bsku /
translated: One should anoint one's feet for three days.

original: bsam gtan byed pa'i nyi ma gsum zhing nad dang mig la phan pa'i phyir rkang pa la snum dang bsung gis bsku /
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa'i nyi ma gsum zhing nad dang mig la phan pa'i phyir rkang pa la snum dang bsung gis bsku /
translated: In order to benefit one's eyes and health, one should anoint one's feet with oil and perfume for three days while practicing concentration.

original: ma phod na der nyal /
analyzed: ma phod na der nyal /
translated: If one is unable, one should sleep there.

original: bsam gtan pa yur ba thabs ltag ma rnams ltar byed de yur ba la ma phan na nyal lo //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa yur ba thabs ltag ma rnams ltar byed de yur ba la ma phan na nyal lo //
translated: One should practice concentration like the water channel method. If the water channel does not help, one should sleep.

original: sgo bcad / nyal ba'i tshe khang bu'i sgo bcad do //
analyzed: sgo bcad / nyal ba'i tshe khang bu'i sgo bcad do //
translated: One should close the door. When sleeping, one should close the door of the hut.

original: glos kyang phab ste'o //
analyzed: glos kyang phab ste'o //
translated: One should also lower one's body.

original: nyal ba'i tshe glos kyang phab ste nyal kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: nyal ba'i tshe glos kyang phab ste nyal kyang nyes med do //
translated: Even when sleeping, it is not a fault to sleep while also lowering one's body.

original: bsgo'o // spong ba'i me la rtse ba yang ngo //
analyzed: bsgo'o // spong ba'i me la rtse ba yang ngo //
translated: One should be mindful. One should also be mindful of playing with the fire of abandonment.

original: bsam gtan byed pa rnams kyis zhal ta byed pa dang grong 'dzin pa gcig dge slong su dad pa la bsgo //
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa rnams kyis zhal ta byed pa dang grong 'dzin pa gcig dge slong su dad pa la bsgo //
translated: Those practicing concentration should be mindful of any service or village-holding done by a monk who has faith.

original: de'i tshul langs nas chag chag dang phyag dar dang rab tu gzhon nu'i lci bas skyang nul sbyin /🔽nang par sngar langs te bsam gtan gyi sar ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las su bskos pa'i dge slong des bya /
analyzed: de'i tshul langs nas chag chag dang phyag dar dang rab tu gzhon nu'i lci bas skyang nul sbyin / nang par sngar langs te bsam gtan gyi sar ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las su bskos pa'i dge slong des bya /
translated: Having done that, sprinkle water, sweep, and apply fresh cow dung.🔽In the morning, having risen early, the monk appointed to do the work should do the following, which are mentioned by name in the texts on the levels of meditative concentration.

original: stan gding / las su bskos pa des bsam gtan pa rnams stan gding /
analyzed: stan gding / las su bskos pa des bsam gtan pa rnams stan gding /
translated: The appointed monk should lay out the seats,

original: mi gtsang ba'i gnas bkru /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i gnas bkru /
translated: wash the place where people relieve themselves,

original: khang pa'i nang na bshang sa yod na kha la ngan skyugs chags pa yod na las byed pas bkru /
analyzed: khang pa'i nang na bshang sa yod na kha la ngan skyugs chags pa yod na las byed pas bkru /
translated: and if there is a toilet in the house, the appointed monk should wash it.

original: chag chag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chag chag la sogs pa'o //
translated: He should sprinkle water, etc.🔽He should sprinkle water and make a mandala in the place where people relieve themselves.

original: @212b bshang sa der chag chag dang mandal dag bya /🔽phyi ba dang sa dang chu yang gzhag / rku ba phyi'i 'ji ba ril bu dang / rdo dang chu la sogs pa bshang sar las su bskos pas der gzhag /'ong ba'i phyir gand'i sbyin /
analyzed: @212b bshang sa der chag chag dang mandal dag bya / phyi ba dang sa dang chu yang gzhag / rku ba phyi'i 'ji ba ril bu dang / rdo dang chu la sogs pa bshang sar las su bskos pas der gzhag /'ong ba'i phyir gand'i sbyin /
translated: He should also keep a shovel, earth, and water there.🔽The appointed monk should also keep a piece of wood, a ball of clay, and water for washing near the place where people relieve themselves.🔽He should give the signal to the assembly by striking a cymbal, etc.,

original: dus gsum mchod pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gar 'du'ang rung ste gand'i brdung ngo //
analyzed: dus gsum mchod pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gar 'du'ang rung ste gand'i brdung ngo //
translated: at the time of the three daily offerings, etc.

original: brdung pa'i thabs 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: brdung pa'i thabs 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The method of striking is explained below.🔽It is placed on top of the covering.🔽It is placed under the roof in order that it not be wet by rain, etc.

original: g-yogs pa'i steng der bzhag gand'i khang thog tu brdung ba'i sar char pa la sogs pas mi gsher pa'i phyir thog bor ba'i 'og tu gzhag / dge 'dun 'du ba'i phyir na rgyun gsum dang de tsam gyis bsnun par ro //
analyzed: g-yogs pa'i steng der bzhag gand'i khang thog tu brdung ba'i sar char pa la sogs pas mi gsher pa'i phyir thog bor ba'i 'og tu gzhag / dge 'dun 'du ba'i phyir na rgyun gsum dang de tsam gyis bsnun par ro //
translated: In order to assemble the Saṅgha, it is struck three times with the continuous sound and then with the sound of the end.

original: dge 'dun nang nub dus su 'du na ni che chung sbrengs pa las lan gsum brdab pa la mjug tu drag po lan gsum du gtogs /🔽las bslangs pa'i phyir na yang ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun nang nub dus su 'du na ni che chung sbrengs pa las lan gsum brdab pa la mjug tu drag po lan gsum du gtogs / las bslangs pa'i phyir na yang ste /
translated: If the Saṅgha assembles at the time of dawn, it is struck three times with the sound of the end.

original: rgyun dang gcig go //
analyzed: rgyun dang gcig go //
translated: In order to request the rite, it is struck once with the continuous sound.

original: 'phral la las zhig byed pa'i phyir dge 'dun bsdu ba ni che chung du sbrengs pa rgyun gcig dang mjug tu drag po gcig brdab po //
analyzed: 'phral la las zhig byed pa'i phyir dge 'dun bsdu ba ni che chung du sbrengs pa rgyun gcig dang mjug tu drag po gcig brdab po //
translated: In order to assemble the Saṅgha for the performance of a rite, it is struck once with the continuous sound and once with the sound of the end.

original: rgyun gsum bzlas pa la brgyab pa gnyis zhes gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: rgyun gsum bzlas pa la brgyab pa gnyis zhes gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: Others say that it is struck twice in the three repetitions of the continuous sound.

original: las la 'du ba la che chung du sbrengs pa rgyud gsum dang mjug tu drag po gcig brdab po //
analyzed: las la 'du ba la che chung du sbrengs pa rgyud gsum dang mjug tu drag po gcig brdab po //
translated: In order to assemble the Saṅgha for a rite, it is struck three times with the continuous sound and once with the sound of the end.

original: gnyis brdab kyang rung mdo ltag ma dang gang dga' ba bya'o //🔽shi ba gdeg pa'i phyir na dum dum por ro //
analyzed: gnyis brdab kyang rung mdo ltag ma dang gang dga' ba bya'o // shi ba gdeg pa'i phyir na dum dum por ro //
translated: If two die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.🔽If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.

original: dge slong shi ba'i phyir bsdu ba ni thabs drag dal dang rgyun gyi grangs med de dum bu dum bur bya /🔽rgyud gcig dang brgyab ste zhes gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i phyir bsdu ba ni thabs drag dal dang rgyun gyi grangs med de dum bu dum bur bya / rgyud gcig dang brgyab ste zhes gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.🔽If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.🔽If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.

original: shi ba las bsdu ba'i phyir che chung du sbrengs pa rgyud gcig dang mjug tu drag po gcig brdab kyang rung ste mdo ltag ma dang 'di gnyis gang byas kyang rung ngo //🔽spang ba'i phyir na khar gsil gyis so //
analyzed: shi ba las bsdu ba'i phyir che chung du sbrengs pa rgyud gcig dang mjug tu drag po gcig brdab kyang rung ste mdo ltag ma dang 'di gnyis gang byas kyang rung ngo // spang ba'i phyir na khar gsil gyis so //
translated: If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.

original: bsam gtan la 'du ba ni seg chad dang dril bu gang gis brda byas kyang rung ngo //🔽ka ti zhes gzhan dag gis so //🔽bsam gtan la 'du ba la gand'i chung ngu ka ti zhes bya ba brdungs kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan la 'du ba ni seg chad dang dril bu gang gis brda byas kyang rung ngo // ka ti zhes gzhan dag gis so // bsam gtan la 'du ba la gand'i chung ngu ka ti zhes bya ba brdungs kyang rung ngo //
translated: If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.🔽If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.🔽If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.

original: glo bur du gcig na nam chog tu'o //
analyzed: glo bur du gcig na nam chog tu'o //
translated: If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong or weak and continuous, but not by the number.🔽If many die, it is suitable to do it in the manner of the sutra or the manner of the back of the sutra.🔽If a monk dies, the gathering is done by the method of strong

original: chu dang me la sogs pa glo bur gcig byung na glo bur nam zhi ba'i bar du 'dod 'dod brdung ngo //
analyzed: chu dang me la sogs pa glo bur gcig byung na glo bur nam zhi ba'i bar du 'dod 'dod brdung ngo //
translated: If water, fire, and so forth suddenly occur, one should beat the gandi until the emergency is over.

original: glo bur zhi ba la phan no //
analyzed: glo bur zhi ba la phan no //
translated: It is helpful to end the emergency.

original: bza' bar 'du ba'i phyir na gnyis ka ste /🔽gand'i ka ti dang gand'i sbyin no //
analyzed: bza' bar 'du ba'i phyir na gnyis ka ste / gand'i ka ti dang gand'i sbyin no //
translated: In order to gather for meals, both [gandi] are beaten.

original: dro kar gdugs @213a * //
analyzed: dro kar gdugs @213a * //
translated: The gandi is given for the hot meal and the gandi is given for the cold meal.

original: tshod la 'du ba la ni gand'i che chung gnyis ka brdung ngo //
analyzed: tshod la 'du ba la ni gand'i che chung gnyis ka brdung ngo //
translated: At noon, both the large and small gandi are beaten.

original: skabs su bsdad de'o //
analyzed: skabs su bsdad de'o //
translated: One should stay in the intervals.

original: gand'i chung du dro kar sngar brdungs nas sku bla'i gzugs bkru /
analyzed: gand'i chung du dro kar sngar brdungs nas sku bla'i gzugs bkru /
translated: After beating the small gandi at noon, the images are bathed.

original: kha zas brtag pa'i zhal ta byas zin nas gdod gand'i chen po brdung ngo //
analyzed: kha zas brtag pa'i zhal ta byas zin nas gdod gand'i chen po brdung ngo //
translated: After the attendant has examined the food, the large gandi is beaten.

original: tshogs che ste gand'i byin pas ma grub cing ma go na dung 'bud do //
analyzed: tshogs che ste gand'i byin pas ma grub cing ma go na dung 'bud do //
translated: If the assembly is large and the gandi is not heard or understood, a conch is blown.

original: dge 'dun mang ste gand'i brdungs pas mi thos shing mi 'dus na mi gnyis kyis dung gnyis thabs cig du 'bud do //
analyzed: dge 'dun mang ste gand'i brdungs pas mi thos shing mi 'dus na mi gnyis kyis dung gnyis thabs cig du 'bud do //
translated: If the saṅgha is large and the beaten gandi is not heard or the saṅgha does not gather, two people blow two conches together.

original: rnga brdung / dung sbrel ma bus kyang mi 'dus na rnga bo che brdung ngo //
analyzed: rnga brdung / dung sbrel ma bus kyang mi 'dus na rnga bo che brdung ngo //
translated: If the saṅgha still does not gather even though a drum is beaten and the conches are blown, a great drum is beaten.

original: gand'i sa na mi 'gro bar mi bya /
analyzed: gand'i sa na mi 'gro bar mi bya /
translated: Do not go to the place of the signal drum without reason.

original: gand'i dang rnga brdungs ma thag tu 'du ba mi bcad par dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro'o //
analyzed: gand'i dang rnga brdungs ma thag tu 'du ba mi bcad par dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro'o //
translated: Do not interrupt the assembly of the Saṅgha immediately after the signal drum is beaten.

original: ma song na nyes byas /
analyzed: ma song na nyes byas /
translated: If you do not go, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi myur bar ma yin /
analyzed: mi myur bar ma yin /
translated: Do not go too slowly.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro ba yang le lor byas te ma 'dug par gand'i brdungs ma thag tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro ba yang le lor byas te ma 'dug par gand'i brdungs ma thag tu 'gro'o //
translated: Do not be lazy about going to the assembly of the Saṅgha. Go immediately after the signal drum is beaten.

original: dgos pa 'byor pa'i dus kyi las na ci bder bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa 'byor pa'i dus kyi las na ci bder bya'o //
translated: If you are engaged in a necessary activity, you may do as you like.

original: bsam gtan du zhugs pa'i rnams kyis dus mi rigs pa'i phyir gdugs tshod bab pa dang tho rangs sngar bslang pa dang nam gyi gung la nyal du bzung ba'i tshod la sogs pa las su bskos pa'i bya zhing sbran no zhes byi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: bsam gtan du zhugs pa'i rnams kyis dus mi rigs pa'i phyir gdugs tshod bab pa dang tho rangs sngar bslang pa dang nam gyi gung la nyal du bzung ba'i tshod la sogs pa las su bskos pa'i bya zhing sbran no zhes byi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: Since it is not the right time for those who are engaged in meditative concentration, the appointed person should wake them at the time of the midday meal, at dawn, or at the time of the middle of the night, and so on, and inform them. This is explained by Bhikṣu Jñāna.

original: gand'i brdung ba'i tshe bdag dge ba gzhan zhig rgyun du spyod de bar chad du mi rung na ma song yang nyes med do zhes byi shu tas bshad /
analyzed: gand'i brdung ba'i tshe bdag dge ba gzhan zhig rgyun du spyod de bar chad du mi rung na ma song yang nyes med do zhes byi shu tas bshad /
translated: If you are engaged in virtuous activity and it is not suitable to interrupt it, it is explained by Bhikṣu Śubha that there is no fault if you do not go.

original: sum rgyud byin te'o //
analyzed: sum rgyud byin te'o //
translated: The three-part drum is beaten.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams langs te 'dong pa'i tshe sum rgyud bklag /'di ni ran par sbyin /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams langs te 'dong pa'i tshe sum rgyud bklag /'di ni ran par sbyin /
translated: When the meditators rise and leave, the reciter of the Three Pledges should recite the Three Pledges. This is the proper giving.

original: sum rgyud bklag pa mi ring bar ran par bya /
analyzed: sum rgyud bklag pa mi ring bar ran par bya /
translated: The recitation of the Three Pledges should be done in a proper way, not too long.

original: sbyin pa las 'chags pa bya /
analyzed: sbyin pa las 'chags pa bya /
translated: One should confess from giving.

original: zas thos pa'i 'og tu sbyin bdag la sogs pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa klag / ran par ro //
analyzed: zas thos pa'i 'og tu sbyin bdag la sogs pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa klag / ran par ro //
translated: After the meal, for the sake of the donor and so on, the donor should recite the verses of giving properly.

original: sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ran pa mi ring bar bya /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ran pa mi ring bar bya /
translated: The verses of giving should be recited properly, not too long.

original: mel tse ba ni tha ma nas 'gro //
analyzed: mel tse ba ni tha ma nas 'gro //
translated: The night watchman should go from the end.

original: bsam gtan las 'gyes pa'i tshe las su bskos pa'i dge slong des las dang zhal ta dag byas nas phyi bzhin du 'gro'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan las 'gyes pa'i tshe las su bskos pa'i dge slong des las dang zhal ta dag byas nas phyi bzhin du 'gro'o //
translated: When the meditation is over, the monk appointed to the task should do the work and the service and go after them.

original: 'ong ba na sngon du'o /
analyzed: 'ong ba na sngon du'o /
translated: When coming, he should go in front.

original: bsam gtan la 'du ba'i tshe tha ma na mi 'dug par sngon du song ste las dang zhal ta bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la 'du ba'i tshe tha ma na mi 'dug par sngon du song ste las dang zhal ta bya'o //
translated: When the meditation is over, he should not stay at the end, but should go in front and do the work and the service.

original: 'on te de lta bu'i rkyen cig gis lde mig sba ba byas na bstan to //
analyzed: 'on te de lta bu'i rkyen cig gis lde mig sba ba byas na bstan to //
translated: If such a condition is made, the key should be hidden and shown.

original: las su bskos pa dge slong de rkyen cig gis gud du 'gro na @213b lde mig 'di na yod do zhes grogs la bstan te 'gro'o //
analyzed: las su bskos pa dge slong de rkyen cig gis gud du 'gro na @213b lde mig 'di na yod do zhes grogs la bstan te 'gro'o //
translated: If the monk appointed to the task has to go away for some reason, he should show the key to his companion and say, “The key is here.”

original: gso sbyong gi dngos po ste zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi dngos po ste zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong du chud pa'o //
translated: The substance of the poṣadha is to be included in the poṣadha of śamatha.

original: bsam gtan gyi zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong rdzogs so /
translated: The poṣadha of dhyāna śamatha is complete.

original: // / bco lnga'i gso sbyong byed pa la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / bco lnga'i gso sbyong byed pa la 'chad de /
translated: The poṣadha of the fifteenth is explained as follows:

original: gso sbyong mngon par bsko //🔽dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis gso sbyong bya ba'i sa thams cad /
analyzed: gso sbyong mngon par bsko // dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis gso sbyong bya ba'i sa thams cad /
translated: The poṣadha is to be performed.🔽The poṣadha is to be performed by the saṅgha through the karman of requesting and asking.

original: byas pa dang skyes pa zin pa'i dngos por ro //
analyzed: byas pa dang skyes pa zin pa'i dngos por ro //
translated: The place where the poṣadha is performed is to be made clean and ready.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi mtshams ni 'dom dang bcas /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi mtshams ni 'dom dang bcas /
translated: The outer boundary is one fathom.

original: gso sbyong gi khang pa rtsig pa chu dang gad pa la sogs pa yod na bar 'dom gang gis bcad la gtsang ba dang yangs pa dang mi rtsed par brtsig go //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi khang pa rtsig pa chu dang gad pa la sogs pa yod na bar 'dom gang gis bcad la gtsang ba dang yangs pa dang mi rtsed par brtsig go //
translated: If the poṣadha house has walls, water, and so forth, it is to be built one fathom away, clean, spacious, and not for play.

original: dge 'dun dad par ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun dad par ro //
translated: The saṅgha is to have faith.

original: gso sbyong gi khang pa brtsig pa dge 'dun kun la dad pa dris te gar dad par bya /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi khang pa brtsig pa dge 'dun kun la dad pa dris te gar dad par bya /
translated: The construction of a purification-house is to be done where the Sangha has faith.

original: las dag kyang de'i gnas so //
analyzed: las dag kyang de'i gnas so //
translated: And the rites are performed there.

original: gso sbyong gi khang pa der tshul nas 'byung ba dang tshul du 'jug pa dang bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa la sogs pa'i las kyang der bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi khang pa der tshul nas 'byung ba dang tshul du 'jug pa dang bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa la sogs pa'i las kyang der bya'o //
translated: The rites of the Patimokkha, of the Uposatha, of the Pavarana, of the Upasampada ordination, and so on, are to be performed in that purification-house.🔽The boundary is to be set.

original: mtshams bcad / dge 'dun gnas pa la spyod pa bde ba'i phyir mtshams bcad do //
analyzed: mtshams bcad / dge 'dun gnas pa la spyod pa bde ba'i phyir mtshams bcad do //
translated: The boundary is to be set for the sake of the comfort of the Sangha living there.

original: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mthar ro //
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mthar ro //
translated: It is to be set at a distance of one and a half yojanas.

original: mtshams bcad pa ni bar du chu la sogs pa mtshams gzhan gyis mchod na dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad du bcad du rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa ni bar du chu la sogs pa mtshams gzhan gyis mchod na dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad du bcad du rung ngo //
translated: The boundary is to be set at a distance of one and a half yojanas, if it is not obstructed by water, etc., or by another boundary.

original: rdo dang rtsig pa dang ka ba dang shing rlon pa dang ra ba dang gad pa dang khre lam dang chu 'thung ba la sogs pa phyogs so sor dmigs par shes pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi drung du kun bsgrags pa ni bstan pa'i mtshan te las
analyzed: rdo dang rtsig pa dang ka ba dang shing rlon pa dang ra ba dang gad pa dang khre lam dang chu 'thung ba la sogs pa phyogs so sor dmigs par shes pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi drung du kun bsgrags pa ni bstan pa'i mtshan te las
translated: The sign of the announcement is that a monk who knows the directions and the boundaries of the Sangha should announce in the presence of the Sangha, “The boundary is to be set in such and such a place.”

original: bya / mtshams bcad pa'i mtshan ma ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las mtshams btsugs te dge 'dun thams cad 'dus nas kun shes par byas te gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bcad mtshan ma ni phyogs bzhi re re btsugs pas chog / gnang ba byas na der
analyzed: bya / mtshams bcad pa'i mtshan ma ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las mtshams btsugs te dge 'dun thams cad 'dus nas kun shes par byas te gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bcad mtshan ma ni phyogs bzhi re re btsugs pas chog / gnang ba byas na der
translated: The sign of the boundary is that it is sufficient to set the boundary in each of the four directions.

original: chos gos dang mi 'bral mtshams bcad na rgan po dang nad pa chos gas mi theg pa dge 'dun gyis chos gos dang mi 'bral bar gnang ba byin na chos gos dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gos dang mi 'bral mtshams bcad na rgan po dang nad pa chos gas mi theg pa dge 'dun gyis chos gos dang mi 'bral bar gnang ba byin na chos gos dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If permission is given, then if the boundary is set so that one cannot be separated from one’s robes, then the Sangha should give permission for the elderly and the sick who are unable to travel to be separated from their robes.

original: 'di bya rgan po dang nad pa chos gos dang 'bral ba'i gsol ba gdab ste mi theg / bden na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba sbyin no //
analyzed: 'di bya rgan po dang nad pa chos gos dang 'bral ba'i gsol ba gdab ste mi theg / bden na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba sbyin no //
translated: This is the request of an old bird or a sick monk who is separated from his robes. If it is true, the Saṅgha should give permission.

original: thams cad kyi @214a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi @214a * //
translated: For all of them,

original: phyir dkyil 'khor bya bar bsko //
analyzed: phyir dkyil 'khor bya bar bsko //
translated: the maṇḍala should be drawn in the area to be defined.

original: snga ma ma btang na nang du bcad pa mi skye /
analyzed: snga ma ma btang na nang du bcad pa mi skye /
translated: If the previous boundary has not been relinquished, the new one will not arise.

original: mtshams snga ma bcad pa ma bkrol bar phyi ma bcad kyang mtshams bcad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams snga ma bcad pa ma bkrol bar phyi ma bcad kyang mtshams bcad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the previous boundary has not been released, even if the new one is defined, the boundary will not be defined.

original: mtshams btang ngo //
analyzed: mtshams btang ngo //
translated: The boundary is released.

original: mtshams gnyis tshig gcig gis bcad pa'am btang du rung ngo ;
analyzed: mtshams gnyis tshig gcig gis bcad pa'am btang du rung ngo ;
translated: It is suitable to define or release two boundaries with one statement.

original: / mtshams gnyis so sor gcod de bar nye na bar du thag pa bres te mtshams gnyis ka thag pas non par byas la /
analyzed: / mtshams gnyis so sor gcod de bar nye na bar du thag pa bres te mtshams gnyis ka thag pas non par byas la /
translated: Two boundaries are defined separately. If they are close, a rope is stretched between them, and both boundaries are covered with the rope.

original: pha rol tshu rol gnyis kar dge 'dun du langs par 'khod pa la bar du dge slong gcig 'dug ste gsol ba dang zhu ba byas na tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis bcad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tshu rol gnyis kar dge 'dun du langs par 'khod pa la bar du dge slong gcig 'dug ste gsol ba dang zhu ba byas na tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis bcad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk sits in the middle and makes the announcement and asks for the proclamation, the two boundaries will be defined with one statement.

original: dgrol ba'ang de bzhin du byar rung /
analyzed: dgrol ba'ang de bzhin du byar rung /
translated: It is also suitable to release the boundary in the same way.

original: las kyis mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas kyi mtshams rtsig pa'o //
analyzed: las kyis mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas kyi mtshams rtsig pa'o //
translated: The boundary of a place where the boundary has not been established by ritual is a wall.

original: gsol ba dang zhu bas mtshams ma bcad na gtsug lag khang gi phyir tshun chad mtshams su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu bas mtshams ma bcad na gtsug lag khang gi phyir tshun chad mtshams su gtogs pa'o //
translated: If the boundary has not been established by request and by announcement, it is included within the boundary up to the edge of the monastery.

original: wa'i chu bab pa gang du ltung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: wa'i chu bab pa gang du ltung ba yang ngo //
translated: It is also where the water of a roof gutter falls.

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyir med pa zhig na khang pa'i wa'i chu phyi rol du ltung ba'i rjes tshun chad mtshams su gtogs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyir med pa zhig na khang pa'i wa'i chu phyi rol du ltung ba'i rjes tshun chad mtshams su gtogs so //
translated: If there is no monastery, the boundary is included up to the edge of the place where the water of a house gutter falls outside.

original: grong gi na mtshams kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: grong gi na mtshams kyi mtha'o //
translated: In a village, it is the edge of the boundary.

original: grong khyer zhig na gnas na ra ba dang sab ma dang 'obs gsum gang yang rung bar bya gang bab pa la sogs pa gong du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer zhig na gnas na ra ba dang sab ma dang 'obs gsum gang yang rung bar bya gang bab pa la sogs pa gong du bshad pa yin no //
translated: If one lives in a village, it is any of the three: a wall, a fence, or a moat. The rest is as explained above.

original: dgon par na phyogs so sor rgyang grags kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: dgon par na phyogs so sor rgyang grags kyi mtha'o //
translated: In the wilderness, it is the edge of a krośa in each direction.

original: dgon pa na gnas te bar mtshams gzhan gyis ma chod na rgyang grags gcig tshun chad rang mtshams su chud do //
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas te bar mtshams gzhan gyis ma chod na rgyang grags gcig tshun chad rang mtshams su chud do //
translated: If one lives in the wilderness, it is included within one’s own boundary up to a krośa, if there is no other intervening boundary.

original: gso sbyong gi dngos po ste gnas su chud pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi dngos po ste gnas su chud pa'o //
translated: The substance of the poṣadha is the place where it is held.

original: gso sbyong la 'du ba'i mtshams gcig na gnas pa kun du dgos pa dang mtshams bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong la 'du ba'i mtshams gcig na gnas pa kun du dgos pa dang mtshams bcad pa'o //
translated: The boundary of the poṣadha is the place where the saṃgha gathers.

original: dad pa byin na de dag gis 'du ba 'grub po //
analyzed: dad pa byin na de dag gis 'du ba 'grub po //
translated: If one gives one’s consent, one is considered to have participated in the gathering.

original: gso sbyong la 'du ba nad pa dang rgan por 'du bar 'ong mi nus te dad pa phul nas 'dus pa dang 'dra ste gso sbyong du rung ngo //
analyzed: gso sbyong la 'du ba nad pa dang rgan por 'du bar 'ong mi nus te dad pa phul nas 'dus pa dang 'dra ste gso sbyong du rung ngo //
translated: If one is sick or old and cannot come to the poṣadha, one can give one’s consent and it is as if one has participated in the poṣadha.

original: mtshams gcod pa la ma yin /
analyzed: mtshams gcod pa la ma yin /
translated: But this is not the case for the boundary.

original: mtshams gcod pa'i tshe ni nad pa dang rgan po yang dad pa dbul du mi rung ste khyogs la blang ngam dge 'dun nad pa'i gan du dong ste mtshams bcad dgos so //
analyzed: mtshams gcod pa'i tshe ni nad pa dang rgan po yang dad pa dbul du mi rung ste khyogs la blang ngam dge 'dun nad pa'i gan du dong ste mtshams bcad dgos so //
translated: When the boundary is being set, even if one is sick or old, one cannot give one’s consent. One must be carried there or the saṃgha must go to the sick one and set the boundary.

original: slob pa byin pa las des bslang ba'am brtag pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa byin pa las des bslang ba'am brtag pa'o //
translated: If one gives one’s consent to a novice, he must inform the saṃgha or investigate.

original: mtshams gcod pa la slob pa byin pa las tha dad pa blang @214b na las su'ang rung dad pa phul bar kyang chud do //
analyzed: mtshams gcod pa la slob pa byin pa las tha dad pa blang @214b na las su'ang rung dad pa phul bar kyang chud do //
translated: When the boundary is being set, one must receive the consent of the novice separately. If one gives one’s consent, one is considered to be within the boundary.

original: de la dge slong du 'du shes gzhag na'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong du 'du shes gzhag na'o //
translated: One must have the perception of being a bhikṣu.

original: slob pa byin pa las dad pa blang ba ni thog ma slob pa byin pa la dge slong du 'du shes gzhag pa ni dad pa blang dgos kyi 'du shes ma bzhag pa ni dad pa blang mi dgos so zhes kyang bshad /
analyzed: slob pa byin pa las dad pa blang ba ni thog ma slob pa byin pa la dge slong du 'du shes gzhag pa ni dad pa blang dgos kyi 'du shes ma bzhag pa ni dad pa blang mi dgos so zhes kyang bshad /
translated: It is explained that if the learner is first given a gift, then if he is considered a fully ordained monk, the faithful should accept it. If he is not considered a fully ordained monk, the faithful need not accept it.

original: dad pa len pa'i tshe na dge slong ma yin snyam du bsams na dad pa blang par mi chud de las su mi rung ngo zhes kyang bshad /
analyzed: dad pa len pa'i tshe na dge slong ma yin snyam du bsams na dad pa blang par mi chud de las su mi rung ngo zhes kyang bshad /
translated: It is explained that if one thinks, I will not accept the faithful, then the faithful are not accepted and the action is not suitable.

original: mi sbyin no //
analyzed: mi sbyin no //
translated: It is not given.

original: slob pa byin pa zhig dad pa len du 'ongs na dad pa mi sbyin no //
analyzed: slob pa byin pa zhig dad pa len du 'ongs na dad pa mi sbyin no //
translated: If a learner comes to accept the faithful, the faithful are not given.

original: smyon par gnang ba mi brel ba yin no //
analyzed: smyon par gnang ba mi brel ba yin no //
translated: It is permitted for a madman who is not busy.

original: dge sbyong smyon pa tham thom can las byed pa'i tshe glo bur du 'gro ba zhig yod na dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis mi 'du ba dang dad pa mi blang par gnang byin na dad pa ma blangs kyang las su rung ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong smyon pa tham thom can las byed pa'i tshe glo bur du 'gro ba zhig yod na dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis mi 'du ba dang dad pa mi blang par gnang byin na dad pa ma blangs kyang las su rung ngo //
translated: If a mad ascetic is acting and suddenly leaves, the Saṅgha should not assemble or accept the faithful through the rite of announcement and request. If it is permitted to give without accepting the faithful, then the action is suitable even if the faithful are not accepted.

original: kun gtsang ba byin pa ni gcig tu'o //
analyzed: kun gtsang ba byin pa ni gcig tu'o //
translated: The gift of the pure is given to one alone.

original: dad pa len pa 'ong na dbul ba'i tshig ni bdag bar chad kyi chos kyang gtsang /
analyzed: dad pa len pa 'ong na dbul ba'i tshig ni bdag bar chad kyi chos kyang gtsang /
translated: If you are to receive the faith offering, say, “I am pure of the conditions of an obstacle.”

original: dge 'dun las byed pa la'ang dad do zhes bya /
analyzed: dge 'dun las byed pa la'ang dad do zhes bya /
translated: And say, “I have faith in the saṅgha’s activities.”

original: bdag gtsang ngo zhes ma byas na nyes pa yod pas 'phrig cing dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gtsang ngo zhes ma byas na nyes pa yod pas 'phrig cing dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not say, “I am pure,” you will be suspected of having an offense.

original: gtsang ngo zhes mi zer na bar chad yod dam zhes dris la yod na mthol du gzhug / gso sbyong du'o //
analyzed: gtsang ngo zhes mi zer na bar chad yod dam zhes dris la yod na mthol du gzhug / gso sbyong du'o //
translated: If you do not say, “I am pure,” ask, “Do you see, hear, or suspect that I have an offense?” If the answer is yes, confess it.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar kun gtsang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gso sbyong gi tshe dad pa dbul ba la dgos so //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar kun gtsang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gso sbyong gi tshe dad pa dbul ba la dgos so //
translated: The words “All are pure” are necessary for the faith offering at the observance ceremony.

original: 'byung ba na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba na yang ngo //
translated: They are also necessary when you are leaving the rainy season retreat.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe'ang dad pa phul na las su rung ngo //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe'ang dad pa phul na las su rung ngo //
translated: If you are leaving the rainy season retreat and you offer the faith offering, it is suitable.

original: de byin pas so //
analyzed: de byin pas so //
translated: Because you have given it.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe dad pa phul ba gcig pus mi chog gi bdag la khrims nyams par mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa yod na rgol cig ces skabs dbye ba dang bcas te dad pa dbul lo //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe dad pa phul ba gcig pus mi chog gi bdag la khrims nyams par mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa yod na rgol cig ces skabs dbye ba dang bcas te dad pa dbul lo //
translated: When you are leaving the rainy season retreat, it is not sufficient just to offer the faith offering. You should offer the faith offering with an announcement that says, “If you see, hear, or suspect that I have damaged the rules of training, speak up.”

original: 'di ltar de dag bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag bya'o //
translated: In this way, they should be done.

original: gso sbyong la kun gtsang ngo zhes dad pa dbul lo //
analyzed: gso sbyong la kun gtsang ngo zhes dad pa dbul lo //
translated: In the confession ceremony, they should offer the purity.

original: 'di ltar de dag bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag bya'o //
translated: In this way, they should be done.

original: gso sbyong la kun gtsang ngo zhes dad pa 'bul ba dang tshul gyi tshe nyes pa yod na rgol cig ces byas nas dad pa 'bul ba'i tshig dad pa len pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong la kun gtsang ngo zhes dad pa 'bul ba dang tshul gyi tshe nyes pa yod na rgol cig ces byas nas dad pa 'bul ba'i tshig dad pa len pa la bya'o //
translated: When offering the purity, one should say, If there is an offense during the confession ceremony, please point it out, and the words of offering the purity should be done by the one receiving the purity.

original: tshul 'di dag mnod //
analyzed: tshul 'di dag mnod //
translated: These rules should be followed.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar dad pa 'bul na dad pa len pas kyang de ltar mi gnang gis 'dong zhes mi bya'i zer ba bzhin du dad pa blang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar dad pa 'bul na dad pa len pas kyang de ltar mi gnang gis 'dong zhes mi bya'i zer ba bzhin du dad pa blang ngo //
translated: If the purity is offered according to the latter sūtra, the one receiving the purity should not say, I do not allow it, let us go, but should receive the purity as stated.

original: sde sder dad pa la sogs pa bskul te las byed na mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sde sder dad pa la sogs pa bskul te las byed na mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not inappropriate to urge the assembly to offer the purity, etc., and perform the action.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang du @215a * //
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang du @215a * //
translated: In one boundary,

original: gso sbyong la sogs pa dge 'dun so sor byed na gcig la gcig dad pa byin te bskul na so sor byas kyang las su rung ngo //
analyzed: gso sbyong la sogs pa dge 'dun so sor byed na gcig la gcig dad pa byin te bskul na so sor byas kyang las su rung ngo //
translated: if the Saṅgha performs confession, etc., separately, if they offer the purity to each other and urge each other, even if done separately, the action is suitable.

original: tshig mtshungs pa brtsams na bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig mtshungs pa brtsams na bral ba ma yin no //
translated: If the same words are used, it is not a separation.

original: dad pa len pas rab tu 'byung ba dang gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba la sogs pa las mang po zhig dad pa gcig car blang du rung ngo //
analyzed: dad pa len pas rab tu 'byung ba dang gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba la sogs pa las mang po zhig dad pa gcig car blang du rung ngo //
translated: It is proper to take the faith of many people at once, such as those who go forth as renunciates, those who take the one-day purificatory fast, those who take the precepts, and so on.

original: gcig gi du ma la blangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi du ma la blangs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not proper to take the faith of many people from one person.

original: mdo ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba bzhin du mi mang mo zhig las dad pa blangs kyang rung ngo //🔽chad pa ni 'di brjod nus na'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba bzhin du mi mang mo zhig las dad pa blangs kyang rung ngo // chad pa ni 'di brjod nus na'o //
translated: It is proper to take the faith of many people as it appears in the sutras.🔽But it is not proper to take the faith of many people from two people, as it appears in the two sutras.

original: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar mang du blang du rung ba ni bdag gis mi brjod cing zlos nus pa tshun chad dad pa blang dad pa len pa'i mi nyid kyang tshig gsal zhing smra mkhas pas dad pa blang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar mang du blang du rung ba ni bdag gis mi brjod cing zlos nus pa tshun chad dad pa blang dad pa len pa'i mi nyid kyang tshig gsal zhing smra mkhas pas dad pa blang ngo //
translated: One should take the faith of those who can express themselves clearly and speak well.

original: ci lta ci lta bus kyang 'di'i sbyin pa la mi nus pas kyang grub bo //
analyzed: ci lta ci lta bus kyang 'di'i sbyin pa la mi nus pas kyang grub bo //
translated: No matter what kind of person, if they are able to give, it is accomplished.

original: nad pa tshabs po che zhig las dad pa len te dris pa'i lan smra mi nus na yi ge dang mtshan ma dang tshig zur la sogs pa ci lta bus kyang dad pa byin par blang ngo //🔽chud do // lus kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: nad pa tshabs po che zhig las dad pa len te dris pa'i lan smra mi nus na yi ge dang mtshan ma dang tshig zur la sogs pa ci lta bus kyang dad pa byin par blang ngo // chud do // lus kyis kyang ngo //
translated: One should accept the faith of a person who is not sick, even if he is unable to speak, by means of gestures, signs, or words.

original: nad pa des smra mi nus shing dad pa'i brda lus kyi yan lag gis byed na'ang dad pa blangs par chud do //
analyzed: nad pa des smra mi nus shing dad pa'i brda lus kyi yan lag gis byed na'ang dad pa blangs par chud do //
translated: If the sick person is unable to speak, but can make gestures with his limbs to indicate his faith, his faith is accepted.

original: ci ltar mi phod na'ang dge 'dun der 'dong ngam de khyogs las bslang /
analyzed: ci ltar mi phod na'ang dge 'dun der 'dong ngam de khyogs las bslang /
translated: If he is unable to do that, one should go to him, or lift him onto a bed,🔽and perform the ceremony of the Poṣadha, etc.

original: gso sbyong la sogs pa'i las byed pa la nad pa la dad pa blang du nad pa de dbugs ni ma chad kyi lus dang ngag gi brda dang mtshan ma byed mi nus kyang rung dad pa dbul nus kyang mtshams bcad pa'i tshe dad pa phu la bas
analyzed: gso sbyong la sogs pa'i las byed pa la nad pa la dad pa blang du nad pa de dbugs ni ma chad kyi lus dang ngag gi brda dang mtshan ma byed mi nus kyang rung dad pa dbul nus kyang mtshams bcad pa'i tshe dad pa phu la bas
translated: If the sick person is unable to breathe, or to make gestures or signs with his body or speech, but is still able to give his faith, one should lift him into the midst of the Saṃgha and perform the ceremony.

original: las su mi rung ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyi nang du dad pa khyogs las blangs te las bya'o //
analyzed: las su mi rung ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyi nang du dad pa khyogs las blangs te las bya'o //
translated: If he is unable to do that, one should perform the ceremony after lifting him onto a bed.

original: yang na nad pa'i drung du dge 'dun song ste las bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nad pa'i drung du dge 'dun song ste las bya'o //
translated: Or the Saṅgha should go to the sick person and do the procedure there.🔽“Having received it, do not run.

original: de blangs te mi brgyug / dad pa len pas dad pa blangs te drag tu mi brgyug / mi drang /
analyzed: de blangs te mi brgyug / dad pa len pas dad pa blangs te drag tu mi brgyug / mi drang /
translated: Having received the faith, do not run fast. Do not run.

original: dogs par gyur na brel to //
analyzed: dogs par gyur na brel to //

translated: If one performs the poṣadha rite, it is not suitable for the rite, and one commits the serious offense of schism.

analyzed: dad pa ma blangs kyang rung zhes 'chad par bsams te gso sbyong byas kyang rung spom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thinks, “I will explain whether it is permissible or not to inquire about faith,” and performs the poṣadha rite, it is permissible.

analyzed: snying nas btsal na gtsang mar byed do //

translated: When one is doing the poṣadha, if one searches and calls out with all one's heart, thinking, 'Is there or is there not a bhikṣu left in the boundaries?', and does not find him, and realizes that there is none, then even if one does the poṣadha, it is suitable. Later, even if a bhikṣu appears, it is fine.

original: brtag pa tsam ma yin /

translated: If one is lazy and searches only superficially, without searching with all one's heart, and a bhikṣu appears, it is not suitable.

translated: If one does not understand the entire canon, one should read the remainder, saying, “I have heard this before.”🔽If one does not understand the entire canon, one should read the remainder, saying, “I have heard this before.”🔽If one does not understand the entire canon, one should read the remainder, saying, “I have heard this before.”🔽If one does not understand the entire canon, one should read the remainder, saying, “I have heard this before.”🔽If one does not understand the entire canon, one should read the remainder, saying, “I have heard this before.”

original: so sor thar pa bklag pa mdo ltag ma rnams ltar rnam bzhir tshigs su bcad pa 'das nas sum cu spang ba'i ltung ba'i mgo la reg ste chung zad smos nas ni rked du bcad de sngan chad thos pa'o zhes mdor klag tu mi rung gi mjug tu
analyzed: so sor thar pa bklag pa mdo ltag ma rnams ltar rnam bzhir tshigs su bcad pa 'das nas sum cu spang ba'i ltung ba'i mgo la reg ste chung zad smos nas ni rked du bcad de sngan chad thos pa'o zhes mdor klag tu mi rung gi mjug tu
translated: The Pratimoksha is to be recited in the same way as the sutras. After reciting the four parts, one should touch the beginning of the thirty downfalls that require relinquishment, recite them briefly, and then recite the middle part.

original: thal bar bklag dgos so //
analyzed: thal bar bklag dgos so //
translated: It is not suitable to recite the end of the sutra in brief. It must be recited in full.

original: zla ba phyed 'das pa de'i kun brtag zhag bco lnga 'das nas zla ba phyed kyi tshe so sor thar pa klag pa'i dus na bdag la ltung ba sde lnga las nyes par gyur pa ci yod dran par bsam /
analyzed: zla ba phyed 'das pa de'i kun brtag zhag bco lnga 'das nas zla ba phyed kyi tshe so sor thar pa klag pa'i dus na bdag la ltung ba sde lnga las nyes par gyur pa ci yod dran par bsam /
translated: After the end of the half month, when fifteen days have passed, at the time of reciting the Pratimoksha during the half month, one should think, “What faults have I committed from among the five classes of downfalls?”

original: 'du bar 'gyur ba'i tshe'o ;
analyzed: 'du bar 'gyur ba'i tshe'o ;
translated: One should think of this at the time of gathering together.

original: / mdo ltag ma ltar bsams pa'i dus ni so sor thar pa klag pa'i mdun du bsam zhing dran par bya /
analyzed: / mdo ltag ma ltar bsams pa'i dus ni so sor thar pa klag pa'i mdun du bsam zhing dran par bya /
translated: The time of thinking like the sutras is to think and remember in front of the recitation of the Pratimoksha.

original: tshor ba so sor bya ste thams cad du 'dug go //
analyzed: tshor ba so sor bya ste thams cad du 'dug go //
translated: One should feel each one and remain in all of them.

original: mdo ltag ma gnyis bsams nas phas pham pa yod na ni dge 'dun gyi nang du mi 'jug par gud du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma gnyis bsams nas phas pham pa yod na ni dge 'dun gyi nang du mi 'jug par gud du 'byung ngo //
translated: If he has a defeating offense, he is not admitted to the Sangha, but is expelled.🔽If he has a remaining offense or a concealed offense, he is examined and kept in a separate place, with a witness.

original: lhag ma yod dam so sor mthol ba zhig yod na grogs gcig la dpang gtsugs nas brtags te gzhag / so sor mthol ba dge 'dun gyi grangs tshangs ste mthol du rung ba dang ltung ba dang nyes byas las pa mthol tshangs bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma yod dam so sor mthol ba zhig yod na grogs gcig la dpang gtsugs nas brtags te gzhag / so sor mthol ba dge 'dun gyi grangs tshangs ste mthol du rung ba dang ltung ba dang nyes byas las pa mthol tshangs bya'o //
translated: If he has a concealed offense, he is to be purified by confession, since he is a full member of the Sangha and is fit to confess.

original: 'dus nas dran pa'am yid gnyis su na drung na mo la bsngo //
analyzed: 'dus nas dran pa'am yid gnyis su na drung na mo la bsngo //
translated: If he remembers an offense or has a doubt after the assembly has gathered, he should confess it to the monk sitting next to him.

original: dge 'dun 'dus zin te so sor thar ba bklags pas bskul bas nyes pa dran na drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gcig la mthol tshangs bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus zin te so sor thar ba bklags pas bskul bas nyes pa dran na drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong gcig la mthol tshangs bya'o //
translated: If he remembers an offense after the Sangha has gathered and the recitation of the Prātimokṣa has begun, he should confess it to the monk sitting next to him.

original: las byed pa ni sems la'o //
analyzed: las byed pa ni sems la'o //
translated: The action is in the mind.

original: so sor thar pa kha ton klog pa nyid klog pa'i tshe nyes pa byas par dran na langs te gzhan la mthol ba'i mi rigs ste bdag nyid kyis yid la mthol bas chog go //
analyzed: so sor thar pa kha ton klog pa nyid klog pa'i tshe nyes pa byas par dran na langs te gzhan la mthol ba'i mi rigs ste bdag nyid kyis yid la mthol bas chog go //
translated: If he remembers an offense while reciting the Prātimokṣa, it is not appropriate for him to stand up and confess it to someone else; it is sufficient for him to confess it to himself.

original: de ste bdag la med la bco lnga la shes na mdza' ba la mthun bar nan tan bya /🔽dge slong gzhan kun khrims ral cing nyes pa yod de dge slong gcig gcig gtsang ste mthol tshangs byed du mi btub na dge slong gtsang ma des thams cad mthol du gzhug par @217b thabs bya ba'i phyir bdag dang gang mdza' ba'i grogs po bdag la mthol tshangs
analyzed: de ste bdag la med la bco lnga la shes na mdza' ba la mthun bar nan tan bya / dge slong gzhan kun khrims ral cing nyes pa yod de dge slong gcig gcig gtsang ste mthol tshangs byed du mi btub na dge slong gtsang ma des thams cad mthol du gzhug par @217b thabs bya ba'i phyir bdag dang gang mdza' ba'i grogs po bdag la mthol tshangs
translated: If he knows that the other has fifteen downfalls but he himself has none, he should make efforts to reconcile with the other.🔽If all the other monks have broken their vows and have faults, but one monk is pure, and if the pure monk is unable to make the others confess and purify, then the pure monk should use means to make the others confess and purify.

original: byed du je gzhug go //
analyzed: byed du je gzhug go //
translated: He should make his own friends confess and purify.

original: mthol tshangs byed du ji ltar gzhug pa'i thabs ni 'og nas bshad pa yin /
analyzed: mthol tshangs byed du ji ltar gzhug pa'i thabs ni 'og nas bshad pa yin /
translated: The means of making them confess and purify will be explained below.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang gis 'di lta bu byas na de cir 'gyur ltung ba lta bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang gis 'di lta bu byas na de cir 'gyur ltung ba lta bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Venerable, if one does this, what happens?” “It is a downfall like this.”

original: 'o na tshe dang ldan pas de 'di lta bu dag ma byas sam byas ste de ltar yod na ni tshe dang ldan pa ltung ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na tshe dang ldan pas de 'di lta bu dag ma byas sam byas ste de ltar yod na ni tshe dang ldan pa ltung ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Well then, Venerable, didn’t you do this?” “Yes, I did.” “If that is so, Venerable, you have a downfall.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa nga gcig pu ma yin te dge 'dun thams cad kyang don 'di la'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nga gcig pu ma yin te dge 'dun thams cad kyang don 'di la'o //
translated: The elder said, Not only I, but the whole community is in this situation.

original: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog bdag gi ltung ba chos ji bzhin du byas so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog bdag gi ltung ba chos ji bzhin du byas so //
translated: The other said, Come, let us act according to the Dharma in regard to your transgression.🔽 The elder said, What should the whole community do?

original: dge 'dun thams cad kyis ci bya zhes rim gyis mthong ba'i lam du ste lhag ma rnams kyis 'dong na gshegs su gzhug go //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad kyis ci bya zhes rim gyis mthong ba'i lam du ste lhag ma rnams kyis 'dong na gshegs su gzhug go //
translated: The other said, If you go to the path of seeing, the rest will follow.

original: dge slong nyes pa med pa gtsang ma des mdza' bo nyes pa yod pa de la de nyid kyi nyes pa dmigs nas phyung ste 'di lta bu zhig byas na ltung bar 'gyur ram dri'o //
