analyzed: dge slong nyes pa med pa gtsang ma des mdza' bo nyes pa yod pa de la de nyid kyi nyes pa dmigs nas phyung ste 'di lta bu zhig byas na ltung bar 'gyur ram dri'o //
translated: The elder said, If the pure elder who is without fault sees the fault of his friend and expels him, will there be a transgression?

original: de ltar dris pa dang nyes pa'i dmigs 'dir 'gyur ro zhes zer na khyod la'ang de lta bu yod na mthol cig ces bya //
analyzed: de ltar dris pa dang nyes pa'i dmigs 'dir 'gyur ro zhes zer na khyod la'ang de lta bu yod na mthol cig ces bya //
translated: The other said, If you have such a fault, confess it!

original: de skad byas pa dang mdza' bo na re dge slong gzhan yang de lta bu spyod de mthol ci dgos zhes zer na dge slong gzhan nyes pa byed pa smos ci dgos khyod bdag gi nyes pa mthol cig ces byas te mthol du gzhug / mthol du gzhug🔽pa ni dge slong gzhan kun gyis kyang mthong bar lam kar sa mthon bor tsog tsog por gzhag la mthol du bcug dang nyes pa yod pa gzhan 'phrig cing 'dzem pa'i phyir khyod nga kho gnyis ci byed ces 'drir 'ongs te de dris pa dang mdza' bo des🔽drang por smras dang gzhan kun zla blta ste //
analyzed: de skad byas pa dang mdza' bo na re dge slong gzhan yang de lta bu spyod de mthol ci dgos zhes zer na dge slong gzhan nyes pa byed pa smos ci dgos khyod bdag gi nyes pa mthol cig ces byas te mthol du gzhug / mthol du gzhug pa ni dge slong gzhan kun gyis kyang mthong bar lam kar sa mthon bor tsog tsog por gzhag la mthol du bcug dang nyes pa yod pa gzhan 'phrig cing 'dzem pa'i phyir khyod nga kho gnyis ci byed ces 'drir 'ongs te de dris pa dang mdza' bo des drang por smras dang gzhan kun zla blta ste //
translated: When the friend says, Other monks also act like that. What is there to confess? the monk should say, What need is there to speak of other monks? You must confess your faults to me!🔽The monk should make him confess his faults in a place where others can see, sitting on the ground, not on a seat.🔽When the friend asks,

original: gcig la gcig mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: What are we two doing? the friend should say,🔽I am confessing my faults to him.

original: thabs de ltar gnyis gtsang par gyur pa dang de la thams cad mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: thabs de ltar gnyis gtsang par gyur pa dang de la thams cad mthol bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the two become pure.

original: mi 'dod na de la des mi bskul lo //
analyzed: mi 'dod na de la des mi bskul lo //
translated: If the friend does not wish to do this, the monk should not insist.

original: thabs ltag tu smos pa ltar bya ste mi dga' bar 'gyur zhing mthol tshangs byed du mi btub na mthol tshangs byos zhes drag tu mi bskul lo //
analyzed: thabs ltag tu smos pa ltar bya ste mi dga' bar 'gyur zhing mthol tshangs byed du mi btub na mthol tshangs byos zhes drag tu mi bskul lo //
translated: As for the method of confession, if the other person is not pleased and does not accept the confession, one should not insist on the confession.

original: 'on te bco lnga'i tshe de ltung ba mtshungs par dran nam yid gnyis kyis na bdag gis bshags pa'i gnas dag tu gang du yang btang ste 'dzin pa 'byor pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te bco lnga'i tshe de ltung ba mtshungs par dran nam yid gnyis kyis na bdag gis bshags pa'i gnas dag tu gang du yang btang ste 'dzin pa 'byor pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the other person remembers the downfall and is in doubt about it, one should not confess it to him, because he is not a suitable person to whom to confess.

original: dge 'dun thams cad la ltung ba 'dra bar yod na gcig la gcig @218a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad la ltung ba 'dra bar yod na gcig la gcig @218a * //
translated: If all the members of the community have the same downfall, they should not confess it to each other.

original: mthol na tshangs par mi 'gyur te ltung ba mtshungs par yod do //🔽shes sam ltung ba yod par 'dra'am /
analyzed: mthol na tshangs par mi 'gyur te ltung ba mtshungs par yod do // shes sam ltung ba yod par 'dra'am /
translated: If they do, the downfall is not purified, because they are in the same situation.

original: mi 'dra gtol med de /
analyzed: mi 'dra gtol med de /
translated: If one is not sure whether the other person knows about the downfall or whether the downfalls are the same,🔽one should not confess it to him.

original: the tshom yod na /
analyzed: the tshom yod na /
translated: If one is in doubt,

original: dge slong gtsang ma logs shig tu mthol dgos te /
analyzed: dge slong gtsang ma logs shig tu mthol dgos te /
translated: one should confess it to a pure monk.

original: dge 'dun ril gyis gud du mthol du 'dong du mi rigs kyi ;
analyzed: dge 'dun ril gyis gud du mthol du 'dong du mi rigs kyi ;
translated: It is not appropriate for the whole community to go and confess the downfall to another community.

original: / dge slong gcig gam gnyis shig dge slong gtsang ma ga la yod par mthol tshangs byed du dgye'o //
analyzed: / dge slong gcig gam gnyis shig dge slong gtsang ma ga la yod par mthol tshangs byed du dgye'o //
translated: One or two monks should be sent to confess in the presence of pure monks wherever they are.

original: dge slong mthol du bkye ba de slar 'khor na dge slong thams cad kun de la mthol na tshangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong mthol du bkye ba de slar 'khor na dge slong thams cad kun de la mthol na tshangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the monk who was sent to confess returns, then all the monks should confess in his presence and they will be purified.

original: mi 'byor na bsngo ba gsol bar 'dod par ro //
analyzed: mi 'byor na bsngo ba gsol bar 'dod par ro //
translated: If that is not possible, then one should request the dedication of merit.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar gud du dge slong gtsang ma la mthol du dgyer gud na dge slong gtsang ma med na ltung ba spyi'i sngags byas te so sor thar pa klag na'ang tshangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar gud du dge slong gtsang ma la mthol du dgyer gud na dge slong gtsang ma med na ltung ba spyi'i sngags byas te so sor thar pa klag na'ang tshangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not able to send a monk to confess in the presence of pure monks elsewhere, as in the case of the previous sūtra, then if there are no pure monks, one should recite the Prātimokṣa after reciting the confession of downfalls in general. In that way one will be purified.

original: bzhi man chad kyis kyang gtsug lag khang gi bya ba brtan par ro //
analyzed: bzhi man chad kyis kyang gtsug lag khang gi bya ba brtan par ro //
translated: Even if there are four or more monks, they should do the duties of the monastery firmly.

original: dge 'dun du ma tshang bar te dge slong bzhi man chad cig 'khod na'ang dge 'dun mang du 'khod pa'i tshul bzhin du gso sbyong bya la reg par bshams te zhal ta bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma tshang bar te dge slong bzhi man chad cig 'khod na'ang dge 'dun mang du 'khod pa'i tshul bzhin du gso sbyong bya la reg par bshams te zhal ta bya'o //
translated: If the saṅgha is incomplete, that is, if there are four or more monks present, then the poṣadha should be done in the manner of a large saṅgha. The arrangement of the seats should be done and the duties should be performed.

original: zhal ta dang las bya ba'i thabs ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: zhal ta dang las bya ba'i thabs ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The method of service and work will be explained below.

original: stan ding ba yang mi nyams par ro //
analyzed: stan ding ba yang mi nyams par ro //
translated: The seats should be spread out without being damaged.

original: dge 'dun du ma tshang yang dge 'dun mang du 'khod pa bzhin du stan la sogs pa gding ste zhib tu 'og nas 'chad chag chag dang phyag dar dang rab tu gzhon nu'i lci ba'i skyang nul byug / seng ge'i khri dang stan gding /
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma tshang yang dge 'dun mang du 'khod pa bzhin du stan la sogs pa gding ste zhib tu 'og nas 'chad chag chag dang phyag dar dang rab tu gzhon nu'i lci ba'i skyang nul byug / seng ge'i khri dang stan gding /
translated: Even if the saṅgha is not complete, the seats and so forth should be spread out as if many of the saṅgha were present. This will be explained in detail below.

original: me mar dang chos bsnyad pa'i sbyin pa bya /
analyzed: me mar dang chos bsnyad pa'i sbyin pa bya /
translated: One should make offerings of butter lamps and Dharma teachings.

original: phyogs mthon por 'dug la phyogs bzhir blta /
analyzed: phyogs mthon por 'dug la phyogs bzhir blta /
translated: Sitting on a high seat, one should look in the four directions.

original: dge 'dun ma tshangs yang ming gis smos ba 'di rnams tshul bzhin du bya ste dge slong gud nas 'ong ngam mi 'ong phyogs bzhir blta zhing byar byas la bsdad do //
analyzed: dge 'dun ma tshangs yang ming gis smos ba 'di rnams tshul bzhin du bya ste dge slong gud nas 'ong ngam mi 'ong phyogs bzhir blta zhing byar byas la bsdad do //
translated: Even if the saṅgha is not complete, one should do this properly by mentioning their names. One should look in the four directions, thinking, Will a monk come or not? and then sit down.

original: dge slong dag mthong na 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa rings par rings thabs su sbyin /
analyzed: dge slong dag mthong na 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa rings par rings thabs su sbyin /
translated: If one sees monks, one should do this quickly and hastily.

original: ltag ma ltar bsdad pa las dge slong zhig gud nas 'ong ba mthong na tshe dang ldan pa la gor rings sbyin no zhes bya /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar bsdad pa las dge slong zhig gud nas 'ong ba mthong na tshe dang ldan pa la gor rings sbyin no zhes bya /
translated: If he sees a monk coming from another direction, he should say, “I will give you a gift of a meal.”

original: de ring dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong nam 'byung ba bco lnga'o zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de ring dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong nam 'byung ba bco lnga'o zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: “Today the purification of the community will occur.”

original: rings par shog shig pa'i tshig ni rings par shog shig pa'i dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong la bab pa'am tshul nas byung ba'i dus la bab kyis rings su shog shig ces bya /
analyzed: rings par shog shig pa'i tshig ni rings par shog shig pa'i dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong la bab pa'am tshul nas byung ba'i dus la bab kyis rings su shog shig ces bya /
translated: The words “come quickly” mean that the purification of the community has arrived or that the time has come for the purification of the community to occur, so come quickly.

original: bzhir ma tshang bas kyang bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: bzhir ma tshang bas kyang bsngo ba'o //
translated: The confession should be done even if there are fewer than four.

original: dge slong bzhir ma tshang ste @218b gsum man chad cig 'dug na'ang gcig la gcig nyes pa ci yod pa brtags te dpang btsugs te gzhag go //
analyzed: dge slong bzhir ma tshang ste @218b gsum man chad cig 'dug na'ang gcig la gcig nyes pa ci yod pa brtags te dpang btsugs te gzhag go //
translated: If there are fewer than four monks, that is, if there are three or fewer, they should examine each other for faults, and then they should wait.

original: nam dus kyi bar bsdad /
analyzed: nam dus kyi bar bsdad /
translated: They should wait until the time of day has passed.

original: dge slong bzhir ma tshang ste brtags te gzhag pa dge slong gud nas 'ongs pa skya rengs shar gyi bar du bsdad do //
analyzed: dge slong bzhir ma tshang ste brtags te gzhag pa dge slong gud nas 'ongs pa skya rengs shar gyi bar du bsdad do //
translated: If there are fewer than four monks, they should examine each other for faults, and then they should wait until dawn for a monk who has gone elsewhere to return.

original: ma 'ongs na gdod brtag go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs na gdod brtag go //
translated: If he does not return, they should then examine each other for faults.

original: 'ba' zhig na 'dug ste'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig na 'dug ste'o //
translated: But if there is only one, he should think, “The Arhat is present in my mind.”

original: gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong gzhan med de bdag gcig pur zad na yid la dgra bcom pa bzhugs par bsam ste nyes pa ci yod pa de brtags te gzhag go //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong gzhan med de bdag gcig pur zad na yid la dgra bcom pa bzhugs par bsam ste nyes pa ci yod pa de brtags te gzhag go //
translated: If there are no other monks at the time of the Poṣadha ceremony, and there is only one, he should think, “The Arhat is present in my mind,” and he should remain alone, having examined his faults.

original: gzhan dang lhan cig na lhag ma dang nye bar ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang lhan cig na lhag ma dang nye bar ro //
translated: If he is with others, he should remain with the remainder.

original: gso sbyong gi tshe grogs la bsdad de 'ongs nas bsnan te des kyang bzhir ma tshang na gcig la gcig brtags te gzhag pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi tshe grogs la bsdad de 'ongs nas bsnan te des kyang bzhir ma tshang na gcig la gcig brtags te gzhag pa la'ang bya /
translated: If, at the time of the Poṣadha ceremony, he has come together with his friends, and if the number is not complete by four because of the addition of this one, then he should remain, having examined himself with regard to the other.

original: dge slong mang du med de gnyis su 'dug na nye bar tsog tsog por phas 'dug tshus 'dug ste gcig la gcig brtag go //
analyzed: dge slong mang du med de gnyis su 'dug na nye bar tsog tsog por phas 'dug tshus 'dug ste gcig la gcig brtag go //
translated: If there are not many monks, but only two, they should sit down cross-legged, facing each other, and examine each other.

original: gsum na 'khod de'o //
analyzed: gsum na 'khod de'o //
translated: If there are three, it is the same.🔽If there are not four monks, but only three, and if the dawn has come while they are waiting for the arrival of another, then all three, having sat down on a bench, should remain, having examined themselves.

original: dge slong bzhir ma tshang ste gsum zhig yod la skya rengs bar du bsdad de ma 'ongs na gsum char khri'u'i steng du 'khod de 'dug la brtags te gzhag / de bzhin du bzhi pa 'byung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong bzhir ma tshang ste gsum zhig yod la skya rengs bar du bsdad de ma 'ongs na gsum char khri'u'i steng du 'khod de 'dug la brtags te gzhag / de bzhin du bzhi pa 'byung ba yang ngo //
translated: The same if a fourth arrives.

original: gso sbyong gi tshe na dge slong bzhi yod na gso sbyong du rung ste so sor thar ba bklag / tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe ni dge slong lngar ma tshang na tshul nas 'byung ba'i las su mi rung ste gcig la gcig brtag pa ni sang phod kyi
analyzed: gso sbyong gi tshe na dge slong bzhi yod na gso sbyong du rung ste so sor thar ba bklag / tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe ni dge slong lngar ma tshang na tshul nas 'byung ba'i las su mi rung ste gcig la gcig brtag pa ni sang phod kyi
translated: When there is a ceremony for the rules, if there are not five fully ordained monks, the ceremony for the rules is not suitable.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe grangs tshang bar bya'o zhes bsam /
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe grangs tshang bar bya'o zhes bsam /
translated: When there is a ceremony for the rules, one should think, “I will make sure that the number is complete.”

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'chad pa de'i tshe gnas na med par shes na gso sbyong la mi bsdad do //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'chad pa de'i tshe gnas na med par shes na gso sbyong la mi bsdad do //
translated: When the Sūtra of Individual Liberation is being explained, if one knows that one is not present, one does not stay for the confession ceremony.

original: so sor thar pa klog cing cho ga shes pa med na gso sbyong gi dus kyi bar du mi bsdad par so sor thar pa kha ton shes pa gang la 'dug pa'i gan du 'gro ba'am btsal te 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa klog cing cho ga shes pa med na gso sbyong gi dus kyi bar du mi bsdad par so sor thar pa kha ton shes pa gang la 'dug pa'i gan du 'gro ba'am btsal te 'jug par bya'o //
translated: If there is no one who knows the ritual while the individual liberation is being recited, one should not stay until the time of the confession ceremony, but should go to or search out someone who knows the recitation of the individual liberation and enter into that.

original: gang na 'di las rgal ba der tshul du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gang na 'di las rgal ba der tshul du mi 'jug go //
translated: Where there is no one who has crossed over this, one should not enter into the rules there.

original: so sor thar pa kha ton dang cho ga shes pa med na tshul du zhugs kyang 'dral dgos pa'i phyir tshul du mi 'jug par tshol du 'gro'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa kha ton dang cho ga shes pa med na tshul du zhugs kyang 'dral dgos pa'i phyir tshul du mi 'jug par tshol du 'gro'o //
translated: If he does not know the Prātimokṣa and the ritual, he should not enter the order, but should go away to seek the knowledge.

original: sngon gyi tshul du zhugs pa mi bsrung ngo //🔽tshul snga mar tshul du zhugs pa las so sor thar pa'i kha ton dang cho ga shes pa shi'am gud du song ngam /
analyzed: sngon gyi tshul du zhugs pa mi bsrung ngo // tshul snga mar tshul du zhugs pa las so sor thar pa'i kha ton dang cho ga shes pa shi'am gud du song ngam /
translated: He should not protect the former rule.🔽If he has entered the former rule, but the one who knows the Prātimokṣa and the ritual dies, goes away,

original: khyim par babs na tshul mi bsrung bar shes pa tshol du 'gro'o //
analyzed: khyim par babs na tshul mi bsrung bar shes pa tshol du 'gro'o //
translated: or becomes a layman, he should know that he should not protect the rule, and he should go away to seek .

original: phyi ma zla ba gnyis las 'das par ro //
analyzed: phyi ma zla ba gnyis las 'das par ro //
translated: After two months have passed.

original: tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las so sor thar pa @219a * //
analyzed: tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las so sor thar pa @219a * //
translated: If he has entered the latter rule, but the one who knows the Prātimokṣa

original: shes pa shi'am med par gyur na zla ba gnyis kyi bar du tshul khrims bsrungs la de nas dral te tshul dang cho ga shes pa tshol du 'gro'o //
analyzed: shes pa shi'am med par gyur na zla ba gnyis kyi bar du tshul khrims bsrungs la de nas dral te tshul dang cho ga shes pa tshol du 'gro'o //
translated: dies or disappears, he should protect the rule for two months. After that, he should leave the rule and go away to seek the knowledge of the rule and the ritual.

original: dngos po dang las dang 'thob pa dang g-yog 'khor spang ba 'chad pa btsal lo //
analyzed: dngos po dang las dang 'thob pa dang g-yog 'khor spang ba 'chad pa btsal lo //
translated: He should seek the explanation of the things, actions, obtainment, and attendants to be abandoned.

original: so sor thar pa shes pa med de spyan 'dren na khang bu bzang por bsdams te sbyin pa dang dge 'dun gyi las su mi gzhug pa dang dge 'dun gyi zas dang yon la sogs pa skal ba gzhan gyi bzhin du sbyin pa dang / dge slong dang khyim pa las g-yog sbyin par khang blangs te spyan drang ngo //
analyzed: so sor thar pa shes pa med de spyan 'dren na khang bu bzang por bsdams te sbyin pa dang dge 'dun gyi las su mi gzhug pa dang dge 'dun gyi zas dang yon la sogs pa skal ba gzhan gyi bzhin du sbyin pa dang / dge slong dang khyim pa las g-yog sbyin par khang blangs te spyan drang ngo //
translated: And one should invite him, having taken a servant from a monk or a layman.

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i 'og nas gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan dag gis bsu /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa'i 'og nas gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan dag gis bsu /
translated: After the Sutra-holder, one should receive him with parasols, victory banners, and flags.

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa mkhas pa zhig spyan ma drangs kyang gud nas 'ong bar thos na ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis bkur sti bya ste mchod cing bsu'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa mkhas pa zhig spyan ma drangs kyang gud nas 'ong bar thos na ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis bkur sti bya ste mchod cing bsu'o //
translated: If one hears that a learned Sutra-holder is coming, even if he is not invited, one should honor him with these names, and receive him with offerings.

original: 'dul ba dang ma lta bu dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ma lta bu dag la yang ngo //
translated: And also with the Vinaya and the Mother.

original: gud nas spyan ma drangs par 'dul ba dang ma lta bu 'dzin pa zhig 'ong bar thos na'ang mdo sde 'dzin pa bzhin du bsu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gud nas spyan ma drangs par 'dul ba dang ma lta bu 'dzin pa zhig 'ong bar thos na'ang mdo sde 'dzin pa bzhin du bsu bar bya'o //
translated: If one hears that a Vinaya-holder or a Mother-holder is coming, even if he is not invited, one should receive him as if he were a Sutra-holder.

original: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du'o //
translated: and three and a half yojanas.

original: bsu ba'i tshad ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du bsu'o //
analyzed: bsu ba'i tshad ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du bsu'o //
translated: The distance for going out to meet is three and a half yojanas.

original: ma nus na rgyang grags lngar ro //
analyzed: ma nus na rgyang grags lngar ro //
translated: If one is unable, then five krośas.

original: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du bsu ma nus na rgyang grags lnga tsam du bsu'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du bsu ma nus na rgyang grags lnga tsam du bsu'o //
translated: If one is unable to go out to meet at three and a half yojanas, then one should go out to meet at five krośas.

original: gsum mam dpag tshad phyed dam rgyang grags sam rgyang grags phyed dam ra ba'am tshig 'jam pos bsu ste lhung bzed dang chos gos blang ngo //
analyzed: gsum mam dpag tshad phyed dam rgyang grags sam rgyang grags phyed dam ra ba'am tshig 'jam pos bsu ste lhung bzed dang chos gos blang ngo //
translated: If one is unable to go out to meet at three yojanas, or one and a half yojanas, or five krośas, or two and a half krośas, or one krośa, or half a krośa, or the distance of a village, then one should go out to meet with gentle words, and receive the alms-bowl and robes.

original: ltag ma ltar bsu ba ma nus na dpag tshad phyed de rgyang grags bzhir bsu der kyang bsu ma nus na rgyang grags phyed dmar ba'i phyi rol tsam du 'ang bsu'o //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar bsu ba ma nus na dpag tshad phyed de rgyang grags bzhir bsu der kyang bsu ma nus na rgyang grags phyed dmar ba'i phyi rol tsam du 'ang bsu'o //
translated: If one is unable to go out to meet like the top of a mountain, then one should go out to meet at one and a half yojanas, or four krośas. If one is unable to go out to meet there, then one should go out to meet at two and a half krośas, or at the outskirts of the village.

original: bsu ba'i tshe 'dzum zhing mdangs can du byas la bde bar byon tam zhes byas la de ltar smra zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa blang zhing bsu /
analyzed: bsu ba'i tshe 'dzum zhing mdangs can du byas la bde bar byon tam zhes byas la de ltar smra zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa blang zhing bsu /
translated: When going out to meet, one should smile and be radiant, saying, Have you arrived well? and thus speak, receiving the alms-bowl, robes, and so on, and going out to meet.

original: khrus bya / gud nas 'ongs te bsu ba de brus bya lus dag mnye /
analyzed: khrus bya / gud nas 'ongs te bsu ba de brus bya lus dag mnye /
translated: One should bathe, and the one who has come from outside should be welcomed and his body massaged.

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang snum thob par ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang snum thob par ro //
translated: The Saṅgha should also give him oil for bathing.

original: gud nas 'ongs te bsu ba de dge 'dun gyis kyang kha zas bzang pos mgron bya zhing lus bsku ba'i snum la sogs pa sbyin /
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs te bsu ba de dge 'dun gyis kyang kha zas bzang pos mgron bya zhing lus bsku ba'i snum la sogs pa sbyin /
translated: The Saṅgha should also entertain the one who has come from outside with good food and give him oil for bathing and so forth.

original: dngos po la sogs pa spang ba sbyin /
analyzed: dngos po la sogs pa spang ba sbyin /
translated: One should give him things such as a robe.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma lta bu 'dzin pa spyan drangs kyang rung rang 'ongs kyang rung khong bu dang g-yog la sogs ba sbyin te so sor @219b thar pa shes pa spyan drangs pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma lta bu 'dzin pa spyan drangs kyang rung rang 'ongs kyang rung khong bu dang g-yog la sogs ba sbyin te so sor @219b thar pa shes pa spyan drangs pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If one invites a scholar of the sūtras and the vinaya, or if one comes by oneself, one should give him a son, a servant, and so forth, and act as if one were inviting a knower of the pratimokṣa.

original: chos mnyan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: chos mnyan pa yang ngo //
translated: One should also listen to the dharma.

original: mkhan po mkhas pa gud nas 'ongs na bsti stang dang mgu bar bya zhing rtag par 'dug par bya ba'i phyir yi ge gra btsugs pa dang kha don mtshan rangs bya /
analyzed: mkhan po mkhas pa gud nas 'ongs na bsti stang dang mgu bar bya zhing rtag par 'dug par bya ba'i phyir yi ge gra btsugs pa dang kha don mtshan rangs bya /
translated: If a learned preceptor comes from outside, one should establish a school in order to honor him and make him stay permanently, and one should recite the alphabet and the meaning of the words all night.

original: bstan pa 'dzin pa la 'di ltar dge slong phrag dog na chud par ro //
analyzed: bstan pa 'dzin pa la 'di ltar dge slong phrag dog na chud par ro //
translated: If a monk is jealous of the one who upholds the teaching, he should be expelled.

original: dge slong mkhas pa la gud nas 'ongs pa la bsu zhing bsti stang byas pa dang mkhas pa gzhan phrag dog langs na phrag dog bya'i mi rigs kyi gcig tu na rim gro gyis shig par sangs rgyas kyi bka'i gzhung las 'byung /
analyzed: dge slong mkhas pa la gud nas 'ongs pa la bsu zhing bsti stang byas pa dang mkhas pa gzhan phrag dog langs na phrag dog bya'i mi rigs kyi gcig tu na rim gro gyis shig par sangs rgyas kyi bka'i gzhung las 'byung /
translated: If a learned monk comes from elsewhere, he should be welcomed and honored. If other learned people become jealous, they should not be jealous. It is proper to honor them. This is stated in the scriptures of the Buddha.

original: gcig tu na sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i tshig kho la yod pas rim gro bya ba'i rigs te de la phrag dog skyes na sdig tu 'gyur gyi ma byed cig ces gros gdab /
analyzed: gcig tu na sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i tshig kho la yod pas rim gro bya ba'i rigs te de la phrag dog skyes na sdig tu 'gyur gyi ma byed cig ces gros gdab /
translated: It is proper to honor them because they possess the words of the Buddha's teachings. If you become jealous, it becomes a misdeed. Do not do it.

original: gso sbyong nam 'byung ba ma byas par de'i nyin mo yod na bdag gi gnas nas mi 'gro //
analyzed: gso sbyong nam 'byung ba ma byas par de'i nyin mo yod na bdag gi gnas nas mi 'gro //
translated: If the poṣadha ceremony is not performed on the proper day, do not leave your dwelling on that day.

original: gso sbyong la bab pa'i nyin par dang / tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe gso sbyong dang tshul gyi las ma byas par gud du mi 'gro song na nyes byas /
analyzed: gso sbyong la bab pa'i nyin par dang / tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe gso sbyong dang tshul gyi las ma byas par gud du mi 'gro song na nyes byas /
translated: If the poṣadha ceremony and the ceremony of the monastic code are not performed on the proper day, do not leave for another place. If you go, it is a misdeed.

original: de ste de nyid na rnam par thos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ste de nyid na rnam par thos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you do not leave, it is not a misdeed.

original: rkyen gcig gis mi 'gror mi rung ba la pha rol du 'gro ba'i gnas de na gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba'i cho ga dang kha ton shes pa yod na ma byas par song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: rkyen gcig gis mi 'gror mi rung ba la pha rol du 'gro ba'i gnas de na gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba'i cho ga dang kha ton shes pa yod na ma byas par song yang nyes med do //
translated: If it is not possible to go to the one condition, but there is a place to go to the other, and if there is a poṣadha and a ceremony of the Vinaya and the recitation of the Prātimokṣa, then even if one goes without doing the poṣadha, there is no fault.

original: 'thab mo byed pa dag la mthar zhing dam pa'i tshul can dang phrad do zhes bsams na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'thab mo byed pa dag la mthar zhing dam pa'i tshul can dang phrad do zhes bsams na yang ngo //
translated: If one thinks, “I will go to the end of the battle and meet with the holy ones,” there is no fault.

original: bdag cag 'khod pa na dge slong 'thab mo pa yod de rtag tu 'khrug cing mi 'dum na /
analyzed: bdag cag 'khod pa na dge slong 'thab mo pa yod de rtag tu 'khrug cing mi 'dum na /
translated: If one thinks, “While we are staying here, there is a monk who is quarrelsome, always fighting and not in harmony,

original: tshul dang ldan zhing mi 'khrug pa'i dge 'dun gyi gan du 'gro bar bsams na gso sbyong ma byas par song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: tshul dang ldan zhing mi 'khrug pa'i dge 'dun gyi gan du 'gro bar bsams na gso sbyong ma byas par song yang nyes med do //
translated: and I will go to the Saṅgha who are in harmony and not fighting,” then even if one goes without doing the poṣadha, there is no fault.

original: dam pa'i tshul can gyi dge slong las 'thab mo byed pa'i dge slong gan du mi 'gro //
analyzed: dam pa'i tshul can gyi dge slong las 'thab mo byed pa'i dge slong gan du mi 'gro //
translated: A monk who is quarrelsome should not go to a monk who is holy.

original: dge slong tshul dang ldan zhing mi 'khrug la 'tsho ba'i yo byad mi bzad pa zhig na yang dge slong 'khrug cing 'thab rtsod pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad bzang zhing 'byor du zin kyang tshul can bor te 'thab mo can 'khod pa'i gnas su mi 'gro bar tshul
analyzed: dge slong tshul dang ldan zhing mi 'khrug la 'tsho ba'i yo byad mi bzad pa zhig na yang dge slong 'khrug cing 'thab rtsod pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad bzang zhing 'byor du zin kyang tshul can bor te 'thab mo can 'khod pa'i gnas su mi 'gro bar tshul
translated: Even if a monk is endowed with morality and is not quarrelsome but has insufficient requisites for his livelihood, he should not go to a place where the monks are quarrelsome and have good requisites for their livelihood.

original: can gan na gnas so //🔽dge slong dang bcas pa nas dge slong med par ma yin te /
analyzed: can gan na gnas so // dge slong dang bcas pa nas dge slong med par ma yin te /
translated: He should stay with those who are endowed with morality.🔽He should not go to a place where there are no monks, but where there are monks who are endowed with morality.

original: dge slong tshul dang ldan pa dang gnas pa las tshul dang mi ldan pa'i gnas su dge sbyong med pa dang 'dra ste mi 'gro //🔽gcig tu na gtsug lag khang dge @220a * //
analyzed: dge slong tshul dang ldan pa dang gnas pa las tshul dang mi ldan pa'i gnas su dge sbyong med pa dang 'dra ste mi 'gro // gcig tu na gtsug lag khang dge @220a * //
translated: He should not go to a place where there are no ascetics, but where there are ascetics who are endowed with morality.🔽In one sense, he should not go from a monastery where there are monks to a monastery where there are no monks.

original: slong yod pa'i gnas nas dge slong med pa'i gnas gtsug lag khang stong bar mi 'gro ba la'ang bya /
analyzed: slong yod pa'i gnas nas dge slong med pa'i gnas gtsug lag khang stong bar mi 'gro ba la'ang bya /
translated: In another sense, he should not go from a place where there are monks to a place where there are no monks.

original: ma lus par ram gzhan rkyen gcig gam lus dang sems bde ba'i dbang gis na ma yin no //
analyzed: ma lus par ram gzhan rkyen gcig gam lus dang sems bde ba'i dbang gis na ma yin no //
translated: He should not go because of a single condition, nor because of the power of physical and mental pleasure.

original: ltag ma rnams ltar 'gror mi rung ba la dge 'dun thams cad ril gyis 'dong ba dang srog la dman zhing dge sbyong gi tshul stor bar 'gyur ba dang sems 'khrugs shing mya ngan du gyur pa dang / yul grong khyer te lus la nad du gyur te rkyen 'di rnams lta bu zhig byung nas dge slong 'thab mo pa dang gtsug lag khang stong par song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: ltag ma rnams ltar 'gror mi rung ba la dge 'dun thams cad ril gyis 'dong ba dang srog la dman zhing dge sbyong gi tshul stor bar 'gyur ba dang sems 'khrugs shing mya ngan du gyur pa dang / yul grong khyer te lus la nad du gyur te rkyen 'di rnams lta bu zhig byung nas dge slong 'thab mo pa dang gtsug lag khang stong par song yang nyes med do //
translated: If such conditions arise and a monk who is quarrelsome goes to an empty temple, there is no fault.

original: gso sbyong dang 'byung ba ma byas pa gnas pa 'gro bar mi btang /
analyzed: gso sbyong dang 'byung ba ma byas pa gnas pa 'gro bar mi btang /
translated: “Do not allow those who have not done the confession ceremony and the arising from the rains residence to go away.”🔽“Do not go elsewhere without doing the confession ceremony and the arising from the rains residence that are to be done for the students and the assembly.”🔽If such a condition arises, one should say, “Do not go, elder so-and-so.”

original: slob ma dang 'khor las gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba'i las ma byas par gud du 'gro zhes zer na gnas brtan gang byed pas ma dgye shig / bkye na nyes byas /
analyzed: slob ma dang 'khor las gso sbyong dang tshul nas 'byung ba'i las ma byas par gud du 'gro zhes zer na gnas brtan gang byed pas ma dgye shig / bkye na nyes byas /
translated: If one sends him away, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs kyi rkyen dam pa'i tshul can ston pa dang ldan pa zhig na gnas che ge mo ba der 'phos shig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs kyi rkyen dam pa'i tshul can ston pa dang ldan pa zhig na gnas che ge mo ba der 'phos shig ces bsgo'o //
translated: “If such a condition arises, a monk who has the form of a holy person and who is endowed with the teachings should go to such-and-such a place.”

original: slob ma dang 'khor las gud du mi gtong bar gzhag tu lus dang srog la dma' zhing dge sbyong gi tshul stor ba tsam gyi rkyen cig byung na pha rol gyi gnas de na dge slong tshul dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / gso sbyong byed pa dang mi byed 'dren mar 'khod na dge slong tshul dang ldan zhing gso sbyong byed pa dang 'grogs la gso sbyong byos shig / tshul nas byung ste song shig ces bsgo nas btang yang nyes med do //
analyzed: slob ma dang 'khor las gud du mi gtong bar gzhag tu lus dang srog la dma' zhing dge sbyong gi tshul stor ba tsam gyi rkyen cig byung na pha rol gyi gnas de na dge slong tshul dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / gso sbyong byed pa dang mi byed 'dren mar 'khod na dge slong tshul dang ldan zhing gso sbyong byed pa dang 'grogs la gso sbyong byos shig / tshul nas byung ste song shig ces bsgo nas btang yang nyes med do //
translated: If the ethical monk who is doing the poṣadha purification is told, “Go out from the way of the monk,” then he should go out.🔽But if he is told, “Do not transgress this instruction,” then the wise should send him out like a criminal.

original: bsgo ba 'di las mi rgal mdo ltag ma ltar mkhas pos bsgo ste btang ba la mkhan pos bsgo ba bzhin du slob mas kyang mnyan cing bya'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba 'di las mi rgal mdo ltag ma ltar mkhas pos bsgo ste btang ba la mkhan pos bsgo ba bzhin du slob mas kyang mnyan cing bya'o //
translated: The disciple should listen to and do what the preceptor instructs.

original: brtags pa ni phyis 'ong ba'i phyir yang 'di dag bya bar ro //
analyzed: brtags pa ni phyis 'ong ba'i phyir yang 'di dag bya bar ro //
translated: The investigation is done so that he may come back later.

original: gso sbyong gi tshe snga na gzhi na 'khod pa'i dge slong gis gso sbyong dang tshul nas byung ba'i las byas zin pa'i 'og tu gud nas dge slong dag cig 'ongs te nged las 'dir bya bar ro ste 'ongs pa yin na slar las bsla ste byar cig
analyzed: gso sbyong gi tshe snga na gzhi na 'khod pa'i dge slong gis gso sbyong dang tshul nas byung ba'i las byas zin pa'i 'og tu gud nas dge slong dag cig 'ongs te nged las 'dir bya bar ro ste 'ongs pa yin na slar las bsla ste byar cig
translated: If, at the time of the purification and restoration ceremony, the monks who are present perform the purification and restoration ceremony and the ceremony arising from the rules, and later some other monks come and say, “We have come here to do this,” it is suitable to do it again.

original: nang zhes zer na slar bsla ste bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: nang zhes zer na slar bsla ste bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: If they say, “We are inside,” it is suitable to do it again.

original: yang dag par byas pa der 'dug par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: yang dag par byas pa der 'dug par 'dod na'o //
translated: If they wish to be present where it was done properly,

original: mdo ltag ma ltar slar bsla ste bya ba'i las su ma rung ngam mthol ba ma tshangs pa'i the tshom yod na slar bsla ste bya ba'i rigs the tshom med kyang gsol @220b na bsla ste bya ba'i rigs slar 'dus te ma byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar slar bsla ste bya ba'i las su ma rung ngam mthol ba ma tshangs pa'i the tshom yod na slar bsla ste bya ba'i rigs the tshom med kyang gsol @220b na bsla ste bya ba'i rigs slar 'dus te ma byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: if it is not suitable to do the ceremony again like the previous one, or if there is doubt about whether the confession is pure, it is suitable to do it again. Even if there is no doubt, it is suitable to do it again. If they gather again and do not do it, there is no fault.

original: mthun pa'i spyod pa na yang ngo //
analyzed: mthun pa'i spyod pa na yang ngo //
translated: It is also the same for harmonious conduct.

original: gtsug lag khang gi rkyen du gtogs pa'i dge slong las kha cig gud du dong ba'i 'og tu gzhi bas gso sbyong byas zin nas gud du 'dong ba 'khor te gso sbyong bslas par gsol na'ang bzlas pa'i rigs dge slong 'dron po snga phyir chad pa las snga🔽mas byas zin te phyi ma ma byas na slar bzlas te bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi rkyen du gtogs pa'i dge slong las kha cig gud du dong ba'i 'og tu gzhi bas gso sbyong byas zin nas gud du 'dong ba 'khor te gso sbyong bslas par gsol na'ang bzlas pa'i rigs dge slong 'dron po snga phyir chad pa las snga mas byas zin te phyi ma ma byas na slar bzlas te bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: If some monks who belong to the circumstances of a temple go elsewhere, and then the basis of the poṣadha is completed, and those who went elsewhere return and request the poṣadha to be repeated, it is appropriate to repeat it.🔽If the earlier group of traveling monks has already completed it and the later group has not, it is appropriate to repeat it.

original: 'du ba yang de dag bslang mdo ltag ma rnams ltar slar bslas par gsol te ma btub na dang pa dris te phyis 'ongs pa'i rnams nang gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: 'du ba yang de dag bslang mdo ltag ma rnams ltar slar bslas par gsol te ma btub na dang pa dris te phyis 'ongs pa'i rnams nang gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: If they are unable to request the poṣadha to be repeated as in the latter part of the sūtra, they should ask about the purity of the group and then perform the poṣadha later when the absent monks return.

original: ma thob na mtshams kyi phyi rol du bya /🔽mdo ltag ma ltar dad pa ma ster na mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ste gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: ma thob na mtshams kyi phyi rol du bya / mdo ltag ma ltar dad pa ma ster na mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ste gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: If they are unable to do that, they should perform the poṣadha outside the boundary.🔽If they are unable to do that as in the latter part of the sūtra, they should go outside the boundary and perform the poṣadha.

original: 'grub pa ni byed pa'i tshe 'ongs te lhag ma myong na'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa ni byed pa'i tshe 'ongs te lhag ma myong na'o //
translated: If they are unable to do that, they should perform the poṣadha when the absent monks return and the remainder is experienced.

original: dge slong bzhi la 'khod pas gso sbyong byed de /
analyzed: dge slong bzhi la 'khod pas gso sbyong byed de /
translated: The poṣadha is performed by a group of four monks.

original: so sor thar pa klog pa mjug tu ma phyin tshun chad du slebs na phyis 'ongs pa de rnams kyang gso sbyong byas par chud do //
analyzed: so sor thar pa klog pa mjug tu ma phyin tshun chad du slebs na phyis 'ongs pa de rnams kyang gso sbyong byas par chud do //
translated: If the Pratimoksha is not finished by the time the new monks arrive, the new monks should join in the confession and purification.

original: phyis 'ongs pa rnams gcig la gcig mthol ba ni tshul gyi mtshams kyi phyi rol du mthol zhing brtags la nad du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis 'ongs pa rnams gcig la gcig mthol ba ni tshul gyi mtshams kyi phyi rol du mthol zhing brtags la nad du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: If the new monks arrive after the confession and purification, they should confess their faults to each other outside the boundary of the community.

original: gang yang gnas nas ma song na gdon mi za bar ro //
analyzed: gang yang gnas nas ma song na gdon mi za bar ro //
translated: If they do not leave the monastery, they should certainly do the confession and purification.🔽If the monks who have already done the confession and purification leave the monastery, and if the new monks who arrive later are only a few, they should gather all the monks who have left and do the confession and purification together.

original: dge slong gzhi bas gso sbyong byas zin te gyes la dge slong phyis lhags pas gso sbyong byed pa'i gnas su dge slong 'ga' tsam zhig slebs na dge slong snga ma gyes pa kun slar bsdus te gso sbyong gyis shig /'ongs pa mang na yang ngo //🔽mdo ltag ma ltar slar 'du ba yang dge slong phyis lhags pa mang na 'du dgos so //
analyzed: dge slong gzhi bas gso sbyong byas zin te gyes la dge slong phyis lhags pas gso sbyong byed pa'i gnas su dge slong 'ga' tsam zhig slebs na dge slong snga ma gyes pa kun slar bsdus te gso sbyong gyis shig /'ongs pa mang na yang ngo // mdo ltag ma ltar slar 'du ba yang dge slong phyis lhags pa mang na 'du dgos so //
translated: If the new monks who arrive later are many, they should do the confession and purification together.🔽If the new monks who arrive later are many, they should do the confession and purification together.

original: gzhi ba mang na ma 'dus kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gzhi ba mang na ma 'dus kyang nyes med do //
translated: If the monks who have already done the confession and purification are many, it is not necessary for them to gather together.

original: dus kyang mang po'i phyir gzhug go //
analyzed: dus kyang mang po'i phyir gzhug go //
translated: The time should be extended for the sake of many.

original: dge slong gzhi ba dang gud nas 'ongs pa tshes grangs bcu bzhi dang bco lnga'i dus mi mthun na mi grangs gang mang pa'i khar dor ro //
analyzed: dge slong gzhi ba dang gud nas 'ongs pa tshes grangs bcu bzhi dang bco lnga'i dus mi mthun na mi grangs gang mang pa'i khar dor ro //
translated: If the number of monks who are residents and those who have come from elsewhere do not agree on the fourteenth or fifteenth day, then the number of the resident monks should be followed.

original: mnyam na gnas pas so //
analyzed: mnyam na gnas pas so //
translated: If they are the same, then the resident monks should be followed.

original: tshes grangs mi mthun la mi grangs mnyam na gzhi la yod pa'i dge slong bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: tshes grangs mi mthun la mi grangs mnyam na gzhi la yod pa'i dge slong bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If the number of days does not agree, but the number of monks does, then the resident monks should be followed.

original: gzhi bas gso sbyong byas te phyis dge slong lags na slar 'du ba yang grangs mnyan na gzhi ba brtsan te ma 'dus kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gzhi bas gso sbyong byas te phyis dge slong lags na slar 'du ba yang grangs mnyan na gzhi ba brtsan te ma 'dus kyang nyes med do //
translated: If the resident monks have already performed the poṣadha, and later the number of monks increases, then if the number of monks is the same, the resident monks should be followed. If they do not gather, there is no fault.

original: de yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ngo //
translated: That is also so.

original: slar 'du dgos pa ni dge slong phyis 'ongs pa grangs mang na snga mas las zin kyang mi phan te 'du dgos so //🔽gso sbyong gi tshul du chud @221a * //
analyzed: slar 'du dgos pa ni dge slong phyis 'ongs pa grangs mang na snga mas las zin kyang mi phan te 'du dgos so // gso sbyong gi tshul du chud @221a * //
translated: If the number of monks who have come later is greater, then it is not beneficial for the earlier monks to have finished their duties, they must gather.🔽The procedure for determining whether or not one is included in the poṣadha

original: pa'o ; / gso sbyong du chud dam mi chud pa'i cho ga bshad pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / gso sbyong du chud dam mi chud pa'i cho ga bshad pa'o //
translated: The procedure for determining whether or not one is included in the poṣadha is explained.

original: bsam gtan las mi bslang /
analyzed: bsam gtan las mi bslang /
translated: One should not rise from meditative concentration.

original: dge slong bsam gtan du bzhugs pa la sdang ba'am bslang bar mi bya bslang na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan du bzhugs pa la sdang ba'am bslang bar mi bya bslang na nyes byas /
translated: One should not disturb or rouse a monk who is in meditation. If one does so, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ston pa med par bsam gtan mi bya /
analyzed: ston pa med par bsam gtan mi bya /
translated: One should not meditate without a teacher.

original: bsam gtan gyi lung ston pa'i mkhan po med par thug thub tu bsam gtan mi bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi lung ston pa'i mkhan po med par thug thub tu bsam gtan mi bya /
translated: One should not meditate independently without a preceptor who can teach the meditation.

original: bum bu dang pho long gi sbyar ba yang rigs so //
analyzed: bum bu dang pho long gi sbyar ba yang rigs so //
translated: It is also appropriate to use a water pot and a ball.

original: bsam gtan byed pa dang gso sbyong byed pa'i tshe yur na bum bu rna ba la btags pa dang pho long gis brdeg pa 'ang nyes med de rigs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa dang gso sbyong byed pa'i tshe yur na bum bu rna ba la btags pa dang pho long gis brdeg pa 'ang nyes med de rigs so //
translated: When one is meditating or practicing the purification and restoration of one’s bodhisattva commitments, if one is tired, it is also appropriate to do so without fault if one ties the water pot to one’s ear and strikes it with the ball.

original: brtson 'grus mi glod /
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi glod /
translated: One should not relax one’s diligence.

original: dge ba ci spyod kyang rung lus dang sems kyis rgyun mi 'chad par bya /
analyzed: dge ba ci spyod kyang rung lus dang sems kyis rgyun mi 'chad par bya /
translated: No matter what virtuous activity one is engaged in, one should do it continuously, both physically and mentally.

original: lus na'am rkyen byung yang sems rgyun mi 'chad par bya /
analyzed: lus na'am rkyen byung yang sems rgyun mi 'chad par bya /
translated: Even if one’s body is sick or one is in difficult circumstances, one should not interrupt the continuity of one’s mental practice.

original: mdo bzhin du 'di yang ngo //
analyzed: mdo bzhin du 'di yang ngo //
translated: This is also like the sutras.

original: mdo sde'i nang nas brtson 'grus bya ba bzhin du brtson 'grus cher bskyed dgos te zan gyis 'grangs te snyom na'ang yon bdag gi bsod nams skyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus bskyed dgos so //
analyzed: mdo sde'i nang nas brtson 'grus bya ba bzhin du brtson 'grus cher bskyed dgos te zan gyis 'grangs te snyom na'ang yon bdag gi bsod nams skyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus bskyed dgos so //
translated: One should generate great effort as it is taught in the sutras. Even if one is full and comfortable, one should generate effort in order to generate the merit of the benefactors.

original: ma 'grangs su zin kyang brtson 'grus bskyed dgos te sha zad pags pa bsnyil gyi bar du bsgrim pa la bya /
analyzed: ma 'grangs su zin kyang brtson 'grus bskyed dgos te sha zad pags pa bsnyil gyi bar du bsgrim pa la bya /
translated: Even if one is not full, one should generate effort. One should be diligent until one's flesh is exhausted and one's skin is wrinkled.

original: mdo sde las bsam pa'i rgyud byung ba bzhin du 'og nas 'byung ba dang nyal khar bsam pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: mdo sde las bsam pa'i rgyud byung ba bzhin du 'og nas 'byung ba dang nyal khar bsam pa la'ang bya /
translated: As it occurs in the sutras, one should think as it will occur below and at the time of going to sleep.

original: yan lag dang / lus rang nyam du mi bya bar seng ge thabs su ne ban ltar nyal ba la bya /
analyzed: yan lag dang / lus rang nyam du mi bya bar seng ge thabs su ne ban ltar nyal ba la bya /
translated: One should not let one's limbs and body be uncontrolled, but should sleep like a lion, lying on one's right side.

original: sems dang gos kyang mi g-yel bar nyal brtag / sngon khyim pa dang mi dge ba'i las spyad pa dran bar mi bya'i dge ba la rgyun mi 'chad cing nang par sngar ldang bar bsams /
analyzed: sems dang gos kyang mi g-yel bar nyal brtag / sngon khyim pa dang mi dge ba'i las spyad pa dran bar mi bya'i dge ba la rgyun mi 'chad cing nang par sngar ldang bar bsams /
translated: One should sleep while examining one's mind and clothes without distraction. One should not recall one's previous life as a householder or one's practice of nonvirtue, but should think of virtue without interruption and get up early in the morning.

original: chos gos dang sham thabs dang ske rags la sogs ba 'thor bar mi gzhag gi mi sprug cing ltab la gnas gcig tu gzhag pa la bya /
analyzed: chos gos dang sham thabs dang ske rags la sogs ba 'thor bar mi gzhag gi mi sprug cing ltab la gnas gcig tu gzhag pa la bya /
translated: Do not leave your robes, lower robe, belt, and so forth scattered about. Do not shake them out, but fold them and place them in one place.

original: mi na bar nyin par mi nyal /
analyzed: mi na bar nyin par mi nyal /
translated: Do not sleep during the day unless you are sick.

original: mi na par nyin par nyal na nyes byas /
analyzed: mi na par nyin par nyal na nyes byas /
translated: If you are not sick, it is a fault to sleep during the day.

original: rked pa na bas pus 'khyud kyi snam bu bcang /
analyzed: rked pa na bas pus 'khyud kyi snam bu bcang /
translated: If you have a backache, you may wear a sash that goes between the legs.

original: rked pa na bas pus 'khyud bcangs kyang nyes med /🔽dbang po nang du chud yid phyir ma song par bcag ste mi nur gsal po drang por ro //
analyzed: rked pa na bas pus 'khyud bcangs kyang nyes med / dbang po nang du chud yid phyir ma song par bcag ste mi nur gsal po drang por ro //
translated: If you have a backache, it is not a fault to wear a sash that goes between the legs.🔽Do not walk around with your head covered.

original: 'chag pa'i tshe dbang po drug nang du bsdus te sems yul la ma bros par 'gros dal bar yang mi bya /
analyzed: 'chag pa'i tshe dbang po drug nang du bsdus te sems yul la ma bros par 'gros dal bar yang mi bya /
translated: When you are walking, do not let your six senses wander outside. Walk slowly, but not too slowly.

original: drag tu yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: drag tu yang mi 'gro //
translated: Do not walk too fast.

original: lus lhod lhod po dang rnyol rnyol por mi bya bar gsal por byas la drang por bcag go //🔽mi nus na thag bu drang /
analyzed: lus lhod lhod po dang rnyol rnyol por mi bya bar gsal por byas la drang por bcag go // mi nus na thag bu drang /
translated: Do not walk with your body loose and swaying. Walk with alertness and erect posture.🔽If you cannot do this, walk in a straight line.

original: 'chag pa'i @221b lam drang por 'gror mi nus na thag bu drangs la de'i 'gram chu dag bcag go //
analyzed: 'chag pa'i @221b lam drang por 'gror mi nus na thag bu drangs la de'i 'gram chu dag bcag go //
translated: If you cannot walk in a straight line, walk in a straight line by following a rope.

original: kha ton byed pa'i 'chag sa'i tshad ni khru bcu gnyis /
analyzed: kha ton byed pa'i 'chag sa'i tshad ni khru bcu gnyis /
translated: The place for reciting the scriptures is twelve cubits.

original: kha ton byed pa'i 'chag sa'i tshad ni khru bcu gnyis tshun chad du bya'o //
analyzed: kha ton byed pa'i 'chag sa'i tshad ni khru bcu gnyis tshun chad du bya'o //
translated: The place for reciting the scriptures should be twelve cubits.

original: spong ba'i ni bco brgyad do //
analyzed: spong ba'i ni bco brgyad do //
translated: The place for walking meditation is eighteen cubits.

original: bsam gtan byed pa'i 'chags khru tshad ma bco brgyad tshun chad du bcag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa'i 'chags khru tshad ma bco brgyad tshun chad du bcag go //
translated: The place for walking meditation for one who is practicing concentration should be eighteen cubits.

original: der thag bu drangs te bya /
analyzed: der thag bu drangs te bya /
translated: One should draw a line there.

original: 'chags byed pa'i tshe thag bu la khrus gcal /
analyzed: 'chags byed pa'i tshe thag bu la khrus gcal /
translated: When making the walking meditation, one should draw a line on the rope.

original: de tshad bzhin du sbyar la thag bus bres te drang por bya /
analyzed: de tshad bzhin du sbyar la thag bus bres te drang por bya /
translated: Having applied it according to the measure, one should make it straight by weaving with the rope.

original: dge slong gis 'dug nas chos bshad /
analyzed: dge slong gis 'dug nas chos bshad /
translated: The monk should explain the Dharma while sitting.

original: sangs rgyas zhal bzhugs su zin kyang dge slong gis chos bshad du rung ste sa la 'dug la bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhal bzhugs su zin kyang dge slong gis chos bshad du rung ste sa la 'dug la bshad do //
translated: Even if the Buddha were present, it is suitable for the monk to explain the Dharma. He should explain while sitting on the ground.

original: du ma na gcig gis so //
analyzed: du ma na gcig gis so //
translated: If there are many, one should do it.

original: mi mang du 'khod kyang chos 'chad pa gnyis su mi bya'i gcig gis bshad do //
analyzed: mi mang du 'khod kyang chos 'chad pa gnyis su mi bya'i gcig gis bshad do //
translated: Even if many people are gathered, one should not explain the Dharma in two places. One should explain in one place.

original: gang sus kyang ngo //
analyzed: gang sus kyang ngo //
translated: Whoever it may be.

original: chos 'chad pa ni gang mkhas pa gcig gis bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa ni gang mkhas pa gcig gis bshad do //
translated: The one who explains the Dharma is the one who is most learned.

original: ma bskos par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma bskos par yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it when not requested.

original: chos bshad du mi gsol bar bdag gis mdor to//
analyzed: chos bshad du mi gsol bar bdag gis mdor to//
translated: If one is not requested to teach the Dharma, one should not teach the Dharma in brief.

original: chos bshad par mi bya /
analyzed: chos bshad par mi bya /
translated: One should not teach the Dharma.

original: de ste de'i dngos 'ongs na ni ma yin /
analyzed: de ste de'i dngos 'ongs na ni ma yin /
translated: But if the other person is actually present, there is no offense.

original: chos bshad du gsol ba dang chos ston byas nas de'i rjes la yon bdag la chos bshad pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: chos bshad du gsol ba dang chos ston byas nas de'i rjes la yon bdag la chos bshad pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one is requested to teach the Dharma, and then teaches the Dharma, there is no offense in teaching the Dharma to the patron afterwards.

original: 'khor du ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor du ma yin /
translated: Not to an assembly.

original: mi phal mo che 'khod pa la grangs mang du bcad de phung bu phung bur bya ste gcig gi sgra gcig gis thos par mi bshad /
analyzed: mi phal mo che 'khod pa la grangs mang du bcad de phung bu phung bur bya ste gcig gi sgra gcig gis thos par mi bshad /
translated: One should not teach the Dharma to a large group of people, dividing them into sections and teaching each section separately, so that the sound of the teaching is not heard by everyone.

original: 'khor phyed du ma yin /🔽mi phal mo che 'khong pa la gcig gis mgo nas bshad /
analyzed: 'khor phyed du ma yin / mi phal mo che 'khong pa la gcig gis mgo nas bshad /
translated: Not to half of an assembly.

original: gcig gis mjug nas bshad de gcig gi sgra gcig gis thos par mi bya ste mi thos par bshad /
analyzed: gcig gis mjug nas bshad de gcig gi sgra gcig gis thos par mi bya ste mi thos par bshad /
translated: One should not teach the Dharma to a group of people, with one person teaching at the beginning and another teaching at the end, so that the sound of the teaching is not heard by everyone.

original: de gnyis kyi gcig tu ma yin /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gcig tu ma yin /
translated: Not to both.

original: khri bshams te chos bshad pa gnyis kyis cig car lhan cig tu smra zhing bshad par mi bya /
analyzed: khri bshams te chos bshad pa gnyis kyis cig car lhan cig tu smra zhing bshad par mi bya /
translated: One should not teach the Dharma simultaneously and together with two people who are seated on thrones.

original: rgan rabs kyis so //
analyzed: rgan rabs kyis so //
translated: To the elders.

original: chos bshad pa ni /
analyzed: chos bshad pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma.

original: rgan rab zhing chos mkhas pa btsun pa rnams kyis bshad /
analyzed: rgan rab zhing chos mkhas pa btsun pa rnams kyis bshad /
translated: The most senior and learned monks should teach.

original: de ste mang na stan gnyis gsum bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: de ste mang na stan gnyis gsum bzhag ste'o //
translated: If there are many, they should be seated in two or three rows.

original: na rgan pa mang la chos 'chad mkhas pa med kyi gral dma' ba'i nang nas chos bshad mkhas pa yod na gral spar te gong du gnyis gsum tsam gyi gral gzhag la de'i 'og tu 'chad pa gzhag / de ste stan med na ma yin no //
analyzed: na rgan pa mang la chos 'chad mkhas pa med kyi gral dma' ba'i nang nas chos bshad mkhas pa yod na gral spar te gong du gnyis gsum tsam gyi gral gzhag la de'i 'og tu 'chad pa gzhag / de ste stan med na ma yin no //
translated: If there are many senior monks but none who are learned in the teachings, if there is someone learned in the teachings in the lower ranks, he should be seated in the higher ranks, in two or three places.🔽If there are no seats, it is not necessary.

original: chos 'chad mkhas pa de rgan po gnyis gsum gyi 'og na 'dug na stan spar mi dgos pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: chos 'chad mkhas pa de rgan po gnyis gsum gyi 'og na 'dug na stan spar mi dgos pa la'ang bya /
translated: If that learned teacher of the teachings is seated in the lower ranks, two or three places below the senior monks, it is not necessary to move the seats.

original: seng ge'i khri yang ngo //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri yang ngo //
translated: It is also the same for the lion throne.

original: chos 'chad mkhas pa de @222a * //
analyzed: chos 'chad mkhas pa de @222a * //
translated: If that learned teacher of the teachings🔽is seated on a lion throne and is asked to teach from there, it is permissible to do so.

original: seng ge'i khri bshams te de'i steng du 'chad du bcug na'ang 'dug ste bshad na'ang nyes med /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri bshams te de'i steng du 'chad du bcug na'ang 'dug ste bshad na'ang nyes med /
translated: Place a spittoon.

original: mchil ma'i chol zangs zhog shig / chos 'chad pa'i drung du chol zangs mchil ma'i snod bzhag kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: mchil ma'i chol zangs zhog shig / chos 'chad pa'i drung du chol zangs mchil ma'i snod bzhag kyang nyes med do //
translated: It is permissible to place a spittoon in front of the teacher of the teachings.

original: der gding ba sbyin /
analyzed: der gding ba sbyin /
translated: Give a cushion.

original: mchil ma'i snod chol zangs kyi nang du 'og ma dag gzhag / bye ma'am thal bas so //
analyzed: mchil ma'i snod chol zangs kyi nang du 'og ma dag gzhag / bye ma'am thal bas so //
translated: Spitting is to spit into a spittoon or on the ground, not into the air or into water.🔽 Spit into a spittoon or on the ground, not into the air or into water.🔽 Spitting on the ground, one should not leave it there, but should wipe it up with a cloth or with ashes or sand.

original: chol zangs su bye ma'am sa'am tha lba blugs te gzhag / dus dus su bkru /
analyzed: chol zangs su bye ma'am sa'am tha lba blugs te gzhag / dus dus su bkru /
translated: Spitting on the ground, one should not leave it there, but should wipe it up with a cloth or with ashes or sand.

original: mchil ma ring du bzhag na sems can du gyur pas dus dus su bkru /
analyzed: mchil ma ring du bzhag na sems can du gyur pas dus dus su bkru /
translated: If one leaves it there, it becomes a sentient being and one should wash it from time to time.

original: nub mo chos bsnyad par bya /
analyzed: nub mo chos bsnyad par bya /
translated: One should recite the Dharma in the evening.

original: nub mo thog thag tu kha ton bya zhing yi ge klag dgos te dus ma yin pa ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: nub mo thog thag tu kha ton bya zhing yi ge klag dgos te dus ma yin pa ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: In the evening, one should recite the scriptures and read the texts. The time for this is explained below.

original: de ltar klag dgos pa ni ngos bzhi mgon po dang rim pa'i lha gtsug lag khang gi 'khor du dus der 'ong ba'i phyir dad pa dang dga' ba bskyed par bklag go //
analyzed: de ltar klag dgos pa ni ngos bzhi mgon po dang rim pa'i lha gtsug lag khang gi 'khor du dus der 'ong ba'i phyir dad pa dang dga' ba bskyed par bklag go //
translated: One should read in this way in order to generate faith and joy in the four-sided protector and the deities of the stages who come to the temple at that time.

original: tshes brgyad dang nyi shu gsum la mgon po dang lha bran gyi g-yog 'ong ba'i phyir yi ge bklag / bcu bzhi dang / tshes bcu bzhi dang nyi shu dgu la mgon po la sogs pa'i bu 'ong ba'i phyir yi ge bklag / bco lnga dang sum cu la mgon po dang lha nyid 'ong ba'i phyir yi ge bklag go //
analyzed: tshes brgyad dang nyi shu gsum la mgon po dang lha bran gyi g-yog 'ong ba'i phyir yi ge bklag / bcu bzhi dang / tshes bcu bzhi dang nyi shu dgu la mgon po la sogs pa'i bu 'ong ba'i phyir yi ge bklag / bco lnga dang sum cu la mgon po dang lha nyid 'ong ba'i phyir yi ge bklag go //
translated: On the fifteenth and thirtieth, read the letters because the Protector and the gods themselves come.

original: nad pa ni 'di ma byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: nad pa ni 'di ma byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one is sick, there is no fault in not doing this.

original: dus drug gi nub mo chos dang kha don klog pa la nad pa ni ma 'ongs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dus drug gi nub mo chos dang kha don klog pa la nad pa ni ma 'ongs kyang nyes med /
translated: If one is sick, there is no fault in not reading the Dharma and the recitations in the evening of the six times.

original: ma bklag kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: ma bklag kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one does not read, there is no fault.

original: bshad pa'i phyir bsgo ba'i tshe khas mi blang bar bya /
analyzed: bshad pa'i phyir bsgo ba'i tshe khas mi blang bar bya /
translated: When one is ordered to explain, one should not agree without accepting.

original: nub mo chos kha don klog pa'i res su bskos na sus bskos kyang rung ngag mnyan no //
analyzed: nub mo chos kha don klog pa'i res su bskos na sus bskos kyang rung ngag mnyan no //
translated: If one is appointed to read the Dharma and the recitations in the evening, one should listen to whoever appoints it.

original: mi nus pa la sogs pa bsgo ba la gsol /
analyzed: mi nus pa la sogs pa bsgo ba la gsol /
translated: One should request the appointment of those who are unable and so forth.

original: kha ton dang klog mi nus pa zhig yin te bskos na su bsko bde la bdag gis ni mi nus na skyin pa gcig btsal te btang ngo zhes gsol /
analyzed: kha ton dang klog mi nus pa zhig yin te bskos na su bsko bde la bdag gis ni mi nus na skyin pa gcig btsal te btang ngo zhes gsol /
translated: If he is unable to recite or read, he should be appointed to a post where he can be of service. If he is unable to do that, he should be given a stipend and dismissed.

original: 'chad pa med na rim gyis 'don cing bshad /
analyzed: 'chad pa med na rim gyis 'don cing bshad /
translated: If there is no one to teach, he should recite and explain in turn.

original: kha don mang du shes pa med dam mang du mi thon na chung zad shes pa kun rim du brje zhing yang bklag go //
analyzed: kha don mang du shes pa med dam mang du mi thon na chung zad shes pa kun rim du brje zhing yang bklag go //
translated: If there is no one who knows many recitations, or if many are not recited, he should recite in turn whatever he knows.

original: mthar na tshigs su bcad pa gcig kyang ngo //
analyzed: mthar na tshigs su bcad pa gcig kyang ngo //
translated: At the very least, he should recite one verse.

original: kha don nyung du yang mi shes na res kyis tshigs su bcad pa re re tsam yang bklag ste /
analyzed: kha don nyung du yang mi shes na res kyis tshigs su bcad pa re re tsam yang bklag ste /
translated: If he does not know even a few recitations, he should recite one verse at a time.

original: nub mo ring du thub cing mtshan zad par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de lan mang du bzlas so //
analyzed: nub mo ring du thub cing mtshan zad par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de lan mang du bzlas so //
translated: In order to make the night long and to pass the night, he should repeat that verse many times.

original: me mar der bya /
analyzed: me mar der bya /
translated: He should do this in front of a lamp.

original: nub mo chos kha don klog pa'i phyir me mar bud pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: nub mo chos kha don klog pa'i phyir me mar bud pa la'ang bya /
translated: He should also do this in front of a burning lamp in order to recite the Dharma at night.

original: mgon @222b po snang yel che bar me mar kha mang du bkram ste bud pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: mgon @222b po snang yel che bar me mar kha mang du bkram ste bud pa la'ang bya /
translated: He should also do this in front of many burning lamps, spreading light, in order to make the night bright.

original: zla ba phyed 'dra ba'am rdzing bu 'dra ba'i chos bsnyad pa'i gtam bya ste mthangs su'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed 'dra ba'am rdzing bu 'dra ba'i chos bsnyad pa'i gtam bya ste mthangs su'o //
translated: The discourse on the Dharma is like the half-moon or a pond.

original: chos bshad pa'i dral thabs ni zla ba kham pa 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i dral thabs ni zla ba kham pa 'dra ba'am /
translated: The method of explaining the Dharma is like the half-moon or a pond.

original: rdzing bu 'dra bar dang rang la ma yin man du 'gro ba'i phyir gral gyi skabs bor te mthangs gdod /
analyzed: rdzing bu 'dra bar dang rang la ma yin man du 'gro ba'i phyir gral gyi skabs bor te mthangs gdod /
translated: Because it goes to the end without skipping the order of the rows, it is at the end.🔽If the Dharma is explained in the open air, a canopy should be set up.

original: bla gab med par chos bsnyad na bla re gdags thang bla gab med pa la chos 'chad na ras la sogs pa'i bla re gdags so //
analyzed: bla gab med par chos bsnyad na bla re gdags thang bla gab med pa la chos 'chad na ras la sogs pa'i bla re gdags so //
translated: If the Dharma is explained in the open air, a canopy of cloth, etc. should be set up.🔽If wind or rain enters, it should be covered.

original: rlung ngam char pa na gzhug / thang la chos 'chad par bla re gdags pa las rlung dang char pa bab na bsdu /
analyzed: rlung ngam char pa na gzhug / thang la chos 'chad par bla re gdags pa las rlung dang char pa bab na bsdu /
translated: When setting up a canopy for explaining the Dharma on the plain, if wind or rain falls, it should be gathered.

original: de'i phyir chos bsnyad par mi gtong /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos bsnyad par mi gtong /
translated: Therefore, it does not give rise to the Dharma.

original: bla re bsdus kyang chos 'chad pa gtong du mi rung ste khang pa yod na'ang der 'phos la chos shod cig / gnas brtan sngar song nas kha rog ste skad cig 'dug na 'dir chos 'chad dam gzhan bsko te dge slong chos smros shig ces so //
analyzed: bla re bsdus kyang chos 'chad pa gtong du mi rung ste khang pa yod na'ang der 'phos la chos shod cig / gnas brtan sngar song nas kha rog ste skad cig 'dug na 'dir chos 'chad dam gzhan bsko te dge slong chos smros shig ces so //
translated: If the elder goes first and sits silently for a moment, should he teach the Dharma here or appoint another and say, “Bhikṣu, teach the Dharma”?

original: chos 'chad pa'i tshe gnas brtan thog mar song la khri'i steng du skad cig mi smra bar 'dug la de nas chos bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i tshe gnas brtan thog mar song la khri'i steng du skad cig mi smra bar 'dug la de nas chos bshad do //
translated: When teaching the Dharma, the elder should go first and sit silently on the seat for a moment, and then teach the Dharma.

original: yang na dge slong chos shes pa la shod cig ces bsko zhing smra'o //
analyzed: yang na dge slong chos shes pa la shod cig ces bsko zhing smra'o //
translated: Or he should appoint and say to a bhikṣu who knows the Dharma, “Teach.”

original: 'chad pa'i tshe nyan te de ste chos na spro bar bya /
analyzed: 'chad pa'i tshe nyan te de ste chos na spro bar bya /
translated: When listening to the teaching, if it is the Dharma, one should be delighted.

original: chos 'chad pa'i tshe gzhung bzhin du ma nor bar bzang zhing gsal bar 'chad na de la yi rang bar bya ste bstod la spro bar bya'o ;
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i tshe gzhung bzhin du ma nor bar bzang zhing gsal bar 'chad na de la yi rang bar bya ste bstod la spro bar bya'o ;
translated: When teaching the Dharma, if one teaches well and clearly, without error, in accordance with the scriptures, one should rejoice in that and praise it to encourage them.

original: /'on te ma yin na bzlog / chos 'chad pa des 'khrul cing log par bshad dam chos ma yin pa zhig smra na dgag cing bzlog go //
analyzed: /'on te ma yin na bzlog / chos 'chad pa des 'khrul cing log par bshad dam chos ma yin pa zhig smra na dgag cing bzlog go //
translated: If the Dharma teacher makes mistakes or explains things incorrectly or speaks of things that are not Dharma, then stop and correct him.

original: khyim pa der 'ongs na chos kyi gtam bya /
analyzed: khyim pa der 'ongs na chos kyi gtam bya /
translated: If a layperson comes there, speak about the Dharma.

original: dus drug gi nub mo chos bsnyad pa'i tshe khyim pa la sogs pa nyan cing bltar 'ongs na chos bsnyad cing bstan to ;
analyzed: dus drug gi nub mo chos bsnyad pa'i tshe khyim pa la sogs pa nyan cing bltar 'ongs na chos bsnyad cing bstan to ;
translated: When you are explaining the Dharma in the evening during the six periods of the day, if laypeople and so forth come to listen and watch, then explain and teach the Dharma to them.

original: / mur 'dug bar du gcod na chad pas rab tu bcad de khros pa dang 'khrugs pas ni mi bstan /
analyzed: / mur 'dug bar du gcod na chad pas rab tu bcad de khros pa dang 'khrugs pas ni mi bstan /
translated: If someone is being obstructive by sitting in the front, punish him severely. Do not teach out of anger or agitation.

original: chos 'chad pa'i tshe mur 'dug pa la sogs pa klan ka tshol zhing rgol na 'thab mo dang brdeg btsog mi bya ba'i 'gab zungs dang ltag chod dang shing log gam tshig thub par ngag gi chad pas bcad de tshig gis thub nas sems grol bar bya'i 'khrugs🔽shing khros par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i tshe mur 'dug pa la sogs pa klan ka tshol zhing rgol na 'thab mo dang brdeg btsog mi bya ba'i 'gab zungs dang ltag chod dang shing log gam tshig thub par ngag gi chad pas bcad de tshig gis thub nas sems grol bar bya'i 'khrugs shing khros par mi bya'o //
translated: When you are explaining the Dharma, if someone is being obstructive by sitting in the front and so forth, looking for something to criticize and arguing, do not fight or beat them. Instead, use the weapon of speech to defeat them. If you defeat them with words, their minds will be liberated. Do not get angry or agitated.

original: 'khor khrid de chad par mi 'gro /
analyzed: 'khor khrid de chad par mi 'gro /
translated: Do not go to punish them with your retinue.

original: chos 'chad pa'i 'phro las gnas brtan gyis bdag gi slob ma khrid de gud du mi 'gro ba la'ang bya /🔽chos 'chad pa'i tshe mnyan cing 'khod pa las kha drangs te gud @223a * //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i 'phro las gnas brtan gyis bdag gi slob ma khrid de gud du mi 'gro ba la'ang bya / chos 'chad pa'i tshe mnyan cing 'khod pa las kha drangs te gud @223a * //
translated: It is also to be applied to the case of a sthavira who does not take his disciples elsewhere while in the midst of teaching the Dharma.

original: du khud par grva btsugs shang mi bshad pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: du khud par grva btsugs shang mi bshad pa la'ang bya /
translated: It is also to be applied to the case of a sthavira who does not explain the Dharma to those who have come to listen to the Dharma, but who instead leads them elsewhere.🔽If the sthavira wishes to do that, he should admit them to the Dharma.

original: de nyid 'dod na chos kyi sgor gzhug / gnas brtan don yod de gud du song ba las slob ma chos nyan cing 'khod pa bdag gi phyi bzhin 'ongs na ma 'ong bar khyed cig ces chos nyan du gzud pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: de nyid 'dod na chos kyi sgor gzhug / gnas brtan don yod de gud du song ba las slob ma chos nyan cing 'khod pa bdag gi phyi bzhin 'ongs na ma 'ong bar khyed cig ces chos nyan du gzud pa la'ang bya /
translated: It is also to be applied to the case of a sthavira who, having gone elsewhere, tells his disciples who are listening to the Dharma, “Do not come after me,” and thus prevents them from listening to the Dharma.

original: kho chos mi 'dod pa la nan gyis mi bshad /
analyzed: kho chos mi 'dod pa la nan gyis mi bshad /
translated: If they do not want the Dharma, he should not explain it to them.

original: chos mi btsun par 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad du gsol na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos mi btsun par 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad du gsol na bshad par bya'o //
translated: If they request him to explain it, he should explain it, because it would be disrespectful not to.🔽He should enter into the Dharma with respect, with a humble mind.

original: bsti stang dang bcas bdag po dang bcas dma' ba'i sems kyis 'jug / chos 'chad pa'i mkhan po des kyang nga rgyal mi bya ba'i bdag gi bla na /
analyzed: bsti stang dang bcas bdag po dang bcas dma' ba'i sems kyis 'jug / chos 'chad pa'i mkhan po des kyang nga rgyal mi bya ba'i bdag gi bla na /
translated: The teacher who explains the Dharma should not be proud, but should think, “My teacher is above me.”

original: sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa'i chos kyi bdag po bzhugs te de ni mchod cing ba sti stang bya ba'i gnas yin gyi bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi bran yin pa snyam du bsams te nga bcag pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa'i chos kyi bdag po bzhugs te de ni mchod cing ba sti stang bya ba'i gnas yin gyi bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi bran yin pa snyam du bsams te nga bcag pa la'ang bya /
translated: Even if you are beaten,

original: chos nyan pa rnams kyis kyang chos 'chad pa la chos kyi bdag po ston pa yin pa'i phyir bsti stang dang rim gror byas te gus par bya /
analyzed: chos nyan pa rnams kyis kyang chos 'chad pa la chos kyi bdag po ston pa yin pa'i phyir bsti stang dang rim gror byas te gus par bya /
translated: Those who listen to the Dharma should respect the Dharma teacher, since he is the one who reveals the Dharma.

original: nan tan du bshad /
analyzed: nan tan du bshad /
translated: Explain with perseverance.

original: chos 'chad pas bshad pa'i tshe le lo mi bya'i gzhung bzhin du ma 'khrul bar nan tan du sems rtse gcig tu bsdus te chos bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'chad pas bshad pa'i tshe le lo mi bya'i gzhung bzhin du ma 'khrul bar nan tan du sems rtse gcig tu bsdus te chos bshad do //
translated: When you explain the Dharma, do not be lazy. Explain the Dharma with a concentrated mind, without error, and in accordance with the scriptures.

original: chos la bsti stang dang bcas te bstan par ro //
analyzed: chos la bsti stang dang bcas te bstan par ro //
translated: Explain the Dharma with respect for the Dharma.

original: chos 'chad pa'ang des chos btsun zhing lci bar bsti stang skyed cing tshig drag dal ma khyer bar bstan par bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'ang des chos btsun zhing lci bar bsti stang skyed cing tshig drag dal ma khyer bar bstan par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the Dharma teacher should generate respect for the Dharma, which makes the Dharma seem noble and weighty, and should explain the Dharma without being carried away by strong or slow speech.

original: yid mi g-yeng /
analyzed: yid mi g-yeng /
translated: Do not be distracted.

original: chos 'chad pa des 'chad pa'i tshe na sha chang dang gser dngul dang nor rdzas dang sngon khyim pa'i spyod pa la sems ma bros par bsdus te bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa des 'chad pa'i tshe na sha chang dang gser dngul dang nor rdzas dang sngon khyim pa'i spyod pa la sems ma bros par bsdus te bshad do //
translated: When the Dharma is being taught, the teacher should not be distracted by thoughts of meat, alcohol, gold, silver, wealth, or his former life as a layman.

original: rigs la grol ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: rigs la grol ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: He should teach with words that are appropriate to the family of the listener.

original: chos 'chad pa'i tshe tshig mgo mjug med par 'dres par rkyang bar mi bshad kyi tshigs su chod cing bye brag phyed par gsal por bshad do //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i tshe tshig mgo mjug med par 'dres par rkyang bar mi bshad kyi tshigs su chod cing bye brag phyed par gsal por bshad do //
translated: When the Dharma is being taught, the teacher should not speak in a confused way, with the beginning and end of his sentences mixed up. He should teach clearly, in verse, and with distinctions.

original: thod rgal du ma yin chos 'chad pas gzhung gcig ma rdzogs par rked nas bcad de gzhung gzhan gyi mgo nas bzung ste mi bshad /
analyzed: thod rgal du ma yin chos 'chad pas gzhung gcig ma rdzogs par rked nas bcad de gzhung gzhan gyi mgo nas bzung ste mi bshad /
translated: He should not teach by skipping around. When the Dharma is being taught, the teacher should not leave off teaching a text in the middle and then start teaching another text.

original: rgyud 'byor ba /
analyzed: rgyud 'byor ba /
translated: He should teach in a way that is appropriate to the listener.

original: thog ma bsod nams bshad de de nas na rag dang mi dge ba bstan /
analyzed: thog ma bsod nams bshad de de nas na rag dang mi dge ba bstan /
