translated: He should teach the results of virtue first, then the results of nonvirtue,

original: de nas las kyi 'bras bu dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rim bzhin bshad do //
analyzed: de nas las kyi 'bras bu dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rim bzhin bshad do //
translated: and then the results of actions and of nirvana in the proper order.

original: byams pa snying rje ba /
analyzed: byams pa snying rje ba /
translated: He should teach with love and compassion.

original: chos 'chad pa'i tshe zhe sdang med par snying rjer byas la khro sems mi bskyed kyi /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i tshe zhe sdang med par snying rjer byas la khro sems mi bskyed kyi /
translated: When he teaches the Dharma, he does so without hatred, with compassion, and without arousing thoughts of anger.

original: byams pa dang snying rje ba'i phyir bla na med par gdon par bsams te bshad do //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje ba'i phyir bla na med par gdon par bsams te bshad do //
translated: He teaches with the intention of attaining the unexcelled, out of love and compassion.

original: @223b zang zing med pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: @223b zang zing med pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: With a mind free of material desire.

original: chos bshad pa'ang bkur sti dang khe dang nor rdzas la sogs pa 'dod pa'i phyir zang zing yod pa'i sems kyis chos mi bshad pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: chos bshad pa'ang bkur sti dang khe dang nor rdzas la sogs pa 'dod pa'i phyir zang zing yod pa'i sems kyis chos mi bshad pa la'ang bya /
translated: He also teaches the Dharma with a mind free of material desire, not desiring honor, gain, wealth, or possessions.

original: dga' sred mgu bar bya /
analyzed: dga' sred mgu bar bya /
translated: He should delight, gladden, and satisfy them.

original: chos mnyan pas kyang chos 'chad pa la sems dang zhing dga' bar bya ba dang bshad pa 'dis mi chog gi mang du mnyan cing bslab pa'i phyir sred par bya ba dang bshad pa'i chos la rjes su yi rangs shing mgu bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos mnyan pas kyang chos 'chad pa la sems dang zhing dga' bar bya ba dang bshad pa 'dis mi chog gi mang du mnyan cing bslab pa'i phyir sred par bya ba dang bshad pa'i chos la rjes su yi rangs shing mgu bar bya'o //
translated: The listener should also delight in the Dharma teacher, with a mind free of distraction, and should seek to hear much, in order to learn. He should be satisfied and delighted with the Dharma that is taught.

original: ma zin kyang don gyi dbang gis na mi bsdad /
analyzed: ma zin kyang don gyi dbang gis na mi bsdad /
translated: Even if he is not satisfied, he should not leave because of the meaning.

original: chos 'chad pa'i tshe na tshig brjed dam glo'am lud pa lta bu langs nas bsams shing bltas te bsdad la bshad pa la bya /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i tshe na tshig brjed dam glo'am lud pa lta bu langs nas bsams shing bltas te bsdad la bshad pa la bya /
translated: When you are teaching the Dharma, it is permissible to stop and think about what to say if you forget the words or become tongue-tied.

original: chos 'chad pa'i rgyud ma rdzogs par rjes ma 'ongs na 'jug rdzogs kyi bar du rjes ma sdod du gzhug pa la bya /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i rgyud ma rdzogs par rjes ma 'ongs na 'jug rdzogs kyi bar du rjes ma sdod du gzhug pa la bya /
translated: It is permissible to make your student wait until you have finished what you are doing if he or she comes to see you before you have finished teaching the Dharma.

original: dbyangs kyis chos bshad /
analyzed: dbyangs kyis chos bshad /
translated: It is permissible to teach the Dharma in song.

original: chos bshad pa la sems skye zhing dga' bar gyur na dbyangs snyan pas chos bshad kyang nyes med /🔽langs nas bye brag tu bya /
analyzed: chos bshad pa la sems skye zhing dga' bar gyur na dbyangs snyan pas chos bshad kyang nyes med / langs nas bye brag tu bya /
translated: It is permissible to teach the Dharma in a melodious way if you are teaching the Dharma and your mind is happy and joyful.🔽It is permissible to teach the Dharma while standing up if you are teaching the Dharma and you need to do something else.

original: chos 'chad 'chad pa las zin te 'gro khar chos 'dri ba zhig 'ongs nas 'greng bzhin du chos bshad kyang nyes med pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: chos 'chad 'chad pa las zin te 'gro khar chos 'dri ba zhig 'ongs nas 'greng bzhin du chos bshad kyang nyes med pa la'ang bya /
translated: It is permissible to teach the Dharma while standing if someone comes to ask you about the Dharma when you are about to leave after teaching the Dharma.

original: drangs te don gtam du'o //
analyzed: drangs te don gtam du'o //
translated: It is permissible to discuss the meaning of the Dharma.

original: gzhung bsdus te 'chad na'ang tshig 'byor par bshad pa la'ang bya //
analyzed: gzhung bsdus te 'chad na'ang tshig 'byor par bshad pa la'ang bya //
translated: It is permissible to teach the Dharma in a concise way if you are teaching the Dharma and you are tired.

original: dbyangs dang tshig la don ci lta bu zhes 'dri na de'i don bshad pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: dbyangs dang tshig la don ci lta bu zhes 'dri na de'i don bshad pa la'ang bya /
translated: It is permissible to explain the meaning of the Dharma if someone asks you what the meaning of a certain word or phrase is.

original: dbye zhing sbyar /
analyzed: dbye zhing sbyar /
translated: It is permissible to analyze the Dharma and apply it.

original: chos bshad pa des gzhung 'di ltar drangs na 'di dang mthun no //
analyzed: chos bshad pa des gzhung 'di ltar drangs na 'di dang mthun no //
translated: When explaining the doctrine, one should also explain that if a text is cited in this way, it is in accord with this or that text.

original: 'di dang mi mthun no zhes bshad pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: 'di dang mi mthun no zhes bshad pa la'ang bya /
translated: And if it is not in accord with this or that text, one should also explain that.

original: gzhung gi nang du la las rang bzo bcug pa zhig yod na 'di tshig de phyung ste gzhung bzhin bshad cing bstan pa la'ang bya'o //🔽dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis nyi ma bgrang /
analyzed: gzhung gi nang du la las rang bzo bcug pa zhig yod na 'di tshig de phyung ste gzhung bzhin bshad cing bstan pa la'ang bya'o // dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis nyi ma bgrang /
translated: If there is something in the text that someone has inserted on their own, one should also explain and teach that it should be removed and the text explained in accordance with the scriptures.🔽The elder of the saṅgha should count the days.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zhag dang nyi ma bgrangs te tshes grangs bzung /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zhag dang nyi ma bgrangs te tshes grangs bzung /
translated: The elder of the saṅgha should count the days and the sun and take note of the date.

original: skud pas brgyus pa'i shing bran gyis spo zhing ngo //
analyzed: skud pas brgyus pa'i shing bran gyis spo zhing ngo //
translated: He should move the stick with the string.

original: tshes grangs gzung ba'i thabs ni skud pa las shing bu bco lnga brgyus la tshes grangs kyi ming so sor bris te shing spu gu can gcig gis bar gcad byas la zhag gcig lon zhing spu gu can gyi nang nas shing bu gcig drang /
analyzed: tshes grangs gzung ba'i thabs ni skud pa las shing bu bco lnga brgyus la tshes grangs kyi ming so sor bris te shing spu gu can gcig gis bar gcad byas la zhag gcig lon zhing spu gu can gyi nang nas shing bu gcig drang /
translated: The method of taking note of the date is as follows: Fifteen sticks are strung on a string. The names of the dates are written on each stick. One stick with a tuft is placed in between. When one day has passed, one stick is drawn from inside the stick with the tuft.

original: gtsug lag khang skyong gis der 'ongs shing dge 'dun la zhu /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang skyong gis der 'ongs shing dge 'dun la zhu /
translated: The caretaker of the temple should come there and request the saṅgha.

original: gtsug lag khang skyong gis dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan la tshes grangs dris la dge brtags kyi tshes grangs 'di 'das so zhes dge 'dun @224a * //🔽la smra / bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang skyong gis dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan la tshes grangs dris la dge brtags kyi tshes grangs 'di 'das so zhes dge 'dun @224a * // la smra / bye brag gis so //
translated: The caretaker monk asks the elder of the saṃgha about the date and tells the saṃgha, “This is the date for the poṣadha.”

original: gnas brtan gyis tshes grangs ma 'khrul bar bya zhing tshes grangs kyi ming dang zla ba gyen thur bye brag phyed par bya /
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis tshes grangs ma 'khrul bar bya zhing tshes grangs kyi ming dang zla ba gyen thur bye brag phyed par bya /
translated: In particular, the elder monk should not be confused about the date, and he should distinguish the waxing and waning of the moon.

original: zla ba phyed tha dad du'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed tha dad du'o //
translated: The waxing and waning of the moon are different.

original: tshes grangs smos pa'i tshe zla ba yar gyi zhag 'di 'das so zhes bya ba dang / zla ba mar gyi zhag 'di 'das so zhes bya ba ma 'khrul bar bya /
analyzed: tshes grangs smos pa'i tshe zla ba yar gyi zhag 'di 'das so zhes bya ba dang / zla ba mar gyi zhag 'di 'das so zhes bya ba ma 'khrul bar bya /
translated: When stating the date, he should not be confused, saying, “This is the waning day of the waxing moon” or “This is the waning day of the waning moon.”

original: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig ces dge slong la bsgo ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig ces dge slong la bsgo ba'i tshig go //
translated: He should recite the verse for the sake of the caretaker of the monastery and the gods. This is the statement to the monk.

original: dge brtags klog pa'i tshe gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig ces kyang smra ste smra ba'i tshig nyid 'og nas zhib tu 'chad /🔽de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: dge brtags klog pa'i tshe gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig ces kyang smra ste smra ba'i tshig nyid 'og nas zhib tu 'chad / de ma thag tu'o //
translated: The words of this recitation will be explained in detail below.

original: dge brtags klog pas mdo ltag ma skad du smras pa dang / dge 'dun rnams kyis kyang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bklag go //
analyzed: dge brtags klog pas mdo ltag ma skad du smras pa dang / dge 'dun rnams kyis kyang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bklag go //
translated: When the Pratimokṣa is recited, one should recite a verse in the vernacular, and the Saṅgha should also recite two verses.

original: der yang zla ba phyed kyi tshes gcig ste gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang gtsug lag khang gi lha rnams kyi phyir tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig ces so //
analyzed: der yang zla ba phyed kyi tshes gcig ste gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang gtsug lag khang gi lha rnams kyi phyir tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig ces so //
translated: There, on the first day of the fortnight, one should recite a verse for the sake of the master of the monastery and the gods of the monastery.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig pa'i tshig ni tshes gcig gam gnyis kyang rung 'das pa yin te gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa tshig 'di go rims bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhogs shig pa'i tshig ni tshes gcig gam gnyis kyang rung 'das pa yin te gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa tshig 'di go rims bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The words of the verse for the sake of the master of the monastery and the gods should be recited on the first or second day, and the verse for the sake of the master of the monastery and the gods should be recited in order.

original: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po spyan 'dren pa'i tshig kyang ste 'di zhes bya ba'i sbyin bdag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun mchod par spyan 'dren gyi de la btsun pa rnams kyis dge ba'i yid kyis thugs rjes gzigs shig ces so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po spyan 'dren pa'i tshig kyang ste 'di zhes bya ba'i sbyin bdag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun mchod par spyan 'dren gyi de la btsun pa rnams kyis dge ba'i yid kyis thugs rjes gzigs shig ces so //
translated: Please look upon him with a virtuous mind and compassion, Venerable Ones.🔽As in the previous sūtra, say according to the donor's request, The donor invites you to a meal tomorrow. Please come with compassion.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar smras pa'i rjes bzhin du yon bdag su yin pas sang bshos la spyan 'dren gyi dge 'dun gyis thugs rjes dgos shig ces mdo 'di'i tshig bzhin du smras zhag nyung ba yang gzhug / gso sbyong bya ba ni zla ba zhag ma tshang ba'i
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar smras pa'i rjes bzhin du yon bdag su yin pas sang bshos la spyan 'dren gyi dge 'dun gyis thugs rjes dgos shig ces mdo 'di'i tshig bzhin du smras zhag nyung ba yang gzhug / gso sbyong bya ba ni zla ba zhag ma tshang ba'i
translated: If the number of days is less, add:

original: rnams la tshes bcu bzhi zhing bya'o //
analyzed: rnams la tshes bcu bzhi zhing bya'o //
translated: The Poṣadha ceremony should be performed on the fourteenth day of the incomplete months.

original: tshes bcu bzhi zhing bya ba'i zla ba ni dpyid zla 'bring po dang dbyar zla ra ba dang dbyar zla tha chungs dang ston zla 'bring po dang dgun zla ra ba dang dgun zla tha chungs drug shi ba'i tshes bcu bzhi'i gso sbyong du bya'o //
analyzed: tshes bcu bzhi zhing bya ba'i zla ba ni dpyid zla 'bring po dang dbyar zla ra ba dang dbyar zla tha chungs dang ston zla 'bring po dang dgun zla ra ba dang dgun zla tha chungs drug shi ba'i tshes bcu bzhi'i gso sbyong du bya'o //
translated: The fourteenth day of the month is the confession day of the six months: the middle month of spring, the first month of summer, the last month of summer, the middle month of autumn, the first month of winter, and the last month of winter.🔽The confession day of the fifteenth day of the month is for the remaining six months.🔽If the confession day falls on the fifteenth day of the month, it is not possible to do it on the fourteenth day, so the confession day should be done on the fifteenth day of the six months mentioned above.

original: zla ba phyed las 'das pa'i dus la zhag bco lngar mi thub ste bcu bzhi la gso sbyong bya ba ni zla ba drug gong du smos pa yin gyi gzhan thams cad ni bco lnga'i gso sbyong du bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed las 'das pa'i dus la zhag bco lngar mi thub ste bcu bzhi la gso sbyong bya ba ni zla ba drug gong du smos pa yin gyi gzhan thams cad ni bco lnga'i gso sbyong du bya'o //
translated: The confession day should be done on the fifteenth day of the other six months.🔽If the king changes the month, the monks should follow the king.🔽If the king changes the month, the monks should follow the king.🔽If the king changes the month, the monks should follow the king.🔽If the king changes the month, the monks should follow the king.

analyzed: zla ba lhag pa'ang bya ste rgyal po'i @224b rjes su 'jug / rgyal pos zla ba shol 'dums shig tu bsgyur ba brtsis na'ang dge slong gis zhag grangs brtsis pa mi brtsan gyi rgyal pos brtsis pa bzhin du gso sbyong bya /🔽skar mkhan gyi phyir 'jug cing skar ma'i rgyud kyi rjes su yang ngo //

original: skar mkhan gyis brtsis te shol 'dums yod pa zhig tu gyur na skar mkhan gyis brtsis bzhin du tshes grangs brtsi zhing gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: skar mkhan gyis brtsis te shol 'dums yod pa zhig tu gyur na skar mkhan gyis brtsis bzhin du tshes grangs brtsi zhing gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: If the astrologer calculates that there is a day to be skipped, the monks should count the day and perform the poṣadha according to the astrologer’s calculation.

original: tshes grangs brtsi ba'i phyir dge slong gis skar ma'i rgyud bslabs kyang nyes med pa'ang bya'o //🔽ma brtags gso sbyong gi bar du ma bsdad par stong pa zhes mtshams mi bcing /
analyzed: tshes grangs brtsi ba'i phyir dge slong gis skar ma'i rgyud bslabs kyang nyes med pa'ang bya'o // ma brtags gso sbyong gi bar du ma bsdad par stong pa zhes mtshams mi bcing /
translated: If a monk studies astrology in order to count the days, there is no offense.🔽If the monks do not wait until the day of the poṣadha to determine whether the boundaries are intact, they should not establish the boundaries.🔽If the monks do not know whether or not there are resident monks in an empty temple, they should not establish the boundaries in order to live there.

original: lha khang stong pa dge slong gnas sam mi gnas gtol med par bdag cag gnas par bya ba'i phyir mtshams mi bcad gtsug lag khang stong pa der dge slong gnas sam mi gnas brtags pa ni gso sbyong gi zhag dus kyi bar du bsdad de ma 'ongs na🔽mtshams bcad kyang nyes med /
analyzed: lha khang stong pa dge slong gnas sam mi gnas gtol med par bdag cag gnas par bya ba'i phyir mtshams mi bcad gtsug lag khang stong pa der dge slong gnas sam mi gnas brtags pa ni gso sbyong gi zhag dus kyi bar du bsdad de ma 'ongs na mtshams bcad kyang nyes med /
translated: If the monks wait until the day of the poṣadha to determine whether or not there are resident monks in an empty temple, there is no offense in establishing the boundaries.

original: gso sbyong bar du ma bsdad par mtshams bcad na nyes byas /
analyzed: gso sbyong bar du ma bsdad par mtshams bcad na nyes byas /
translated: If the monks establish the boundaries without waiting until the day of the poṣadha, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yan lag ma yin pa ni ma skyes par shes pa'i bcad pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag ma yin pa ni ma skyes par shes pa'i bcad pa'o //
translated: The branches are not established if it is known that the monks will not arrive.

original: gtsug lag khang gi mtshams sngar bcad zin la mtshams bcad dam ma bcad gtol med de mi shes kyang rung bcad par shes bzhin du yang rung ste mtshams sngags kyis ma bkrol lam zhig pa ma yin na phyis bcad kyang mtshams bcad par mi 'gyur ba'i steng du
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi mtshams sngar bcad zin la mtshams bcad dam ma bcad gtol med de mi shes kyang rung bcad par shes bzhin du yang rung ste mtshams sngags kyis ma bkrol lam zhig pa ma yin na phyis bcad kyang mtshams bcad par mi 'gyur ba'i steng du
translated: Even if it is known that it has been established, if the boundary is not released by the boundary mantra or destroyed, it will not be established again later.

original: nyes byas kyang yod do //
analyzed: nyes byas kyang yod do //
translated: Moreover, there is also an offense.

original: de med na yang btang ba'o //
analyzed: de med na yang btang ba'o //
translated: If that is not the case, it is released.

original: mtshams sngags kyis bkrol ba dang / dge slong kun gud du dong ste zhag lon pa dang dge slong pha kun mo mtshan du gyur ba dang / dge slong kun shi ste lha khang stong par gyur pa dang / dge slong kun khrims phul ba dang /
analyzed: mtshams sngags kyis bkrol ba dang / dge slong kun gud du dong ste zhag lon pa dang dge slong pha kun mo mtshan du gyur ba dang / dge slong kun shi ste lha khang stong par gyur pa dang / dge slong kun khrims phul ba dang /
translated: If the boundary is released by the boundary mantra, if all the monks go elsewhere and a day passes, if all the monks become nuns, if all the monks die and the temple becomes empty, if all the monks relinquish their vows,

original: dge slong kun mtshams med pa dang / phas pham par gyur pa dang // dge slong kun mur 'dug tu zhugs pa dang / rnam pa 'di bdun lta bu zhig tu gyur na mtshams zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong kun mtshams med pa dang / phas pham par gyur pa dang // dge slong kun mur 'dug tu zhugs pa dang / rnam pa 'di bdun lta bu zhig tu gyur na mtshams zhig pa yin no //
translated: if all the monks commit heinous acts or are defeated, if all the monks enter the state of an arhat, if any of these seven conditions occur, the boundary is destroyed.

original: brtags pa'i gnas kyang ngo //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gnas kyang ngo //
translated: The place is also examined.

original: tshang mang du bsngos te gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byas pa'ang gong ma'i rnam pa bdun du smos ba gang yang rung /
analyzed: tshang mang du bsngos te gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byas pa'ang gong ma'i rnam pa bdun du smos ba gang yang rung /
translated: If the proclamation and the request are done in the kitchen, then the action of the proclamation and the request is the seventh of the above.

original: gcig ltar gyur na gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las zhig pa yin te phyis bya dgos so //
analyzed: gcig ltar gyur na gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las zhig pa yin te phyis bya dgos so //
translated: If it is done in one way, then the action of the proclamation and the request is finished, and it must be done later.

original: ma brtags pa ni mtshams la mtshams bskor ba'o //🔽mtshams sngar bcad zin pa la phyis mtshams @225a * //
analyzed: ma brtags pa ni mtshams la mtshams bskor ba'o // mtshams sngar bcad zin pa la phyis mtshams @225a * //
translated: The unexamined is the circumambulation of the boundary.

original: bcad kyang mtshams mi chags so //
analyzed: bcad kyang mtshams mi chags so //
translated: If the boundary is previously cut, then later the boundary is not cut.

original: brtags pa ni 'khor dang dge slong ma'i dbyar mo thang dang khron pa yang ngo //
analyzed: brtags pa ni 'khor dang dge slong ma'i dbyar mo thang dang khron pa yang ngo //
translated: The examined is the boundary of the retinue, the boundary of the nuns, the boundary of the rainy season, and the boundary of the well.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol kyang rung mtshams snga ma bcad pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol kyang rung mtshams snga ma bcad pa'ang rung ste /
translated: It is also suitable to be outside the boundary, or it is suitable to be in the previous boundary.

original: 'phral la sogs pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis mtshams bu chung du bcad la gso sbyong byas na'ang rung mtshams bu chung ma byas kyang rung /
analyzed: 'phral la sogs pa dang zhu ba'i las kyis mtshams bu chung du bcad la gso sbyong byas na'ang rung mtshams bu chung ma byas kyang rung /
translated: If the boundary is cut with the action of the proclamation and the request, it is suitable to do the poṣadha. If the small boundary is not made, it is also suitable.

original: dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang du 'dong ste dad pa dris la gso sbyong byas kyang rung /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang du 'dong ste dad pa dris la gso sbyong byas kyang rung /
translated: If one goes to the nunnery, asks about the faith, and performs the poṣadha, that is also suitable.

original: shing gcig 'dug pa'i mtshams kyis du ma bzhi'i mtshams so //
analyzed: shing gcig 'dug pa'i mtshams kyis du ma bzhi'i mtshams so //
translated: The boundary of the four directions of a single tree is the boundary of a single tree.

original: mtshams gnyis gsum zhig so sor gcod de kun gyi bar na shing ngam rdo zhig yod na mtshams de kun gyi mtshams shing ngam rdo de gcig pu la gzugs su rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams gnyis gsum zhig so sor gcod de kun gyi bar na shing ngam rdo zhig yod na mtshams de kun gyi mtshams shing ngam rdo de gcig pu la gzugs su rung ngo //
translated: Two or three boundaries are cut separately. If there is a tree or stone between all of them, that boundary tree or stone is suitable for all of them.

original: brtan pa de mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: brtan pa de mtshan ma'o //
translated: That stability is the sign.

original: mtshams kyi mtshan ma gzugs pa ni brag gam pha bong ngam zhing lta bu brtan pa las gzugs so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi mtshan ma gzugs pa ni brag gam pha bong ngam zhing lta bu brtan pa las gzugs so //
translated: The sign of the boundary is made from a stable rock, boulder, or field.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa ma yin pa ni 'phrul dang sgyu mas byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa ma yin pa ni 'phrul dang sgyu mas byas pa'o //
translated: It is not like this: it is made by magic and deception.

original: mtshams kyi mtshan ma mi brtan pa sprin nam /
analyzed: mtshams kyi mtshan ma mi brtan pa sprin nam /
translated: The unstable sign of the boundary is like a cloud,

original: na bun nam /
analyzed: na bun nam /
translated: mist,

original: sgyu mar sprul cing 'dug pa lta bu la mtshan mar mi gzugs /
analyzed: sgyu mar sprul cing 'dug pa lta bu la mtshan mar mi gzugs /
translated: or an emanation conjured up and sitting there.

original: mi brtan pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od la sogs pa'i rlabs so //
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od la sogs pa'i rlabs so //
translated: The unstable waves of the moon, sun, and so on are not suitable as signs.

original: mtshams kyi mtshan ma zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od zer dang grib ma lta bu dang chu'i rlabs skyed 'brir 'gyur ba la mtshan ma mi gzugs /
analyzed: mtshams kyi mtshan ma zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od zer dang grib ma lta bu dang chu'i rlabs skyed 'brir 'gyur ba la mtshan ma mi gzugs /
translated: The boundary sign is like the light and shadow of the moon and sun, or like the waves of water.

original: mtshams kyi chu ni mtshams gzhan dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi chu ni mtshams gzhan dang 'dra'o //
translated: The water of the boundary is like the other boundaries.

original: rdza ma dang zangs kyi nang du chu blugs la de'i nang du chos gos bcug la chos gos de snod la ma reg par skya rengs byung na'ang bral ba'i ltung ba la'ang bya /
analyzed: rdza ma dang zangs kyi nang du chu blugs la de'i nang du chos gos bcug la chos gos de snod la ma reg par skya rengs byung na'ang bral ba'i ltung ba la'ang bya /
translated: If water is poured into a pot or a copper vessel and the Dharma robe is put into it, and if that Dharma robe is not in contact with the vessel, even if the dawn appears, it is also a downfall of separation.

original: mtshams bcad pa'i nang du chu 'bab cing skam pa zhig yod na'ang 'bab pa'i tshe ni chu phan chad mtshams gcig tu mi rung skam pa'i tshe ni mtshams su rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa'i nang du chu 'bab cing skam pa zhig yod na'ang 'bab pa'i tshe ni chu phan chad mtshams gcig tu mi rung skam pa'i tshe ni mtshams su rung ngo //
translated: If a river flows and dries up within the boundary that has been delimited, when it is flowing, it is not suitable as one boundary beyond the water. When it is dry, it is suitable as a boundary.

original: bar chad na gcig tu med do //
analyzed: bar chad na gcig tu med do //
translated: If it is interrupted, it is not one.

original: mtshams bcad nas mtshams kyi nad du chu 'bab na mtshams bcad pas brtsir mi rung ste chus mtshams su bzung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams bcad nas mtshams kyi nad du chu 'bab na mtshams bcad pas brtsir mi rung ste chus mtshams su bzung ngo //
translated: If a river flows into the boundary after the boundary has been delimited, it is not suitable as a boundary due to the delimitation. The boundary is held by the water.

original: de ste zam pa brtan na ni yul bzhin no //
analyzed: de ste zam pa brtan na ni yul bzhin no //
translated: If the bridge is stable, it is like the country.

original: chu de la zam pa bzang po zhig yod na ni chus chod kyang mtshams gcig pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chu de la zam pa bzang po zhig yod na ni chus chod kyang mtshams gcig pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: If there is a good bridge over the water, then even though the water is a barrier, it is as if there were no barrier.

original: zhig pa las slar byas na rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhig pa las slar byas na rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: If one repairs it after it has been destroyed, it is permissible.

original: chu la zam pa yod pa de zhig ste slar bcos par bsams na zam pa ma thogs kyi bar du zhag gis chod kyang zhig par mi 'gyur te chos gos dang @225b bral bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chu la zam pa yod pa de zhig ste slar bcos par bsams na zam pa ma thogs kyi bar du zhag gis chod kyang zhig par mi 'gyur te chos gos dang @225b bral bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: If one thinks, “I will destroy the bridge over the water and repair it,” then even though the water is a barrier, it is not destroyed, and one does not become separated from one’s robes.

original: sbyor bam btang na yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyor bam btang na yang ngo //
translated: If one gives up the preparation, it is also permissible.

original: zam pa bcos par bsams na zhag gis chod kyang rung ba ni zam pa zhig nas mkhar lan mgo zugs te rtsom bzhin na rung gi mkhar lan ma zugs la phyis bcos bar sems pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: zam pa bcos par bsams na zhag gis chod kyang rung ba ni zam pa zhig nas mkhar lan mgo zugs te rtsom bzhin na rung gi mkhar lan ma zugs la phyis bcos bar sems pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If one thinks, “I will repair the bridge,” it is permissible even if one is separated by a night. But if one thinks, “I will destroy the bridge and then repair it,” it is not permissible.

original: zhag bdun las 'das na ma yin no //
analyzed: zhag bdun las 'das na ma yin no //
translated: If one is separated by more than seven days, it is not permissible.

original: bcos par bsams na rung ba ni zhag bdun tshun chad rung gi zhag bdun las 'das na bcos par bsams shing mkhar lan mgo zugs gcig gis rgyun ma chad par byas kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bcos par bsams na rung ba ni zhag bdun tshun chad rung gi zhag bdun las 'das na bcos par bsams shing mkhar lan mgo zugs gcig gis rgyun ma chad par byas kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is suitable to be repaired, it is suitable for up to seven days. If more than seven days have passed, even if it is intended to be repaired and the mending is done without interruption, it is not suitable.

original: nam mkha'i na bar chad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i na bar chad du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be an obstacle in the sky.

original: mtshams kyi mtshan ma nam mkha' la mi rung ste nam mkha' la mtshams kyi mtshan ma btsugs kyang mi chud do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi mtshan ma nam mkha' la mi rung ste nam mkha' la mtshams kyi mtshan ma btsugs kyang mi chud do //
translated: The boundary sign in the sky is not suitable. Even if the boundary sign is erected in the sky, it is not included.

original: 'di yod kyang mi spyod pa ma chod pa lta ga la zhig / nam mkha' yod du zin kyang gzung zhing bsngor med na mtshams kyi mtshan ma ci las gzung ste ga la rung /
analyzed: 'di yod kyang mi spyod pa ma chod pa lta ga la zhig / nam mkha' yod du zin kyang gzung zhing bsngor med na mtshams kyi mtshan ma ci las gzung ste ga la rung /
translated: How could there be an obstacle even though it exists, but is not used? If, even though the sky exists, it cannot be grasped and defined, from what boundary sign could it be grasped? How could it be suitable?

original: dbus nas dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha'i mtshams las lhag par gcod du mi skye'o //
analyzed: dbus nas dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha'i mtshams las lhag par gcod du mi skye'o //
translated: It does not grow beyond the boundary three and a half yojanas from the center.

original: mtshams bcad pa'i tshad dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad ni bcad du rung gi dpag tshad phyed dang gsum las ring pa phan chad ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i sngags kyis mtshams bcad kyang mtshams ma bcad pa dang 'dra ste sngags kyang mi 'chags mtshams kyang med
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa'i tshad dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad ni bcad du rung gi dpag tshad phyed dang gsum las ring pa phan chad ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i sngags kyis mtshams bcad kyang mtshams ma bcad pa dang 'dra ste sngags kyang mi 'chags mtshams kyang med
translated: The measure of the boundary is that it is suitable to be within one and a half yojanas. Beyond one and a half yojanas, even if the boundary is set with the mantras of request and supplication, it is like not setting the boundary and the mantras are not recited.

original: do // de bzhin du bla dang 'og dang sra ba la bad pa'ang thang bzhin no //
analyzed: do // de bzhin du bla dang 'og dang sra ba la bad pa'ang thang bzhin no //
translated: The boundary is also like that above and below and the hard and the soft.

original: lung pa la sul gcod rong zhig tu mtshams gcod ri gcig nas gcig gi bar nam mkha' la kha drang du mi bcad kyi sa'i gzhi gyen thur ci ltar 'dug pa bzhin du 'dom grangs kyis bcal te dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du bcad do //
analyzed: lung pa la sul gcod rong zhig tu mtshams gcod ri gcig nas gcig gi bar nam mkha' la kha drang du mi bcad kyi sa'i gzhi gyen thur ci ltar 'dug pa bzhin du 'dom grangs kyis bcal te dpag tshad phyed dang gsum du bcad do //
translated: In a valley, the boundary is not set in the sky from one mountain to another. It is set by measuring with cubits according to the slope of the ground, up to one and a half yojanas.

original: mi skye ba ni mi 'bral bar gnang ba las mtshams ma bcad na'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni mi 'bral bar gnang ba las mtshams ma bcad na'o //
translated: Non-arising is not being separated from the permission.

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis mtshams bcad na rgan po dang nad pa las chos gos dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba byin kyang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis mtshams bcad na rgan po dang nad pa las chos gos dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba byin kyang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the boundary is not established by the act of requesting and asking, then even if permission to be separated from the Dharma robes is given to the elderly and the sick, they will be separated from them.

original: bcad pa med na med do //🔽mtshams bcad de chos gso dang mi 'bral bar gnang ba byin pa las mtshams zhig pa rnams ba bdun gang yang rung /
analyzed: bcad pa med na med do // mtshams bcad de chos gso dang mi 'bral bar gnang ba byin pa las mtshams zhig pa rnams ba bdun gang yang rung /
translated: If the boundary is established, then they will not be separated.

original: gcig byung na chos gos dang mi 'bral bar gnang ba byin pa zhig ste bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig byung na chos gos dang mi 'bral bar gnang ba byin pa zhig ste bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the boundary is established and permission is given to be separated from the Dharma robes, then if any of the seven conditions occur, such as the boundary being destroyed, the permission to be separated from the Dharma robes will be given and they will be separated.

original: des na ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not so.

original: dge slong rgan po dang nad pa chos gos dang 'bral bar gnang @226a * //
analyzed: dge slong rgan po dang nad pa chos gos dang 'bral bar gnang @226a * //
translated: The permission to be separated from the Dharma robes given to the elderly and sick monks

original: ba de shi'am khrims phul lam gnang ba slar phrogs kyang mtshams ni zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba de shi'am khrims phul lam gnang ba slar phrogs kyang mtshams ni zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is not destroyed even if they die, return to lay life, or the permission is revoked.

original: mchod rten dang dri gtsang khang gi bar dang gso sbyong gi dngos por gso sbyong gi tshe phyags /
analyzed: mchod rten dang dri gtsang khang gi bar dang gso sbyong gi dngos por gso sbyong gi tshe phyags /
translated: The boundary between the stupa and the fragrant chamber, and the boundary of the poṣadha ceremony, are established by the act of bowing at the time of the poṣadha ceremony.

original: gso sbyong byed pa'i dus su mchod rten dang dri gtsang khang dang gso sbyong byed pa'i sar phyag dar dang mandal dang / chag chag la sogs pa byas te me tog gis brgyan to //
analyzed: gso sbyong byed pa'i dus su mchod rten dang dri gtsang khang dang gso sbyong byed pa'i sar phyag dar dang mandal dang / chag chag la sogs pa byas te me tog gis brgyan to //
translated: One should adorn it with flowers.

original: dad pa byin pa pa ni dge 'dun la byin pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa byin pa pa ni dge 'dun la byin pa'o //
translated: The gift of faith is a gift to the Saṅgha.

original: gso sbyong la 'du ba'i tshe brel tam /
analyzed: gso sbyong la 'du ba'i tshe brel tam /
translated: When one is in a hurry to attend the poṣadha assembly,

original: nan de 'dun la dad pa phul nas 'dus pa dang 'dra ste las su rung ngo //🔽gang sus kyang de'i phyir de zhu bar gyis shig / de mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas na mi sbyin sbyin du mi 'jug / dad pa len pa las bar du chu'am ra bas chod na dad pa blangs par mi chud pa'i phyir bdag gis kyang dad pa🔽mi 'bul ta dad pa len pas kyang 'bul du mi gzhug cing dad pa mi blang /
analyzed: nan de 'dun la dad pa phul nas 'dus pa dang 'dra ste las su rung ngo // gang sus kyang de'i phyir de zhu bar gyis shig / de mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas na mi sbyin sbyin du mi 'jug / dad pa len pa las bar du chu'am ra bas chod na dad pa blangs par mi chud pa'i phyir bdag gis kyang dad pa mi 'bul ta dad pa len pas kyang 'bul du mi gzhug cing dad pa mi blang /
translated: if one offers one’s faith to the Saṅgha, it is as if one has attended the assembly, and one’s action is complete.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.

original: phul kyang dad pa phul bar mi chud /
analyzed: phul kyang dad pa phul bar mi chud /
translated: If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.🔽If one is outside the boundary, one should not give or cause to be given.

original: sbyin du mi gzhug / mtshams kyi phyi rol nas bdag gis kyang mi len kho bo sbyin du yang mi gzhug / gcig nas gcig tu ma yin dad pa len du bskos pa'i mi des gzhan la bcol te dad pa len du mi btang /
analyzed: sbyin du mi gzhug / mtshams kyi phyi rol nas bdag gis kyang mi len kho bo sbyin du yang mi gzhug / gcig nas gcig tu ma yin dad pa len du bskos pa'i mi des gzhan la bcol te dad pa len du mi btang /
translated: It is not to be given by one who has been appointed to receive offerings from the faithful to another who has been appointed to receive offerings from the faithful.

original: de ltar byas na dad pa 'bul ba dang dad pa len par bskos pa'i dge slong gnyis nyes byas so //
analyzed: de ltar byas na dad pa 'bul ba dang dad pa len par bskos pa'i dge slong gnyis nyes byas so //
translated: If it is given in this way, both the monk who has been appointed to receive offerings from the faithful and the monk who has been appointed to receive offerings from the faithful will have committed a minor offense.

original: nyes byas pa ni na ba dang dbang med pa dang gsog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyis 'jigs pa las byin na'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni na ba dang dbang med pa dang gsog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyis 'jigs pa las byin na'o //
translated: A minor offense is committed if it is given to one who is sick, to one who is not free, to one who is hoarding, or to one who fears that his celibacy will be interrupted.

original: dad pa len par bskos pa des dad ba blangs nas dge 'dun la dad pa dbul ba bdag nyid kyis ma phul bar mi gzhan la bcol te dbul du bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dad pa len par bskos pa des dad ba blangs nas dge 'dun la dad pa dbul ba bdag nyid kyis ma phul bar mi gzhan la bcol te dbul du bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: If the monk who has been appointed to receive offerings from the faithful, after receiving the offerings from the faithful, does not himself offer the offerings to the Saṅgha, but appoints another person to offer them, he commits a minor offense.

original: dad pa gzhan la dbul du bcug kyang nyes med pa ni srog la dma' ba dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba dang / bdag la dbang med pa med pa'i rkyen cig byung ste gur du 'gro bar 'gyur te rings na grogs gcig la dad pa dbul du bcol kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dad pa gzhan la dbul du bcug kyang nyes med pa ni srog la dma' ba dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba dang / bdag la dbang med pa med pa'i rkyen cig byung ste gur du 'gro bar 'gyur te rings na grogs gcig la dad pa dbul du bcol kyang nyes med do //
translated: It is not a fault if one is not able to do it oneself, but a condition arises that makes it necessary to go to a tent, and if one is in a hurry, one can entrust a companion to offer one's faith.

original: ma gus pas ma zhus na'o //
analyzed: ma gus pas ma zhus na'o //
translated: If one does not ask because of disrespect,

original: dad pa blangs na blangs kyi ma gus pa'i phyir ma phul yang bla zhes bsams te 'dug pa ni dge 'dun gso sbyong gi las ni rung gi dge slong de nyes byas so //
analyzed: dad pa blangs na blangs kyi ma gus pa'i phyir ma phul yang bla zhes bsams te 'dug pa ni dge 'dun gso sbyong gi las ni rung gi dge slong de nyes byas so //
translated: it is thought that if one has taken faith, it is enough to take it, and that it is not necessary to offer it because of disrespect. If one stays like that, the Sangha's poṣadha rite is suitable, but that monk has a duṣkṛta.

original: nyes med pa ni 'dis 'jigs te phyi'i mtshams nas blangs pa'o//
analyzed: nyes med pa ni 'dis 'jigs te phyi'i mtshams nas blangs pa'o//
translated: It is not a fault if one takes it from outside the boundary out of fear of this.

original: @226b dad pas blangs nas 'bul du 'gro ba'i lam na dgra 'am gnod par byed pa zhig yod na mtshams kyi phyi ro la nas bskos te dge 'dun la dad pa phul yang nyes med do //
analyzed: @226b dad pas blangs nas 'bul du 'gro ba'i lam na dgra 'am gnod par byed pa zhig yod na mtshams kyi phyi ro la nas bskos te dge 'dun la dad pa phul yang nyes med do //
translated: If one has taken faith and is going to offer it, but on the way there is an enemy or someone who will harm one, then if one is appointed outside the boundary and offers one's faith to the Sangha, it is not a fault.

original: gtsug lag khang skyong gis gso sbyong gi tshul shing 'drim pa nas dge slong dgongs shig / dge slong grangs mang ste ngos mi tshol na gtsug lag khang skyong gis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shing brim la shing bsdus te tshang ngam ma tshang shing mi bgrang ngo
analyzed: gtsug lag khang skyong gis gso sbyong gi tshul shing 'drim pa nas dge slong dgongs shig / dge slong grangs mang ste ngos mi tshol na gtsug lag khang skyong gis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shing brim la shing bsdus te tshang ngam ma tshang shing mi bgrang ngo
translated: If the number of monks is large and it is difficult to count them, the caretaker of the monastery should distribute the voting sticks for the purification and restoration ceremony. He should not count the sticks to see if the number of monks is complete or not.

original: // rab tu thon pa'i tshig phyed kyang mi 'khrul bar shod cig / gso sbyong byed pa'i tshe so sor thar pa kha don du klog pa ni tshig cung zad kyang mi 'khrul bar klog nus pa gcig gis bklag go //
analyzed: // rab tu thon pa'i tshig phyed kyang mi 'khrul bar shod cig / gso sbyong byed pa'i tshe so sor thar pa kha don du klog pa ni tshig cung zad kyang mi 'khrul bar klog nus pa gcig gis bklag go //
translated: When the purification and restoration ceremony is performed, the recitation of the Pratimoksha should be done by one who is able to recite it without error, even if it is only half a verse.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis so //
translated: The most senior monk of the Sangha should do it.

original: so sor thar pa kha don klog pa bskos pa ni las byed pa dge slong gis gnas brtan gral mthon po na 'dug pa me tog brims te byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: so sor thar pa kha don klog pa bskos pa ni las byed pa dge slong gis gnas brtan gral mthon po na 'dug pa me tog brims te byed du gzhug go //
translated: The one appointed to recite the Pratimoksha should be made to do it by the monk who is the officiant, by scattering flowers on the most senior monk in the row.

original: mi nus na gnyis pos kyang ngo //
analyzed: mi nus na gnyis pos kyang ngo //
translated: If he is unable, then two of them should do it.

original: gral thog ma pas kha ton klog mi nus na de'i 'og nas 'dug pa la me tog byin te byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: gral thog ma pas kha ton klog mi nus na de'i 'og nas 'dug pa la me tog byin te byed du gzhug go //
translated: If the one in the first row is unable to recite the oral transmission, then the flowers should be given to the one sitting below him and he should be made to do it.

original: gsum pos kyang ngo //
analyzed: gsum pos kyang ngo //
translated: If three are unable,

original: des kyang ma nus na gnyis kyi 'og nas dge slong su 'dug pa la me tog byin te klog tu gzhug go //
analyzed: des kyang ma nus na gnyis kyi 'og nas dge slong su 'dug pa la me tog byin te klog tu gzhug go //
translated: then if the one sitting below two bhikṣus is unable, then the flowers should be given to the bhikṣu sitting below him and he should be made to recite it.

original: des kyang na re mor ro //
analyzed: des kyang na re mor ro //
translated: If he also says he is unable,

original: des kyang ma nus na de gsum kha ngon ci shes pa las gcig gi mjug gcig gis mthud de kha don zer du gzhug go //
analyzed: des kyang ma nus na de gsum kha ngon ci shes pa las gcig gi mjug gcig gis mthud de kha don zer du gzhug go //
translated: then if those three are unable to continue the oral transmission with one after another knowing what the other knows, then the flowers should be given to the one sitting below them who knows the oral transmission and he should be made to do it.

original: mi nus na gzhan la bsko //
analyzed: mi nus na gzhan la bsko //
translated: If he is unable, then it should be passed on to another.

original: de gsum gcig gis gcig mthud de byar yang mi nus na 'og na kha thon shes pa su yod pa la me tog byin te byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: de gsum gcig gis gcig mthud de byar yang mi nus na 'og na kha thon shes pa su yod pa la me tog byin te byed du gzhug go //
translated: If those three are unable to continue with one after another, then the flowers should be given to the one sitting below them who knows the oral transmission and he should be made to do it.

original: mi btub na dge 'dun gyis so //
analyzed: mi btub na dge 'dun gyis so //
translated: If he is unable, then the saṃgha should do it.

original: kha thon shes pa de byed du mi btub na dge 'dun kun gyis bskos te byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: kha thon shes pa de byed du mi btub na dge 'dun kun gyis bskos te byed du gzhug go //
translated: If the one who knows the oral transmission is unable to do it, then the entire saṃgha should be appointed to do it.

original: brtag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: brtag pa yang ngo //
translated: The investigation is also like that.

original: so sor thar pa kha thon shes shing tshig mi 'khrul bar mkhas pa zhig yod na rtag tu de so sor thar pa kha thon byed du gzhug go //🔽lus na lhag ma gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: so sor thar pa kha thon shes shing tshig mi 'khrul bar mkhas pa zhig yod na rtag tu de so sor thar pa kha thon byed du gzhug go // lus na lhag ma gzhan gyis so //
translated: If one cannot continue from where one left off, then one should recite it in parts, as much as one can.🔽If one cannot continue from where one left off, then one should recite it in parts, as much as one can.🔽If one cannot continue from where one left off, then one should recite it in parts, as much as one can.🔽If one cannot continue from where one left off, then one should recite it in parts, as much as one can.
